author: {'steamid': '76561198122519096', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1503, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1711226768}
review:
Combat is satisfying and addicting (hack n slash done right). 
Story is engaging and benefits from terrific english voice acting, 
Npc's have good dialogue and motivate you to explore the world to fulfill some of their side quests.
Boss battles are a ton of fun, they arent too easy but also not crazy difficult. They can be pretty difficult later on in the game (i played on normal difficulty) but most of the difficulty can be mitigated by reaching certain levels for your character (Adol) and your gear.
OST as with any ys game is great, although this game may have less notable tracks in the OST compared to other ys games. 
Graphics are dated but fit the game very well and are not an eyesore by any means. 

Amazing game and story. As of this review I have played ys origin, ys 1 and 2, memories of celceta, and now oath in felghana. Oath in felghana is by far my favorite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024706875', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 850, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1710716249}
review:
simple and satisfying combat and progression with no BS, good levels with no annoying parts whatsoever, great bossfights, insane OST. fun experience from start to finish (challenging, too. even on normal difficulty)
the only significant flaws i can think of are:
at least one boss (the segmented lava dragon) being broken if you have more than 60 fps
default controls kinda suck (jumping and charging magic at the same time is not convenient), but you can change them
easiest recommend of my life

author: {'steamid': '76561198012564453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1096, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1710598695}
review:
I think Ys is one of the best action RPG series out there. I played a bit when I was younger, but I truly discovered it in the past years. All games in the series are worth a playthrough and they all have common qualities, although each game feels unique (even if you play the same character -Adol Christin- in most of them!)

Common strengths of the series are: the consistently excellent music; the quick and exciting gameplay, coupled with satisfying level progression; the relatively small scope of each game, especially before the modern party-based entries; the excellent writing and worldbuilding, including an epic story, strong plot twists and a good amount of cheeky humour.

Here's my personal and very subjective list of what to play in the Ys series. Just know that they are all standalone games, and are not published in chronological order of the story.

**MUST-PLAY TIER 
- YS ORIGIN: If you're playing only one, I think it should be this one: as the last game made before modern party-based titles, Origin sits perfectly between Ys eras, and the game itself is set centuries before the rest of the series, offering a good understanding of its foundational lore. It also has 3 interwoven stories that work well together, if you're willing to replay the game.

- YS I & II: The games that started it all! They're not my ultimate pick because of the outdated mechanics and high difficulty limiting their accessibility, but all the strong foundations of the future series are there! All the details I love are already there, like the journal with fun 1-paragraph character descriptions, the weapons and armors grid display, the satisfying progression, the killer soundtrack and so on. 

- YS IV: MEMORIES OF CELCETA: I love Ys IV, its setting and the organic progression of the plot. Compared to "old Ys", this is one of the longer modern party-based entries, where you control more than one character. It is a re-imagining of an older Ys IV from the 90's, and as such it is the technical successor of Ys Seven. 

**SHOULD-PLAY TIER 
- YS VI: ARK OF NAPISHTIM: I was surprised how much I enjoyed Ys 6, as it was released a while ago and is technically weaker than Origin and Oath in Felghana, but it has a very strong setting and story. It's not "must-play" for me because of its somewhat unbalanced progression, some plot holes in an otherwise excellent story, and a bland endgame boss. 

- YS: OATH IN FELGHANA: I don't love this one as much as other people do, but it is a very nice game if you already have love for the series. The unbalanced progression and unfair boss difficulty prevents it from being an instant recommendation for me, but it's also a great reimagining of the old Ys III: Wanderers from Ys on SNES.

- YS SEVEN: I honestly thought I would hate this one, but I was wrong! I love that it comes right after the Ys VI story, including some recurring characters. It is the first of the party-based era of "modern Ys", with somewhat rough but efficient mechanics, and your friend Dogi the wall-breaker as a playable character for the first time! Even with a lot of clichés all around the place, it is still a strong and very satisfying entry.

- Finally, I didn't play VIII or IX yet, but from reviews and my own experience with the series, I'm pretty sure they are very much worthy of your time and money!

author: {'steamid': '76561199202594675', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 357, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1710094435}
review: 高难度的boss战，错综复杂的地图，令人皱眉的跳跃关卡设计，鼓励刷级的等级机制，构成了我心目中最为纯正的一部伊苏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198800719980', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1672493062}
review:
最近游戏荒，玩了下老游戏，把伊苏F打完了。
实际上游戏流程就9个小时左右，其他时间都是以前没玩挂卡的时间。
我个人没玩过伊苏3原版，这个重置版剧情感觉一般，没什么亮点。
这次的故事舞台是在多奇的故乡，阿豆19岁的故事，前面已经经历了伊苏1跟2还有伊苏4树海了，阿豆也变得成熟了不少。
制作时间是伊苏6之后，起源之前，所以能看到很多起源跟6代的影子。
6F0感觉都是一个战斗系统框架。
这是我玩过历代最难的伊苏，哪怕是普通难度都非常折磨，像我这种伊苏老玩家习惯困难起手能改难度后期改噩梦的简直太难了。
绝大部分BOSS这一作难度都非常高，在没拿到土属性手镯无敌技能之前，大部分BOSS的难度甚至感觉比魂类游戏难多了，就算有土属性手镯无敌技能，后期很多BOSS难度还是很高，特别是最终BOSS不熟悉机制的情况死个7到10次以上都很正常。
BOSS战难度高即是缺点也是优点，好几个BOSS给我留下了深刻印象，打起来真的太刺激了。
地图中还有一堆跳跳乐，充斥着大量恶意的跳跳乐，有的地方跳失败就直接回到起点要从头开始跳。。

最后没什么好说的，伊苏系列粉丝强烈推荐玩这一作。
购买推荐：只有本体
个人评分：9分（有伊苏系列粉丝滤镜加成，实际上分没那么高）

author: {'steamid': '76561199440168067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1709760544}
review: The game is good but with a few flaws. A few of the bosses are less than fun, oftentimes feeling unfair rather than actually challenging. The game is also brutally punishing with the distance between checkpoints, meaning you can lose quite a lot of progress if you happen to die on a difficult section. Otherwise though, the story is quite good and emotional, the level design is unique and challenging, and as always in the Ys series, the soundtrack is absolutely phenomenal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198973213764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 4171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2462, 'last_played': 1709749617}
review:
我非常喜歡伊蘇系列，但這遊戲我實在給不了好評。
如果不是粉絲，建議別浪費生命玩了。
理由：
一、成就太刁鑽，很多成就都是令人煩悶且過份。
像是要求60等級，但經驗值要升到60等得耗很久；
或要求5小時內通過，不只影片及對話無法跳過，甚至達成條件時，成就也沒跑出來。
二、boss的攻擊不合理，操作系統本來就不是很好，很難閃避攻擊。
三、無繁體中文化。

113.3.7。終於拿到全成就了，至於方法就別提了，懂的都懂。
後來想了一下，這遊戲不能只有我玩。
強力推薦，這樣才能感受一下這遊戲的精髓：成就超級麻煩。

對了，經測試，使用遊戲的密技，有些成就拿不到。

review:
Game is hard but fun. I played on Normal but it feels like Nightmare on the Bosses. I'm looking forward to replaying the game on Inferno and Nightmare difficulty after a long break. 
The story is great and it feels like an adventure. Dungeons are vastly different and there and many enemy types. Great game but I think the difficulty might not be for everyone.

I cannot believe my first experience of this franchise was this game on Nightmare difficulty years and years ago. And coming out of it as a fan instead of running for the hills. But I suppose it struck a chord like no other game did, especially at the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265281974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1708955310}
review:
ラスボス戦の音楽とギミックが最高すぎる。
PSP版をプレイ済みだったけどセールで安かったので衝動買いしてしまった。

難易度ノーマルが難しいけどレベル上げと装備強化でどうにかなるちょうどいいバランス。
詰む人もいるかもしれない。
イージー以下ならレベル上げなしでも行けそうだが、途中で難易度変更できないので注意。

セーブポイントが少なめだったり、今思うと不親切なところがいくつかある。
特にエルダーム山脈の入り口の登り方がわかりにくく、二段ジャンプではギリギリ登れず特殊操作が必要。正攻法でも失敗する。
[spoiler]二段ジャンプ＋回転斬りor切り上げ攻撃で登れる。[/spoiler]

初期解像度が4:3の低画質になってるので、まずは設定変更から始めたほうが良い。
ただし、16:9にすると画面端で背景が切れてるなど見えてはいけない部分が見えてしまう。

フルスクリーンで一部の場面でフレームレートが安定しなくなる場合はウィンドウにしましょう・・・。

author: {'steamid': '76561198028674152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1683922238}
review:
Ys: The Oath in Felghana. Classic action, classic adventure, classic charm, and mostly classic boss fights. Its a classic!  A remake from the ground up of the 3rd Ys game and much, much better for it. The skinny is: its good and you should play it.

[u][h3] Welcome to the Land of Legend [/h3][/u]
Adol, our playable character, arrives back at the homeland of his companion and friend, Dougi, and finds much is wrong. The town Dougi knew and the friends he grew up with are not the same and something sinister is afoot. Beasts all over the shop, a crisis in mining, and a seeming return of an ancient evil threaten the island and the return of the hero is demanded. Time to step up!  

What follows is a fairly routine, but by no means bad, classic adventure story-line. Damsels to save, a lurking evil orchestrated by a high official, heroic cycles, ancient armaments, and a decent rival story. Not too shabby, but no one is going to be surprised here

[u][h3] Is Your Blood Pumping Yet? [/h3][/u]
The gameplay is where its at in Ys. Fast paced, combo heavy, almost...[i]soulslike[/i]. There are tells, timings, weaknesses and its all at hyper speed. The faint of heart will be heavily tested here, but once it clicks it sticks. The bosses in particular stand out, each generally playing differently and its easy to gain that "flow state" any action game strives for. All this tied into the sound and music design are simply [i]*chefs kiss*[/i]. Speaking of music...

[u][h3] Put on Your Headphones [/h3][/u]
Its a known thing that most Falcom games (developers for Ys: Oath in Felghana) have incredible scores and this title is no slouch. Overworld themes promise mystery, while bosses sport music sure to fire you up for the challenge ahead. Driving where it needs to be, calm and cozy when at town, somber during the down parts and lurking terror for the final areas, this is a score that soars. Combine this with punchy sounds for swinging swords and bass filled booms when something kabooms and its great.  Truly elevates the experience

[u][h3] Not the Prettiest Picture, But... [/h3][/u]
The visuals are really the only slouch and given the games age, [i]and that its is a psp port[/i] I think it holds up fine. The character model look kinda like lego guys, or some of the earlier playstation models, but the backgrounds do some heavy lifting. While it doesn't have the highest poly count it does have a unified art direction and that's almost always better. This case is no different. Once youre used to it you'll forget this is an old game youre playing. 

[u][h3] The Bottom Line [/h3][/u]
Ys: The Oath in Felghana is great! a solid 8, with some room to be placed maybe a touch higher. its hard, but rewarding, and combines just about all the elements of this happy medium for a fantastic action experience. It shows some of its age, but this dog has plenty of tricks up its sleeve. Fun, Fast, and Affordable. You should purchase and play Ys: Oath in Felghana

author: {'steamid': '76561198049814699', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2962, 'last_played': 1708644704}
review:
Finally beat this game after over a decade of it being in my backlog. It's a solid title but also notoriously difficult.

The last two dungeons require hours upon hours of grinding and throughout the game the amount of experience you get from enemies scale with your levels. So for example, an enemy that gives you 100 exp on level 35, might give you 60 exp on level 36 and so on like a Fibonacci sequence. And it gets painful when you're in the final stretch.

I don't know if it's my favorite Ys game since Ys AoN was my personal favorite for so long and it's been a minute since I played that title, but OiF definitely has it's flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300637180', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1704437000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026309131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1604, 'last_played': 1705098456}
review:
Every now and then you stumble upon a game where the gameplay is so good that you enjoy even the moments when you have to grind.
Throw on top of that a great soundtrack that occasionally even shreds, alongside a hefty sprinkling of great sound effects, and you're in for a good time.
I can easily overlook the boring story and forgettable characters in a game like this, but I wish the art direction was more inspired. But other than that, it's a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019153769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1619902774}
review:
[i]Oath in Felghana[/i] is a remake of [i]Ys III: Wanderers from Ys[/i] and is extremely faithful to the original versions on the Genesis, SNES, and PC Engine while expanding on the originals in welcome ways. The music is a remix of the original (but still inferior to the PC Engine version) while the dungeons were clearly inspired by the original versions and expanded to feel like a proper remake.

If you've played the originals, the magic rings have been replaced with three based on the elements of fire, ice, and wind that grow in power as you add appropriately colored gems. The inclusion of actual magic, a mechanic first introduced in the original second game, opens things up for original puzzles involving the right spells as well as tactics based on an enemy's weaknesses.

My one and only complaint is that the story remains largely the same. Falcom really missed out on a chance to expand upon things.

author: {'steamid': '76561199241273848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1688395409}
review:
[h1]Ys: The Oath in Felghana Review[/h1]

I’m a big Ys fan. I love the series greatly. The mixture of excellent action RPG elements, great controls, superb music, and an authentic challenge truly establish the games as classics. Ys: Oath in Felghana is a remake of the third game in the series – Wanderers from Ys. First released on PC, Ys: Oath had excellent graphics, smooth controls, and a redone story that re-imagined everything about Wanderers. In short, they made a silk purse out of a sow’s ear.

[b]Story[/b]

Ys: Oath in Felghana takes place two years after the events in Ys Books I & II. Adol and his stalwart companion, Dogi, have been wandering from town to town (hence the original version’s title of Wanderers from Ys) when they learn about trouble in Dogi’s homeland, Felghana. Curious, they take a boat to the island and immediately encounter monsters. After saving Dogi’s childhood friend, Elena, from a pack of wolves, they head to the village of Redmont and learn that the monsters are just the tip of the iceberg. For the last decade or two, the lord of the land, Count McGuire has been levying high taxes and impressing townsfolk into service building his castle. To top it off, he recently shut down the Tigray Quarry and Redmont’s main source of income: raval ore. To top it off, the Mayor is trapped in the Quarry and needs a rescuin’. What’s a red-haired swordsman to do?

I appreciated how Falcom re-imagined the story for the remake of what most fans consider the black sheep of the series. Characters have been given more depth and more distinctive personalities, events have been made more coherent, there’s a plot twist that you won’t likely see coming, and it’s overall more dramatic. In addition, the translation was nearly flawless. XSEED purchased it from a fan, Jeff Nussbaum, who originally did the translation so that other English-speaking fans could enjoy the PC version of the game. Having played the PC version with that translation, I can see where XSEED massaged and improved upon Nussbaum’s work, and in the end, it’s a polished product. While it’s not a revolutionary story, it’s still worth the price of admission.

[b]Gameplay[/b]

The Ys series has always been known for its excellent gameplay. For the most part it doesn’t do anything new, but rather takes already solid elements and hones them to a razor’s edge. Ys: Oath takes the mechanics from Ys VI and throws in nice little tweaks without changing what I consider to be some of the best action gameplay out there.

The game takes a three-fourths overhead view with Adol going from area to area, running around, and slicing things up with his sword. Adol moves fast and attacks even faster, which is incredibly satisfying. Defeating enemies nets you experience and gold/item drops from time to time. These items take the form of herbs and potions that give you immediate benefit when you pick them up. Some will raise your defense, some your attack, and some your magic restoration rate. In addition, the more hits you rack up, the higher your experience multiplier, to a maximum of 1.99. Money and raval ore can be used back in town to purchase and upgrade your weapons and armor.

Adol can also use three types of elemental magic: fire, wind, and earth. Finding certain bracelets gives the player access to these abilities, and finding the proper enhancement gems powers them up. While I wound up relying on the wind magic most of all, all three types are required at various points throughout the adventure, yet I never felt they were gimmicky.

Of course the main thing any Ys fan should be wondering about is the bosses. I’m happy to say that they are challenging without being impossible; in other words, Ys bosses. The nice thing, though, is that when you change the difficulty level on the game, the bosses will change their patterns and do new things. I found this change refreshing as it allowed me to challenge myself while still facing something familiar. Add to that a New Game + mode which allows you to port over certain things from your last playthrough, and you’ve got a solid game with enough replay value to make it worthwhile.

[b]Graphics[/b]

I know I’m gonna get flak for this, but I had a tough time dealing with the graphics in Ys: Oath. Primarily, this is a function of playing on the PSP’s tiny screen. The PC version was beautiful, with well-textured polygons and cute, distinct sprites. Unfortunately, the jump to the small screen causes a lot of that crispness to be lost and I often had difficulty determining what the enemies were or even where they were. In a fast-paced game such as this, these graphical problems really put a dent in my ability to play. I also don’t take into consideration the ability to play on a TV; this is a handheld system, I rate it as such.

One thing that does survive the transition in tact is the character portraits. They’re all done beautifully and manage to convey the characters’ expressions quite well. There is also a portrait gallery that you can unlock as you beat different difficulty levels, and a bestiary with pictures of all the enemies. These little touches help to offset the negative aspects somewhat.

[b]Sound/Music[/b]

Ys games have always been known for their amazing soundtracks, and Ys: Oath is no exception. Sound team JDK managed to take the one saving grace from Wanderers – the music – and give it a complete facelift. The result is an amazing score, that ranges from melancholy piano solos to expansive orchestral pieces, and of course JDK’s trademark hard rock. The re-envisioning of the original tracks was done flawlessly, and there is no bad music to be found. Furthermore, the game will come with a soundtrack that includes two older renditions of the original’s music. You can’t lose there.

Where you can lose is in the area of voice acting. One of the changes from the PC version is a heavy dose of voice acting. Every character in the game (save Adol) gets at least one instance of voice dialog. The only problem is that it’s a crapshoot as to whether that acting is good, bad, or meh. Characters such as Dogi, Elena, and Chester are voiced quite well, whereas Margo, Anya, and Cynthia are badly overacted. Most of the others are just mediocre.

I think the addition of voice acting was a good move, but the quality is so inconsistent as to make it almost a wash.

[b]Control[/b]

Good controls are a staple of the Ys games. While I found Ys VI to be the pinnacle of the series in terms of controls, Ys: Oath was a close second… on the PC. On the PSP, however, control does suffer due to the lousy analog nub. Adol weaves around as if he were drunk (and I’m quoting the manual here), and sometimes the analog nub makes it difficult to get him to move where I want. I can switch to the D-pad, but I shouldn’t have to. In addition, some button combinations required awkward finger placement to execute, and this is not something I wanted to deal with when fighting a particularly nasty boss or navigating treacherous landscapes.

[b]Overall[/b]

Ys: The Oath in Felghana is a fun game, and it’s worth the purchase for any Ys fan, this is a must play for fans of the genre, and if you haven’t played it before, I recommend it wholeheartedly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094112446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6333, 'last_played': 1657996685}
review: Ys: The Oath in Felghana is a shining example of what an action RPG should be. It manages to strike the perfect balance between challenging gameplay, a pretty generic JRPG story but is still as memorable characters. The Ys series has gone under the radar for the most part unfortunately, but if you're a newcomer i highly recommend giving the series (particularly this title) a shot.

[h3]I played it, I beat it, and I think I'll never touch the Ys series again.[/h3]

The general gameplay is [i]fine,[/i] but nothing special. However, the [b]bosses are a headache,[/b] often of trial and error, rendering the overall experience as unfulfilling aggravation. In a blind play-through, this game felt like a sadistic joke at the player's expense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073011958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1670213884}
review: An excellent remaster of a SNES classic. All the things that made Wanderers of Ys III fantastic are present, while adding overworld elements, one of the best soundtracks to any game I've ever seen, and even more story packed in. The game is both faithful and improved where it matters, and an excellent starting point for anyone curious about the Ys series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3048, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1404, 'last_played': 1701298441}
review:
Action-jRPG

Aaaahh, Ys. Le série de jeux que tous les webos du monde, un tant soient peu fans d'action, me vendaient depuis des années comme étant le meilleur jRPG temps réel au monde. Et quand je leur demandais lequel en particulier, tous répondaient: Oath in Felghana. Ainsi débuta ma rencontre avec Ys.

Et il faut avouer que ce Ys est vraiment un très bon jeu. Il s'agit d'un jRPG à huit-clos, très carré niveau personnalisation, assez minimaliste, mais avec de l'explo de donjons et surtout des combats blindés d'action et des boss bien retors. Un seul village entouré des donjons du jeu, toujours les même personnages, au bout d'une heure n'importe quel joueur aura appréhendé la spatialisation des lieux et saura très rapidement où aller, en fonction des requêtes des PNJ. On rentre donc très rapidement dans l'univers du jeu, et l'impression de faire partie de cette histoire est vraiment forte, tellement tout le lore tourne autour de notre petite personne. C'est aussi un peu dommage, car ceux qui apprécient les voyages, découvrir de nouvelles contrées, de nouvelles coutumes, resteront sur leur fin. Mais en échange, l'implication dans le monde, en tant que joueur, est vraiment réussi.

Pis viennent les premiers donjons, et donc les premiers combats. C'est hyper nerveux, et malgré un gameplay plutôt simple (saut, attaque, pouvoir magique), tout le panel de mouvement est utile à maitriser, à utiliser en fonction des faiblesses des ennemis. Les boss sont des cas d'école, avec des patterns assez simples à comprendre, relativement difficile à contrer, mais une fois qu'on a compris, c'est que du bonheur et ça pète dans tous les sens. L'exploration des donjons est assez linéaire, mais c'est toujours plaisant de découvrir un petit secret par ci par là entre deux phases d'actions.

Pour ce qui est des points négatifs, je citerai la durée du vie du jeu, à savoir 10h en normal, sachant que j'ai bien galéré sur certaines phases, dont un boss en particulier qui m'aura pris plus d'une heure. Cependant, il y a plein de modes de difficulté, et ceux qui voudront prolonger l'expérience pourront montrer à quel point ils sont kikitoutdur avec les difficultés les plus élevées, qui me font cauchemarder juste à y penser. Et il existe même un mode boss rush pour ceux qui ont kiffé. Pour les moins persévérants par contre, il faut noter que le mode "très simple" se fait les doigts dans le nez, et inclut quelques options du genre la quicksave ou l'impossibilité de tomber dans les trous.

Parce que oui, le second défaut, c'est les phases de plateforme. Elles ne sont pas très punitives puisque si le joueur chute, il ne meurt pas mais tombe juste plus bas dans le donjon ( = perte de temps + énervement), mais METTRE DES PHASES DE PLATEFORME DANS UN JEU EN VU ISO C'EST VRAIMENT UNE IDÉE DE MERDE. Bon, c'est pas rédhibitoire non plus, en s'appliquant un minimum on s'y fait, mais pour avoir essayé de speedrun le jeu lors d'une seconde partie en "très facile", j'ai bien pété les plombs sur ce point en particulier.

Mais au delà de ça, Ys Oath in Felghana est vraiment une excellente surprise. Un "petit" jeu, mais ultra maitrisé. Qui m'aura beaucoup fait penser à Castle in the Darkness tellement tout est pensé au pixel près par les développeurs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10141, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 2175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2175, 'last_played': 1679327039}
review:
[h1]
《起源》√
《1+2》√
《F》√
[/h1]

法老控的游戏大家都懂得。价格作为日厂游戏简直是白菜价。可惜旗下多款游戏都被国内代理了，中文有版权独占了。网上找的汉化补丁链接都失效的。但还是趁着史低买来花了一天多通关了。这次更新了英语配音，那么老的上古游戏最近还在更新，感觉还算不错哦。地图虽然不是很大，但迷宫和谜题设计的非常棒，剧情也很紧凑，虽然我之前并没玩过这代..啃着英文有点难受呀。关键是用原版玩还不能加速，有的地方不练级会很苦B。但这剧情看一半后面套路就差不多摸清了。一共就那么点NPC，果然后面那老哥要洗白然后GG... 这代有部分场景做的像横版闯关一样非常有意思，特别是最后的城堡，钟楼场景。印象最深的还是最终BOSS战了。BGM也是超赞啊！

author: {'steamid': '76561198070729758', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1700924447}
review:
La música, la jugabilidad y la historia están muy bien. 
Este es un buen punto de partida para meterse en la saga.
Me gustó mucho la forma de moverse por el mundo. Sin necesidad de un marcador de objetivo es muy intuitivo. 
La dificultad es bastante elevada, recomiendo jugarlo en fácil la primera vez.

Es mi primer YS y me dejó enamorado, voy a seguir probando el resto de los juegos de la saga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142125684', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1700911268}
review: I played Felghana shortly after Origin and found them remarkably similar, almost to a fault. While I favored the storyline of Origin and the bosses in Felghana, the level scaling, aerial combat, and achievements were aspects I didn't enjoy. It's a good game in keeping with the older titles of this series, but I'm looking forward to progressing to the more contemporary entries.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236969142', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1698035504}
review:
[h3] YS: The Oath in Felghana [/h3]

Mi primer acercamiento a la saga lo hice con este juego , en resumen es el clásico viaje del héroe para salvar al mundo de un mal inconmensurable , con una historia fácil de seguir  y con mecánicas fáciles pero no por eso significa que el juego es fácil , vas a tener que manejar bien al personaje y tener los reflejos afinados si quieres pasarte el juego en las dificultades mas altas , lo recomiendo si buscas algo sencillo y desafiante , por mi parte este Ys me dejo una buena experiencia así que probare con los demás.

[h3] IMPORATE [/h3]

- Para los que hablamos español  este y el Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana cuentan con traducción al español hecha por fans la probe en este juego y funciona perfecto  recomendado .

- Ademas seguramente como es un juego viejo tal vez tengas problemas al configurar los controles en mi caso tuve que mapear el mando desde Steam para poder tener la configuracion como yo queria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040256804', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1535526159}
review: A fantastic game. If you're a fan of action RPG's, this is the game for you. It's lightning fast, free of clutter, and controls amazingly well. My only gripe is, and this is true of all Ys titles unfortunately, the story-line and characters are very weak and generic. While the game-play itself stands out very well, I could have cared less why I was doing whatever it was that I was doing. Grab it if you're a fan of straight out, fast paced adventure games. Don't buy it if you're looking for a moving narrative and a ton of mechanical depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009352377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1694747895}
review:
Is this the best Ys game in the entire series? If not, it's only competitor (Origin) uses the same combat system in a slightly different, more contained environment. Everything that makes the game good is done just as well here, if not better. The biggest difference players will notice is the difficulty: Felghana is noticeably more challenging than Origin, and the difficulty is spread across the entire game, not just the boss encounters. While the skills you obtain later in the game make some of the bosses a little easier to approach (because you have more mobility), the difficulty never really lets off, and the last boss offers one of the more satisfying encounters in the entire game.

The story, characters, environment, music, graphics, and combat are all strong to excellent here, and they make the challenge worth it. And everything is paced just right: the game took me just over 12 hours on Normal, and that was with me trying to find a bunch of secrets. Some may look at that and frown, but I appreciate that Felghana never wastes my time. Instead, it gives me awesome location after awesome location with tough opponents, light puzzles, and fantastic bosses. 

If you're worried about the difficulty that everyone seems to talk about, don't. Felgahan offers difficulty levels and you shouldn't feel ashamed to try the easier ones. Don't let comments about people not finishing it on normal deter you. There's way too much good game here for difficulty elitism to spoil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008785787', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1035, 'last_played': 1688776056}
review:
Game absolutely rips as always with Ys, though I think I liked this one the least out of the three Ys VI era games.
The level design was great, with wonderful pacing and a surprisingly good sense of scale at times. It took inspiration from its roots as a remake of a sidescrolling game and had some parts where it switched to pseudo sidescrolling perspective as well (long before Nier did the same thing! neat), and the platforming is a big step up from how it felt in Ys VI. The music was fantastic as always, it slaps so hard that it really keeps the momentum going as you sprint through each dungeon. The portrayal of small communities is always a highlight in Ys games, and this one is no different, and while it only has the one town this time, it does a good job of giving each resident of Redmont their own little story arc. The combat mostly felt better than Ys VI's did, with tighter control and more interesting abilities that integrate into your combos more smoothly, but the boss fights were a bit rough (occasionally more than a bit rough, like the final boss). The story was pretty standard stuff, but the addition of extremely hammy anime dub-esque voice acting helps elevate it a bit.

So while it was a super well-paced game game with great, simple-but-deep combat mechanics and a banger ost, it felt less like it had its own identity compared to Ys VI and Ys Origin. It is simply a good "one of these." but since no other action RPGs have the same energetic enthusiasm, the same chutzpah Ys does, it's still a great time to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111477632', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1638570440}
review:
What an absolute gem of a game. I had such a blast playing this.
Playing this game right after Ys I & II Chronicles+ made me miss the cozy vibes of these two games, but Oath in Felghana definitely has its own charm! The gameplay is still quick and fun, which made me enjoy every second.

Not being able to save when I want to and a few bosses were a pain in the ass though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994085641', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2111, 'last_played': 1695397828}
review:
A relentlessly difficult game that will challenge you every step of the way. Unlike with other Ys entries, there’s really no way around it; whatever difficulty setting you might choose, it will probably feel like you’ve accidentally picked one level above that. It even has a certain air of "brutality" around it, with more ominous music, less colorful environments and an eldritch horror for a final boss (though even bigger horror is how ball-crushingly hard that thing is and how much of your health bar it takes away with every hit).

If you’re new to the series or prefer sticking to lower difficulties, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/207350]Origin[/url] or [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/312540]Napishtim[/url] would be better starting points. But if you really want to test you skills or push your limits in a fair, smart and varied way, few games can deliver as well as Felghana.

Also a rare entry where Adol doesn’t get shipwrecked but safely arrives at the starting point by boat. His best bro Dogi still gets to crush a wall, though, so all is well with the world.

review: Remake de la tercera entrega, con el motor que también tienen el 6 y Origin, esta vez en Felghana la tierra de Dogi fiel compañero de Adol, probablemente junto a Dana la historia mas emocional de la saga, jefes retantes, jugabilidad increíble, banda sonora al nivel de la saga y todo acompañado igual que con Dana y el primero, de una traducción fantástica al español para quien tenga impedimentos con el ingles, muy recomendado cuando llevéis 2-3 juegos

author: {'steamid': '76561198254576277', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1684245583}
review:
Gran juego como todos los YS.
Si el inglés no es un impedimento os animo a probar esta saga.
Este es un poco antiguo pero no por ello peor, tienes una ligera exploración y mazmorras muy curradas, los puzzles son sencillos y anecdóticos, ya que hace muchísimo énfasis en el combate y la exploración.
Podéis empezar por cualquiera de estos clásicos, son más jugables que los primeros, aunque no vais a tener party como en los modernos, solo manejareis a Adol.
La historia pues como siempre es muy buena en estos juegos.
Os animo a que probéis esta saga tan infravalorada y que merece más ventas y reconocimiento.
Y si queréis empezar a lo grande en la saga, empezar por Lacrimosa of Dana que es el mejor de todos y de los mejores juegos que he jugado en mi vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044294994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1691891925}
review: Difficult but fun, really enjoyed this remake. A little grindy, but overall good design. Satisfying when you level up and notice a difference in power. Bosses really test your understanding of the game mechanics. Good voice acting in my opinion, some familiar voice actors were used. The plot is a product of its time, but it was nice to see it and the characters in the game fleshed out vs the minimalist story from the SNES game this is based on (never played the old PC versions, PC-8801 or MSX2 etc.).

author: {'steamid': '76561198056328885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1689839259}
review:
在起源之后也打完了誓约，所以写个简单的评测给他人做参考吧。

伊苏系列的战斗模式变更了几次，每个模式都有人喜欢有人讨厌，这作是前面05年作品的重制移植版，用了和起源相同的系统，所以打完起源的很建议继续游玩誓约，会很容易上手。

剧情方面是多奇带亚特鲁去自己故乡勘察异变，由此发生了各种各样的剧情，因为是rpg，所以剧情方面留待自己去体验。整体的剧情还算流畅，不过也很容易感受到老版日式rpg的一些拖沓吧，而且这是多年前的重制，很多地方并没有现在游戏的便利，参考起源，所以游玩时候需要一些耐心。

战斗方面玩过起源的话也没有太多可以说的，没玩过的，上手也不难，大体就是普通攻击加上三种额外属性攻击，装备更换和锻造系统，打不过去强化肯定没毛病。传统的二段跳，突刺各种熟练应用，多注意地形问题，都是arpg的老生常谈，相信不会太难。

音乐方面老游戏很多制作还是很精良的，好像是有ost的，游玩过后，喜欢的可以去找找看，最后战斗的音乐也挺激动的。因为是一个系统，所以ui之类也没有可说太多的。

最后作为一款经典老游戏，能接受这种风格的还是尝试一下吧，虽然时代变了，游戏也越来越多，但是值得回味的好游戏，老游戏还是很多的，新游戏玩累了，不妨回来找找这些老游戏体验一轮，或许会找回最简单的快乐。

author: {'steamid': '76561198376541470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1691605258}
review:
Après avoir sauvé les 2 déesses de la contrée d'Esteria, Bière de la Chope avec son alcoolyte Dogi s'échouèrent dans la région de Felghana.
Là bas un mal ancien menaçait de revenir des entrailles de la terre, transformant la plupart des gens en soiffard, et asséchant les tonneaux d'alcools des habitants.

Bière se sentant concerné par le désespoir de ses derniers leur proposa de leur prêter sa chope.

review:
This is one of the better adol focused YS games on the market. It's just adol, surprisingly not shipped wrecked on his quest in the Felghana region. 

Game's just great and the music is so much better. The characters as well I'd say are better than in Ark of Napishtim with how they're handled. One of the games I wanted to play again on Nightmare. I'd definitely recommend this for any newcomers or people going through the old YS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041330842', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1689865703}
review:
A proper Ys game, through and through.

Surprisingly great story, and characters.
Fantastic English-dub cast. (especially Chester, and Dogi's va's)
Fantastic level design. 
Delightfully fun gameplay, and combat. 
Player progression, and pacing are also quite satisfying.
The bosses also make me want to break a window; as a Ys game should.

Very great game. Well worth the $5 I payed for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141680546', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1535, 'last_played': 1688204770}
review:
Disclaimer; I play Ys on nightmare (almost) exclusively, this is less applicable to easier difficulties and inferno is intentionally unfair. 

Everyone who recommends this game to Ys newcomers is absolutely evil. I honestly would leave a neutral review on this game if I had the option to, as I think its a bit overpraised. I do not like it as much as the other Ys games as it has extremely questionable level design (relative enemy placement/strength to checkpoints) and doesnt really do a good job of telling the player when they need an equipment upgrade to make a boss doable.

I've seen a lot of people complain about only doing 1 damage to bosses because they didnt know when to go looking for a new weapon or level up. Personally the bosses are a bit overtuned in general as far as HP / Damage goes, the fights themselves are excellent dont get me wrong (some of the best in the series ive played so far imo), its just they take way too long and become more of an endurance test than a test of your abilities. It promotes unfun strategies like walking back and forth from the checkpoint to farm levels until enemies dont give you anymore xp. You don't HAVE to do this obviously, but not doing it might tack on another 5-10m to the boss. It makes the amazing bosses more frustrating to fight than enjoyable, especially when you have to fight two almost back to back (Lava zone lol, this area sucks). 

I have a lot of negative things to say about OiF, but its still Ys. I just dont think this entry deserves the title of best Ys game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101064176', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1663448047}
review:
Ys: The Oath in Felghana is an action-packed, hack-and-slash RPG developed by Nihon Falcom and published by XSEED Games. Originally released in 2005 for the PC in Japan, the game was later remade and released for the PC in English in 2012.

One of the standout features of Ys: The Oath in Felghana is its fast-paced and engaging gameplay. The game follows the story of Adol Christin, a red-haired adventurer who travels to the land of Felghana to investigate a series of mysterious events. The game's combat system is intuitive and satisfying, with a range of weapons and special abilities that allow players to take on a variety of enemies.

The game's graphics and soundtrack are also impressive, with detailed and vibrant environments that are a joy to explore. The game's music is composed by the legendary Yuzo Koshiro and creates a unique and immersive atmosphere that perfectly complements the game's action-packed gameplay.

One of the strengths of the game is its difficulty. The game is challenging but not frustrating, with a range of difficulty settings that allow players to adjust the game's challenge to their liking. The game also features a range of side quests and hidden items that encourage players to explore and discover all that the game has to offer.

However, some players may find the game's story to be predictable and cliché, with characters and plot points that feel formulaic. Additionally, the game's translation and localization may not be up to the standards of some players, with occasional awkward dialogue and grammatical errors.

Overall, Ys: The Oath in Felghana is an exceptional hack-and-slash RPG that offers fast-paced and engaging gameplay, stunning soundtrack, and a challenging and rewarding experience. The game's difficulty and replayability make it a must-play for fans of the genre, while its story and translation may be less impressive to some players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328999986', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 3637, 'last_played': 1710313083}
review:
Ótimo jogo ora quem deseja adentrar no mundo da serie YS. O sistema de combate é bem responsivo e a história, mesmo que simples, é bem feita. As horas de jogatina variam dependendo da dificuldade que você escolhe (recomendo Normal para quem adentra, assim você compreende a história e se diverte com o Sistema Ark) podendo ser 12hrs no Normal, até 40+horas no Pesadelo ou Inferno. Recomendo a compra, mas caso você esteja com pouco dinheiro, espere uma promoção aparecer que o jogo fica entorno de 11,00 a 15,00 reais.

Agradeço a paciência, tenha um ótimo dia e uma ótima jogatina.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064002064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2502, 'last_played': 1534637374}
review:
This game is a remake of the original that is chronologically the prequel to Ark of Nepishtim, but this remake came out after Ys VI Ark of Nepishtim with a lot more solid combat system. Oath in Felghana has a pretty good story with some memorable characters that stick with you in mind after the credits roll, making you wonder what happened to them when you get into the newer sequels to Ys.

The final boss has an incredible boss track and is fun to play against, until you reach the Ping-Pong section that become incredibly frustrating to do as it gets faster with each volley and one mistake restarts it all over again. Despite that massive annoyance, the overall game is quite dang good and would highly recommend playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992316895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1685594968}
review:
I recommend this game but do not recommend the English dub and would instead suggest installing a Japanese voice mod: https://www.moddb.com/mods/ys-oath-in-felghana-japanese-dub to play this game with the original voice cast. This is a great Action RPG with a good story, great music, incredible boss fights, and a good sense of adventure. The way Adol fights also feels reminiscent of the bump system from Ys 1 and 2 because you can bully enemies across the screen with your attacks. Very fun combat and I found myself just gliding through the game at a rapid pace. This game feels like a fun side adventure for Adol and starts off rather lighthearted before eventually getting dark toward the end. 

People say that this is the most challenging Ys game and I can see why. I think I died to the final boss over 30 times on Normal difficulty and a couple of other bosses earlier definitely killed me over 10 times. This game has some of the best boss fights in the series and they are all unforgiving tests of skill but fair. This game also expects you to gear up as soon as you have the gold for it and not whenever you return to town naturally. This game's motto is: be prepared. You often will not have enough gold to buy that new set of armor or weapon when you go to the next dungeon. You may think, "I'll just go beat this dungeon real quick and then come back to upgrade." That's how other games work but that's not how this game works. This game expects you to run away from a dungeon the moment you have enough gold to upgrade. This lets you come back stronger than ever to bulldoze through the dungeon and then, somehow, just barely survive the boss encounter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025183152', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1684231857}
review:
One of my favorite games ever.

The difficulty balance is off though. If you play on Easy, the bosses will still be quite challenging while most of the normal mobs will be too easy. But the boss fights are very good! Even when they are difficult and kill you over and over, they are much more enjoyable than in other hard games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112356517', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1706578514}
review:
This game slaps harder than Superman on crack. I did my first playthrough of Ys: The Oath in Felghana on nightmare, which definitely caused me some high amounts of frustration. I mean, it took me about 36 hours to beat it on nightmare, and almost all of that was the bosses, and a little bit of getting too carried away running through dungeons without going back to save. 
My biggest complaint about the game would be that the story is mediocre, most of the normal enemies are kind of boring to fight, and some of the voice acting is a little rough. However, I don't hold the story against the game because it's both short, and it puts gameplay above all else, which is what all good games should do. However, it should be noted that Chester's voice actor did a superb job. While a lot of the normal enemies are trashy, there are a decent amount of ones later on in the game that require some actual thought to beat. The only boss that I genuinely disliked was the spike hell hole bird that is some RNG bullshit, and Guilen the dragon centipede thing. Fuck Guilen. These are my only complaints.
Ys: The Oath in Felghana excels in its boss battles and music, which are next level well made. Now, the bosses, to put it bluntly, truly are on crack and will slap you hard as all hell on nightmare mode, but that just makes them even more fun to fight. Apparently. starting on hard mode, the bosses not only hit harder and take less damage, but gain new attacks, attack patterns, and less windows of opportunity to attack them, and it changes to become harder once again when playing on nightmare mode. This is a really cool difference between difficulties that I really respect. Now, the music for every YS game absolutely slaps, and Oath in Felghana has some of the best tracks to date, in my opinion. I especially enjoyed the soundtrack for the final boss, who took me about a whopping 5 hours and 20 minutes to beat at lvl 52. The controls are super tight too. 
All in all, I'd give Ys: The Oath in Felghana a 10/10. The bosses are just pure euphoria to fight, and some of the mobs are also pretty fun to fight. If you want an extremely solid action RPG that is one bitch of a challenge on high difficulties, then there really isn't anything better than this game. Personally, I found a decent chunk of the bosses in this game, on nightmare mode, to be far more difficult to beat than 99% of the bosses from the Souls series. The final boss of Oath in Felghana? Pfft, that bastard is far harder than Malenia from Elden Ring. It's not even a contest. 
Edit: I 100% completed the game now, and nightmare boss rush is by far the most difficult one to do. I did nightmare boss rush before inferno, which made inferno feel like a cakewalk. Nighmare boss rush was hella fun, though. This game's a masterpiece!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028953721', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3299, 'last_played': 1685266156}
review:
I about hate this game, and it hates me, it probably doesn't like you either...it certainly doesn't respect you. Its purpose is to abuse your time, presumptions of fair play, and good will. You or at-least I overcome this game by cultivating your hate, til like an anime edgy boy you declare your hate the stronger and pay backs its myriads of abuse with FOCUS and contempt.

Its a game I wanted to like but ended up beating out of spite. If that appeals to you go for it but I should also mention the characters are hella dumb, like DAMN, these boys taken too many to head.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058838611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1684024304}
review:
A remake of the third game of the franchise, this title continues a fairly good quality within the series. Cleaning up and making the game playable for modern audiences is quite nice and, especially if you've played Ys Origin, you'll feel right at home with many mechanics being used between the two games.

The gameplay has that edge of simplicity with enough mechanics to not be overbearing which some games fall into the common pitfall. The bosses themselves do play around very well with what the player can do, but I did find a couple of them being a bit more on the stalling end of the spectrum, which was a bit frustrating at times. The game's difficulty options are numerous in number, and I found the level of challenge to be quite welcome and not too bad overall. There isn't too much need for grinding, but if you do skip hallways of enemies consistently, you might find the need to catch up just a little. Again, as stated above, if you've played Ys Origin before, you'll feel right at home in this title.

Rather brief, but the graphics were rather nice. Again, same as Ys Origin, so you'll find yourself not out-of-place when jumping in. The look was rather nice and charming, keeping a solid consistency throughout. In addition, there's voice acting added, but I found some voices to fit in well while a few others didn't really work for me.

The only downside, I would say, was the story. While the earlier games weren't too complex either, I found them a bit more engaging than with this title. That isn't to say it's bad, but if you're looking for something a bit more engaging, you may be a bit disappointed. That said, it's still pleasant to play through and see how things develop.

The third game in the series does well to continue the saga of Adol. While the story might not the strongest, or some of the voice acting either, I found the experience overall to be amazing and still reaching that quality I've come to expect from the series. Absolutely recommend from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198846175230', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1678153256}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1423499060}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199415773', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1682941945}
review:
Це було шикарно.
Ніхон фалком знову це зробили, вони ще раз написали теплу історію про Адола і змусили мене знову сумувати за персонажами. Так, сюжет не настільки емоційний як в перших двух, але якусь пустоту всередені він залишає, а це вже знак що історія як мінімум не погана. Геймплей мені був +- нормальним, іноді паркур дратував, і складність боссів теж, але у кінці залишилися тільки позитивні емоції від гри. Усім рекомендую після перших двух. 
P.S На просторах інтернету є undub мод.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050086381', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2959, 'last_played': 1682542827}
review:
This game got me into the Ys series.
Wonderful story, characters, and music.
Incredibly well balanced across six difficulty settings, providing the player with dozens and dozens of hours of gameplay.
Explore various dungeons, from underground lava abyss, to snowy mountains. Fight various monsters, as well as tough bosses in this beautiful reminiscent 2D jrpg. A game that every jrpg fan must play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081566830', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5811, 'last_played': 1682182717}
review:
Finally 100% this game, inferno was something, but i think the nightmare boss rush was even worst. Not my favorite of the ys series but a very good game nonetheless, prepared to be challenged even in normal difficulty, altough hard can be a decent starting point also. Boss gains new mechanics at nightmare and inferno, so it can be a bit rough to experience the story at first.

Good gameplay, good music, decent story, it's a nice experience for fans of ys games/falcom/the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561199413516097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1682373963}
review: I really dislike using this word to describe media but if I had to describe Ys: Oath in Felghana.. it would be "soul". There is nothing quite like Ys. Oath in Felghana especially is one of the standout titles in the franchises many entries. Felghana manages to provide really fun, tight and tense gameplay paired with fluid movement, beautiful sprite work and incredibly satisfying gameplay progression. And of course, that beautiful OST. Falcom provides yet another stunning OST with my absolute favorite here being, "Valestein Castle". UItimately, Oath in Felghana is a rather quick game but that does not detract from how it manages to be an incredibly enthralling and downright exciting experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180292450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1681044645}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018963096', 'num_games_owned': 2097, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1680975825}
review:
For the record, before I played this one I've played and finished Ys Origin, Ys I, II and Celceta. All of them were fun experiences, even considering the severely dated bumping systems of I and II.

This game, however, is painfully unbalanced. I've played on Normal. First boss was barely beatable even getting the first magic powerup. I gave up on the second boss in the temple. There's very little room for mistake and not in a fun way. 

Judging by the reviews, most people seem to have enjoyed this game. To me, it was hard but not in a "fair, learn from your mistakes" way but more like "you probably are into ballbusting and pegging" way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400146178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1688614632}
review:
30대 중반의 나이로 이제는 잘 기억도 나지 않는 고등학생 시절, 나는 이 게임을 했다. 정말 재미있게 나이트메어 난이도는 물론 나중에 패치로 나온 인페르노 까지 전부 클리어 했었고, 이는 내가 이스 시리즈라면 시리즈 넘버나 발매 순서 같은거 무시하고 아무 망설임 없이 구매하게 만든 하나의 발판이 되었다. 그리고 이후 나온 이스시리즈 중 나를 실망시키는 건 단 하나도 없었다. 

스팀에서 이 게임을 보았을 때 당시 한국에서 구할 길이 없어 불법 다운로드를 했던 속죄겸 게이머 인생을 풍요롭게 만들어 준 보답으로 오리진과 함께 바로 결제했다. 그 때 나는 이 겜의 재미는 추억 속의 미화라고 생각했고, 그래서 다시 손대지도 않았는데... 최근 노트북으로 심심풀이겸 깔아 해봤더니 이 모든게 다 내 착각내지 지레짐작이었다는 걸 깨달았다. 2005년에 출시된 이 게임은 18년이 지난 지금 해도 재미었었다. 연출부터 전투시스템, 보스 레벨디자인, 인터페이스까지 단 하나도 촌스럽지 않았으며, 더구나 타격감과 효과음, BGM은 최근에 나온게임들에 뒤지지 않는 것에 난 오히려 당황해야 했다.

대체 그 오랜 기간동안 게임계에는 무슨 일이 일어났길래 이런 끔찍한 정체, 혹은 퇴화가 일어났을까. 고민해봐야 할 문제이다.

그래서 추천하냐고? 무조건 사라. 스팀에서 보통 70% 할인으로 5천 이하에 자주 판매하니 이 정도 게임을 이 가격에 건지는 건 1100원에 할인판매하는 레포데 바로 다음 수준의 갓성비이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016057247', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1679086642}

author: {'steamid': '76561198851412461', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1678944184}
review:
歯ごたえがありすぎて、歯が砕けそうになる高難易度のARPGです

ザコ敵は固い、鬱陶しい、多いのトリプルでダンジョン探索が一苦労
ダンジョン内部は広く、しかもマップは存在しないのもつらい
そして敵が回復アイテムを落とすからか、常時使えるポーション的な回復アイテムもありません
止まってると回復する装備もあるのですが、操作できないんで退屈

そしてこの作品の目玉といえばボスのマジキチ度合いでしょう
どのボスも非常に固く、多種多彩な攻撃でプレイヤーを苦しめてくれます
ただボスにはちゃんと対策が用意されており、それさえわかれば案外勝てたりと
戦闘のバランスに関しては中々神がかっていて、非常に面白かった

グラフィックはいまいち、ストーリーも大したものではありませんが、
やりごたえのあるARPGがやりたい人にはお勧めです

総合評価は90点
それにしても、このゲームの実績のマークはなんでこんなにダサいのか

author: {'steamid': '76561197973648250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1331, 'last_played': 1678877549}
review:
나메 기준 보스들 패턴이 맛있게 어려운 게 아니라 조잡하게 어려움
잡몹들도 점프공격 강요하는 것들이 많고 경직이 없는지 선빵 쳐서 한 사이클에 못 잡으면 역으로 맞는 경우가 많음
스토리도 민간인 학살한 놈들 세탁기 돌리려고 해서 별로

author: {'steamid': '76561198048961836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1671796766}
review:
Très bon jeu ! Histoire sympathique, combats dynamiques, gameplay agréable.
Mais attention, il nécessite un peu de grinding dès qu'on se fait démolir complètement par les boss. En prenant 1 à 2 niveaux de plus, et en améliorant son équipement, on revient un peu plus fort et le boss est beaucoup plus accessible. Bon, forcément vers la fin du jeu le grinding est un peu plus long...
Ne pas oublier de sauvegarder dès qu'on peut pour ne pas avoir de mauvaise surprise, la mort peut vite arriver !

review:
This game is almost the same as Ys Origin played with the melee character. Fun little Action RPG with classic grinding.

But still Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198201495963', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1677483653}
review:
Helluva game, firing on all cylinders in basically every regard. This is my 5th Ys game, following Digital Emelas's story order, and with each one I play, my love of this series is further cemented.

Combat is engaging and fun throughout the whole game. Your regular attacks are punchy and satisfying, with a surprisingly long basic combo and jump attacks. You get 3 types of spells over the game, which each have specific uses in combat and also exploration: a spin attack, fireball, and charge/parry. The bosses are challenging if you want, but easily knocked down a couple pegs if you level up a few more times (on Normal, if you go Very Easy/Easy you will likely breeze through regardless), so you'll be able to avoid most of the salt (unless you reeeally suck or are impatient like me lol). The reason my playtime is so high is because I grinded a bunch to bypass the worst of the challenge. Regular mobs are varied and require enough different strategies to defeat that it successfully staves off the tedium.

The soundtrack is incredible, as to be expected from Falcom, and it has some of the best songs in the series (in my experience so far). Personal highlights for me are the main theme and Redmont's theme, plus the farewell theme in the epilogue. Every dungeon has its own music, and they each suit the area perfectly, and while boss themes are sometimes reused, it still works because it instills a familiar sense of urgency and gets you ready each time you hear them.

The story isn't terribly original, but it's executed and told well thanks to a great translation and surprisingly charming voice acting. I usually am too impatient to listen to voice acting after I'm done reading, and the VA initially got on my nerves when I started, to the point where I was considering just turning it off. But ultimately I decided to try and appreciate it for what it is, and it grew on me in short order, except for Margo's voice, which drives me up the wall. The plot itself has a few twists and turns, which keep things interesting, and when I reached the end, I really felt satisfied and sad saying goodbye.

Overall, one of the peaks of Ys and a highly recommended game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401246551', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1946, 'last_played': 1674193902}
review:
Ys 3 Remake: Felghana

The best thing about this game is the magic attacks, especially fire and wind. Fire for ranged attacks and wind is essential for spinning across gaps to get to other areas or treasures. It makes gameplay interesting.
This game is a lot like Ys Origin and the original versions of Ys IV on Turbografx CD and SNES. It's nothing like the side scrolling original Ys 3. It's also not a party of characters like Ys 4 Celceta.

You start the game out with your longtime pal, Dogi, from Ys 1. Funny thing is that he always manages to run off somewhere in a hurry or he gets hurt, so that the entire game you play solo. Sadly, you never get to be the wall-busting Dogi.  Oh well, this game is fun anyway! If you like the straightforward old style of gameplay then buy this already! It's great even at full price. And it's definitely bang for buck when there's a sale.
I even liked it more than Ys Origin. At Normal level, the bosses are not that difficult until late into the game. There aren't really any puzzles or anything too crazy. This is mostly an action and character driven type of story that was just right in length. Not too short and it ended right about when I was ready for a conclusion, so I could move on to the next game in the Ys series.
Even though, chronologically, this game's story is after Ys 4 Celceta, I recommend playing Felghana right after Ys 2. Adol's story flows better that way. In fact, in the old version of Ys 3 on Turbografx CD there's an intro scene where Adol and Dogi are sailing away leaving the land of Ys, while a girl stands looking at them, watching her crush (Adol) go off to another adventure.
This game is a fun experience and a worthwhile remake. Plus it's better than a lot of more expensive games. I hope the rest of the series continues this trend of better than average.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276607340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1700688909}
review:
童年回忆之一的游戏，小时候家里管的严加上没有零花钱基本游戏都是偷着下盗版玩，一个游戏来来回回玩个十几遍通关也不会腻，怀念那个存粹的年代。F算是这代系统里操作体验较为爽快的一作，高难度boss大部分也只是熟练度加上有时一定的运气问题，对比从7代开始加入的团队机制，伊苏老几代这种孤胆红发剑士拯救世界的模式虽然老套但却有自己独特的味道，这种感觉在面对加尔巴兰以及6代的方舟时尤为明显。在如今法老越来越花里胡哨的年代，这种体验也很难再寻回，配上最佳配乐，使得这几部游戏虽然已年代久远，但始终是值得体验的经典佳作。
重温的同时也要差评一下成就系统，噩梦boss rush以及老爷子加黑暗比卡多两个隐藏boss的成就个人认为还算合理，涉及到的是玩家操作熟练度和boss招式的背板，只要花时间练习或者观摩大佬的视频总有机会打过。但一些凑数的成就实在恶心，比如杀500个女仆，又比如60级满级。拿60级满级举例，在祭坛前的密道里速刷死灵骷髅，后期15-20s一波才不到50经验，而50级后升一级需要上万经验，这还是维持1.99倍率经验的情况下，也同时意味着玩家不能停止操作，因为一旦停止经验倍率就会过期。我大概留意了一下光从52升到53就花了半个多小时，打到后面都开始意识模糊，所以这种成就即使达成了也毫无成就感，后期完全溢出的矿石和金钱也证明了这种练级毫无意义。

author: {'steamid': '76561197989129610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2001, 'last_played': 1674276175}
review: Once again Ys does it with a solid entry in the franchise. I may not argue it as my favorite so far (I still favor 2 as the one to perfect the formula of the original), but not being my favorite out of a series I have generally loved right down the line does not make it a bad game in any way. If you like action adventure games and don't mind something that is a bit more linear then this genre usually is, it's a very solid game to pick up and play. Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198443072666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1666770521}
review: First time playing an Ys game so my opinion is not educated haha. Has great look for a 3D retro title. The music blew my socks off, fantastic flair. Surprisingly difficult, specifically the boss fights, normal enemies didn't pose a problem but the second I step into a big open circular room I get smeared across the wall, talk about difficulty spikes...wow. The bosses seem to all have a gimmick, you have to puzzle it out on the fly, most will take multiple tries until you figure out what you should be doing. Had a few instances where the next objective wasn't clear, couldn't figure out how to activate the 3 birds boss fight that was clearly supposed to be there, turned out I had to go back to town and talk to a guy and that spawns the encounter, definitely normal for old games but I'd suggest having a guide to reference, saves some time. Overall fun little action RPG, I will definitely be checking out some more Ys games in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967775693', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3348, 'last_played': 1481391808}
review:
고대 왕국 이스와는 상관이 없는 아돌 개인의 모험을 그린 첫 작품.
왕도적인 스토리를 멋진 BGM과 깔끔한 그래픽, 호쾌한 액션으로 잘 살린 게임.
지하 갱도, 유적지, 용암지대, 동굴내부, 설산, 성 내부, 시계탑, 마왕섬 등
JRPG식 모험 하면 떠오르는 다양한 장소들이 게임속 무대이기 때문에,
액션 RPG를 좋아하는 사람이라면 재밌게 즐기기 충분함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099458236', 'num_games_owned': 1666, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1669872814}
review: Ys: The Oath in Felghana does not deviate from the formula that the other games from this era in the series follow, but that is a good thing: more of the same challenging but satisfying combat I've come to love, and even more insanely hard bosses. It's a really fun time! Obligatory purchase for any fan of the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080678213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1674161642}
review:
dejo una review negativa a este juego por un par de motivos, no puede ser que un juego te medio obligue a farmear cerca de un checkpoint por que si te matan y pierdes todo lo que has conseguido, por lo cual te obliga a farmear y farmear par aluego pasarte la dungeon esquivando todo lo que te salga y pillando los cofres.

Por otro lado, los jefes son dificiles si, pero el mayor problema de este juego es que no tienes una manera de curarte en medio de la batalla, depende de algun item que te protege de un par de golpe y poco mas, donde estan nose POCIONES y esas cosas? la historia esta bien pero uff de verdad, que dolor de muelas

Y encima los controles no te deja personalizarlos en mando lo cual si no te gustan pue te jodes :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198293745494', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1674330764}
review:
Elderm Dağları'ndaki buz seviyesini kim tasarladıysa gitsin kafasına baktırsın. Sadist olmayan birinin bunu yapabileceğini sanmıyorum. Üstüne üstlük bir de aynı anda hepsi birbirinden zor bir sürü canavarla uğraşıyorsunuz. Kaç kere ölüp önceki save dosyasından başladım bilmiyorum. Dark Souls hiç oynamadım ama anladığım kadarıyla buna benzer bir his yaşatıyor o da :( Bir parçacık aklım kalmıştı onu da bu oyunla kaybedeceğim :(
Edit: Oyunu bitirdim. Şimdiye kadar oynadığım en zor oyun olabilir ama bitirdim :D Benim kadar zorlanmamanız için bazı ipuçları bırakıyorum. Bu oyunda aldığınız hasarı azaltma konusunda en önemli iki faktör var: seviyeniz ve zırh kuvvetiniz. Bir bossta zorlanırsanız 1-2 seviye daha kazanıp tekrar deneyin. Raval cevheri elde ettikçe başta zırhınızı, sonra da kılıcınızı güçlendirin. Zor bir zindana girdiğinizde zindanı tek oturuşta bitirmeye çalışmayın, canınız 15'in altına düştüğü anda dışarı çıkıp oyunu kaydedin. Yoksa ölüp ölüp durursunuz ve seviye kasmak imkansız olur. Çok zorlanırsanız internetten o bölümün/bossun nasıl geçildiğine bakmayı tercih edebilirsiniz. Herkese iyi oyunlar :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198255015060', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1672883189}
review: Ys Dark Souls

author: {'steamid': '76561198047072384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1672845123}
review:
The worst in the series, all truth be told. Frustrating, the weakest OST by very far amongst the whole series, characters are annoying as fuck,  hells even the reason why the story unfolds is ridiculous. Difficulty is hectic, it has no consistency (something that ached from Ys 1 and 2, this is even worse) and the reason why everyone loves it (iTs hArD) is just not enough to make me actually like it.

Origins was much stronger in all regards.

EDIT: Ah yes, and the fact the game has steam achievements based on ridiculizing the player about the number of times they die against a boss says a lot about the game's design.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083506775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 18676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1708796312}
review:
(28/12/22 to 03/01/23)

11.5 hours of game data progression, and 8.5 hours of lost save data or wasted time on killing bosses. 

The bosses were definitely made when the developers were on crack. This gotta be the best Ys game, despite all the frustration of losing data and spending hours to kill bosses. The story was amazing, along as having the best ending imo. Chester's VA was also probably one of the best I've heard for any English dub anime or game. All the other VA's were good, but no one can compete with Chester. Chester was MVP imo in the game because of his character setting, especially what happened at the ending.

10/10 Underrated Game. Would recommend, if you wanna get angry at a game for being so good and hard for no reason.

-------------------------------------------

Edit 1 - (27/02/23 to 01/03/23):

Just finished Inferno and tried speed running It, It did not indeed go so well. I finished it in about 5hrs and 30 mins, with and overall gameplay of 20 hours.

Honestly there isn't actual that much dialogue and the game feels quite quick when spamming 'a', the only problem to the speedrun was the bosses. I def lost my sanity playing this game as the bosses started to gradually get harder. All bosses after the Gyalva were definitely on crack and I def spend hours on some bosses only to add like 20 mins to the timer. Which is why I had 10 hours of unrecorded bs time due to how rigged the game is. I couldn't even touch the last few bosses half of the time, especially the last boss, not only that but am i pissed that I was 30 mins from getting the 5 hour achievement.

This game is so good, but pisses me off cuz how hard it is. Still a 10/10 imo

-------------------------------------------

Edit 2 - 13/03/23

Completed all the game modes at last. I feel like im losing my sanity. Now the only achievements I need are all the boss rush which I might not do from months now, maybe even years.

-------------------------------------------

Edit 3 - 04/12/23

Decided that I wanted to get the 100% achievement on January 3rd because that is when I completed the game and got the achievement for completing it on normal mode, which was my first run. Yesterday I attempted normal boss rush and it was much easier than I thought. It took me slightly just under 1 hour. 

I then decided that today I could potentialy beat Hard mode on Boss Rush. I just got it done in under 2.5 hrs.

Since all went well I thought what would be a great idea but to do Inferno mode boss rush. I spent almost 4.5 hours fighting Galbalan, which is the final boss before the secret boss. And you will never guess what happened, I died and accidentally shifted down on towards my joystick while pressing 'a' on my controller and pressed onto back to menu. And just like that, half a day's worth of grinding is gone! I'm really starting to lose my sanity againt this game! As much as I like this game, this game makes me feel like im going crazy.

-------------------------------------------

25/12/23

Its Christmas, a time of giving. Rather than finishing it on the 3rd of Jan, I decided to 100% plat the game. Its over!

author: {'steamid': '76561199261855025', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2111, 'last_played': 1672606300}
review:
Ys: The Oath in Felghana is pretty wonderful all things considered. The story, while fairly generic, is propped up by a quality translation and voice acting. The gameplay provides a fulfilling challenge. The campaign is well-paced and expediently does what it needs to. The visuals, barring the dopey character sprites, are gosh darn gorgeous. And the soundtrack is definitely up to the high standards of any Falcom title. All of which amounts to a truly fantastic action RPG, and one that I would recommend with no reservations.

PROS:
✓ Challenging boss fights
✓ Wonderful cast of characters
✓ Magic and melee combine for fast-paced, efficient action
✓ Scalable difficulty suits button mashers and experts alike
✓ Absolutely stunning soundtrack
✓ Nice blend of fighting and platforming

CONS:
- It's over pretty quick
- Platforming is occasionally frustrating
- Tube level design

author: {'steamid': '76561198042393975', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 11293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11282, 'last_played': 1688337355}
review: Ys: The Oath of Felghana is a fantastic and super challenging Action RPG. Extremely tight controls, fast-paced boss battles that take your breath away, a beautiful art style and an incredible soundtrack round up an interesting story about Adol's journey to Dogi's homeland. I cannot recommend this game enough for enthusiasts of high octane and super challenging action games. If you are an achievement hunter you are in for a wild ride!
