author: {'steamid': '76561198957069999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1672513699}
review:
Do I recommand this game? YES and NO.

Currently, I play it in normal mode. It is grindy and the controls are not that good. My impression is that the controls are 'intended' to fail in certain situations such that the game is 'more interesting' (and most annoying). If they would not fail, then the amount of grinding is much more apparant and annoying. This hold for jumping as well as for boss fights. If you do not have the right level the fight is programmed to fail. At any rate you have to grind a lot. Grinding is not a problem if there is enough to discover and there are sufficiently many different monsters. So far, however, this is not really the case. Moreover, it is moooost annoying that the save points are placed only at the start and end of dungeons, i.e if you die you have to start all over  again.

There is some freedom in buying wapons, shields and armory, but I doubt that you will know the best way to do this in the first playthrough. According to the steamcards the game can/should be played at very easy, easy, normal ...
At best I play it at normal mod. That is all for the moment.

Hint. As others, I was not able to get on the mountain, but reducing the frame rate to 60 fps did the trick. (I thank the Discussions to this game!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198038031845', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1671776566}
review:
An YS-y recommendation and a great jumping on point, provided you're cool with a challenge.

This is the sixth Ys game I've played and the third I've completed, and I can say this is tied with Seven as my favorite. To get the obvious out or the way: the music crushes it once again, and this might be the most consistent OST of the games I played. Give it a listen for yourself, but I'm particularly fond of the Castle music. Every track is a hit.

Gameplay wise, this is Classic Ys. Adol only, no weapon damage types, and magic are your bread and butter here. And that gameplay is VERY fast and snappy. Adol controls like a dream, dancing around the environments with each sword slash and magic attack. I never once felt like I wasn't in complete control, and I was able to be offensive while dodging attacks with ease once I learned the patterns.

Speaking of, this game is hard. Most Ys games I would consider a decent challenge, but this is easily the hardest one of the ones I played. Normal mode on this feels comparable to hard in Seven and VIII. However, it never really feels unfair. Once you have good equipment and learn the boss patterns, fights become extremely fun exchanges of getting into a rhythm and learning when to dodge or use magic for defense. The entire flow of the game is just... really nice. 

My Steam time says I have 13.5 hours, but that's counting all my deaths. My actual game time is around eight hours, so it's a much shorter game than the modern ones. That said, I honestly consider it a strength. This game doesn't waste your time at all, and that in turn also leads to the flow being as good as it is.

Without going into spoilers, I can also say I enjoyed the story a good amount. Focusing on a single small town and the people within it was a very good choice, and the decision to give each one their own portraits with dialog that always changes made me want to always talk to everyone after a story beat. Ys games aren't known for the deepest plots, especially compared to how dense Falcom's other series, Trails, is, but I really appreciated everything that was here. Of particular note is the rival of this game, who is easily one of the best characters in the series IMO.

So yeah, all in all, this was an excellent game, and one I can recommend without hesitation, provided you're fine with the challenge. Especially if you want something on the shorter side.

review: There are games that are satisfyingly difficult, and then there are games that are just frustrating. Unfortunately this game is the latter, and it's largely due to save points being placed only at the start and end of dungeons, which means if you die, you start all over.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968608379', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1671449504}
review: Bossess are waaay too dark souls like. You've got like 150 HP while the boss has 1200. You do like 10-20 damage with one hit, while they do 30-40. You get hit 4 times and you're gone, while the bosses takes tens of hits. It's simply too frustrating. That and the fact the jump-wind art move needed to move around doesn't fire correctly 75% of the times, and that is needed to move around in the maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050306828', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1595656394}
review:
Remake de la tercera entrega númerada de Ys, Oath in Felgana es el segundo ys hecho en un engine 3d y es fenomenal. Superando lo que ya construia Ark in napishtim, Ys Oath in felgana nos trae otra de las muchas aventuras de Adol, el chad de chads, el rompe corazones de waifus y friendzoner profesional. 

Oath in felgana es un action-jrpg simple, que como sus antecesores basa su disfrute en la sensación de aventura, interesantes mazmorras, jefes badass, música aún mas badass y un gameplay simple pero adictivo. Un juego igual relativamente corto en comparación de otros titulos del genero, pero que resulta muy satisfactorio porque lo que sabe hacer, lo hace muy bien. 

La historia esta vez nos llega con voces, doblada, y personalmente encontre el doblaje en ingles muy disfrutable. Es entretenida de principio a fin y nos regala momentos igualmente entretenidos. Un juego bastante solido, barato y un muy buen Ys sobre todo.

review: This was my introduction to the Ys series, and since then I've played Ys 1/2, Origins, and Celceta. The action combat is great and since I like grindy games, I enjoy this series. It does come from a time when games were difficult and usually required patience and multiple attempts in order to learn the techniques required for boss fights, but back then games also included a much greater sense of accomplishment for completing them. This is one such game where progress feels good, and I highly recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965984883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1669702752}
review:
The good thing is that this game has a normal difficulty, the bad thing is that it's called easy. If you like to grind and a guarantee that you will replay bosses after losing to completely uncommunicated expectations, this is the game you have been looking for. The very easy difficulty exists if your just done with this, but it's fairly mindless, and really, the game is kind of mindless altogether, you can choose to blow through it, or drag through it, skill doesn't change how tedious and protracted defense phases are in this game, and you can replay the entire game at a lower difficulty faster than grind up to a manageable DPS.

Seriously, there's something wrong with a game that has a very easy mode, if easy mode isn't easy, than they clearly didn't have good judgement. The Dark Souls Trilogy is easier than normal mode on this game, not that they are that hard, but the BS should be reserved for ppl who want to be abused.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311552616', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1669584684}
review: Nice story, addictive combat, great platforming. The Ys series at it's finest!

author: {'steamid': '76561199064360079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4883, 'last_played': 1698523109}
review:
이스3편의 리메이크 작품인데 최고 난이도 인페르노를 기준으로 본다면 역대급으로 어려운 이스 시리즈라고 할 수 있다. 2회차 인계플레이 이런거 일절 없으므로 똥손이라면 보스전 직전마다 레벨노가다, 장비강화 고생문을 각오해야 하며 보스의 패턴을 파악하고 패턴별 회피요령을 익혀야 한다. 시계탑 정상에서의 체스터2차전의 경우 갈바란보다 어렵기로 정평이 나 있다. 지령팔찌를 얻게 되면 스킬로 가드가 가능한데 이걸 제대로 활용하지 못한다면 인페르노 보스전은 말 그대로 지옥불이다.
도전과제 100% 달성하기도 매우 골룸하기 이를 데 없다. 나이트메어로 보스러시 끝내라고 하는 도전과제는 그렇다쳐도 갈바란을 노대미지로 잡으라고 하는게 있는데 도전과제 하려다가 게임을 때려칠 수도 있을 것 같다. 난이도는 상관없고 고인물들의 유튜브 공략영상을 보며 패턴을 익히면 불가능한건 아닐 거라 보지만 난 못하겠다.
엘레나 스토다트의 일본어 담당성우는 노나카 아이인데 내가 아는게 맞다면 팔콤 3대 타이틀에 모두 출연한 유일한 성우일 것이다. 또 있었나?
이 무렵에 제작된 이스 시리즈는 아무데서나 세이브가 되지 않고 정령비나 행신 포인트에서만 가능한데 이르반즈 유적이나 시계탑은 세이브 포인트 간격이 길어서 가다가 중간에 죽어버리면 깊은 빡침이 오게 될 것이다. 게다가 아돌의 소위 '광합성'이 되지 않아서, 정령의 옷을 입기 전에는 체력에 신경쓰며 플레이해야 된다.
더 나중에 나온 게임이기는 하지만 이스 셀세타의 수해에서 보면 아돌이 그란루한테서 보검 하나를 받는데 이게 있었다면 본작 엔딩이 달라지지 않았을까 생각해본다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198687277', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1854, 'last_played': 1668663209}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000644707', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1649300141}
review:
Ys: The Oath in Felghana, is a Falcom remake of Hudsons Ys3: Wanderers of Ys. The game incorporates Falcom's new gameplay style, seen in Ys Origin which involves a much more modern take on the RPG style, with dedicated jumping, attacking and item buttons. Story wise, this takes place immediately after Ys2, though aside from Dogi, there isn't much requirement to play Ys1 and 2. There is alot to unpack about this game, much of it good. 

The first major caveat, as implied in my Origin review, is the combat and visual style. These two combine together to make a fantastic Ys title. The game, and especially large scale structures, look brilliant in the partially 2d pixel visual format. This 3d space also allows bosses and enemies to make more interesting movements and do more unique attack (compared to what was able on 2d Ys titles). Much of the foundation of Ys origin returns, with 3 major types of magic existing (Earth, Wind and Fire) for use by the player, with some basic attacks such as plunging attacks, a normal combo, jumping attacks etc. 

The main enjoyment of this games combat is the enemies movesets and player creativity with use of the 3 defined spell types, much like how Fromsoftware games are often praised for their enjoyable combat, Ys is similar in that regard. Whilst Souls combat isn't very deep (It can be boiled down to dodge, attack for the most part), Ys is similar, whilst it rewards good mechanical skill and smart thinking, the addictive nature of the dodging, counter attacking and learning of enemy moves is truly what made me enjoy it so much. This was best achieved with the final boss of the game, which had well defined miniphases which made me constantly shift my way of thinking. In Nightmare, it was a treat to slowly get through each miniphase with a bit more HP than before - visually representing ones mastery. Overall, the assessment of Oath's combat is much like mine of Origins, the gameplay is fantastic especially for bosses - for trash mobs, this can be hit or miss dependent on the area, though often its pretty good. The need for farming is still annoying though. The level design is alot of fun, especially castle Valestein, and the various stages of platforming makes for some very unique venues for bosses and fighting enemies (clock tower, looking at you). 

The music and story in this game are also not to be taken lightly. Whilst the story still is basic, there is quite the attachment to characters and area in this game. I found myself engrossed in the land of Felghana, despite only being wanderer there. The direct connection to Dogi gave me reason to help the people, and seeing their stories only made me go further. I really enjoyed the history that was hinted at the land by those who talk to Dogi - suggesting that the land had gone into disarray whilst he was in Esteria. This really makes you feel like a hero who is saving a land that is slowly getting overrun by monsters. The character of Chester was a major unexpected interest for me, presenting a character that I simply just didn't expect. The addition of voice acting (the English is to be praised in this) is also welcomed. As for the music, this game had a ton of amazing tracks, as Ys does. Sealed time and Valestein castle are my personal favourites, really matching the pace of the level I feel. This game, out of the Ys trilogy and this definitely won in terms of the music used, though 2 comes in as a close second. 

One last thing I'd like to mention is the side content, there was alot of cool things to find in Felghana, you were much more rewarded for exploring and doing side content than Origin or the prior games, which I highly appreciate. This also allowed you to further understand the plights of the villagers or the history of Dogi - both of which were equally interesting. The various secrets you can uncover are recommended if you are a thorough player.  

Overall, whilst not my favourite, The Oath in Felghana is a strong contender again due to it's charm as a simplistic old game I think. The modernisation brought by falcoms revising really helps the game shine and I think this game would act as a strong entry point for a new player. Though, if they are willing to get this game then they might as well just start with Origin as it better makes sense chronologically, if they want to avoid bump system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192651930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1687, 'last_played': 1701401080}
review: Absolutely lovely game. For the first Ys game with voice acting I've played (although from what I understand, the English dub was added to this version relatively recently), I'll have to say best vocal performance goes to Derek Stephen Prince as Chester, as much as I loved hearing Heather Hogan doing her Colette voice in another game. Intrinsically more difficult than Ys Origin; I played on very easy and still found myself dying a few times. Ys Origin had three campaigns that felt a little too long if you marathoned them; this game is just the length I expect for an early Ys game (despite what Steam says, my save file says around 8 hours and 40 mins). Absolute must-play if you like action RPGs

author: {'steamid': '76561198082198047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2163, 'last_played': 1676267653}
review:
This was my first Ys game and it left a very good impression!

Pros:
+I'll start with the reason I know what Ys is in the first place: The soundtrack. HOLY SHIT IT IS SO GOOD. Every track is a joy to listen to. And it's not just Oath in Felghana; I've explored the OSTs for several other Ys games, too, and they all had a consistent, high level of quality. Ys has, hands down, one of the best soundtracks of any franchise I've ever played, rivaling Undertale, Touhou Project, and others.
+The character portraits (the ones that appear during dialogue) look great. Everyone's design is memorable and distinct.
+I liked the voice acting, you could really tell that the VAs were having fun with the characters. I especially liked Chester's VA!
+Despite being confined to a pair of islands, the world manages to give a distinct look to all of its different areas and dungeons. The dungeons themselves make for good platforming.
+The combat system is engaging, easy to understand, and fast-paced - good for those looking for something that isn't turn-based.
+The bosses all present their own challenges, with each one having different strengths and weaknesses. All of them, though, will keep you on your toes from beginning to end!

Neutral:
*The story and characters are pretty basic. The plot isn’t *bad* but it relies on a lot of common tropes, [spoiler]including the quintessential anime quest to "kill god," which I adore. The ending also goes out of its way to be tragic, which doesn't work that well[/spoiler].
*Hard game is hard. Really hard. I played this on the Normal difficulty and still struggled with almost every single boss (but there are easier settings you can choose). Apparently that's just par for the course with this series. Personally, I like a challenge, but I'm putting this in the neutral column just because I don't view game difficulty as an inherently good or bad thing - everyone's views are different.

Cons:
-Overworld graphics haven't aged all that well. Understandable, because the game is 17 years old at this point, but still.
-The difficulty spikes had me reeling. If you're not careful (and, sometimes, even if you are) you'll quickly find yourself getting overwhelmed by all the enemies in the dungeon, and the game will turn from a hack-and-slash dungeon crawl into a desperate sprint for the nearest save point so you can heal (granted, you can buy healing potions. I didn't because I'm cheap). Backtracking doesn't do you many favors, either, because enemies reset every time you enter a new area. This isn't a huge complaint because whenever I found myself in this position, it usually meant I was due for a weapons/armor upgrade. That plus some moderate grinding always cleared the problem right up.
-The game uses save points, which I've never liked. Early on, you do get an item which lets you teleport to them from anywhere on the map, so they're at least good for quick navigation.
-You can't pause during boss fights, and if you die during a boss fight, your only options are to either quit the game or restart right at the start of the fight, instead of the last save point. I did not like this. [b]PSA: Save immediately before and after every boss battle[/b].

Tl;dr Overall, while the visuals and story aren’t anything to write home about, this game has a great combat system, good dungeons, really challenging and unique bosses, and a kickass OST. Perfect for those looking for a solid, classic JRPG fantasy experience. I look forward to exploring the rest of the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028558172', 'num_games_owned': 1044, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1666819820}
review:
Ys The Oath in Felghana is a remake of Ys III: Wanderers of Ys from 1989, so it's safe to say this is the third game in the series. However, unlike Ys II, which is connected to Ys I, Ys III has a different story, with no mention of the previous story, so if this is your first Ys game, you can play this without worrying about missing lore.

This game unlike Ys I and II is much different. For starters, 3D graphics with 2D sprites, very identical to Legend Of Heroes Trails in the Sky series (after all, they are both made by Falcom). Second biggest change is no more pressing forward to attack, meaning you know have to press a button to attack, and the third biggest change is jump. Combined all that makes Ys Oath in Felghana a unique game in the series.

At first I was a bit skeptical about these changes, making the game feel more like a hack and slasher platformer, but when I actually first tasted the combat, it was extremely fun. I later realized how improved this combat was over the first two games, and how much boss battles are a lot more fun.

Actually I would say, everything is improvement over the first two games. The game is longer, more challenging, more awesome music, more memorable characters, better story...

So here is my final thoughts: If you liked Ys I and II, you will like this even more. If you disliked Ys I and II's combat mechanic, then try this game and maybe you will change your mind. 

However if this is your first entry to the Ys, that's completely fine too! As of now, Ys Oath in Felghana is my favorite Ys game, so I give it full thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561199083682818', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1666414513}
review:
[h1]历代最难的一部伊苏【8.3/10】[/h1]
[h1]难！是真的难！[/h1]
前两个boss都打了几十遍，几十遍啊！我算是伊苏N党，一周目都是打的normal，打过伊苏O，6，7，树海，8，9，姑且算是有点基础的（主要指打过O，6，后面伊苏越做越简单了），然后一到boss战就被吊打。如果手残的剧情党（感觉剧情也不多）建议不要一周目normal。
[h1]很多横版的地图设计[/h1]
这是我玩这部伊苏感触最深的，与6，O相比算是一个特色，这样的设计感觉有好有坏吧，这样的设计使得跳跃的难度提高了，但同时更不容易迷路吧。
取消冲跳斩，新增二段跳。可喜可贺！我之前给6的冲跳斩虐的死去活来，但是跳跃难度比起起源还是高上不少，后面依然给跳跃虐的死去活来（感觉是受到视角限制不知道落脚点在哪里）。
[h1]杰出的音乐[/h1]
玩之前就看到很多评论吹这作的音乐，确实不错，当然6，F，O三部的音乐质量都很高。
[h1]爽快的打击感[/h1]
这作爆气的攻速加成高，打起来非常爽快，加上黄手镯的格挡，小怪一路莽过去问题不大。战斗系统相比6更加完善，刷级也相对更好刷，节奏得到优化。但是每次进入新地图都会被小怪按在地上摩擦，除非拿到新的装备，这点6和起源的平衡做的更好，当然这三作的共通点都是等级对战斗产生影响很大，多升个一两级，手残也能过boss。
[h1]有趣的boss战设计[/h1]
也许是被虐的次数过多了，感觉这一作的boss节奏把控的最好，半血boss就会改变出招方式，以及拥有更长的无敌时间（然后game over了），这作的boss钻研时间最长，感觉都跟boss打出感情了......当然，有趣的还是最后boss的那个传球，感觉打击感非常......音游？整体的难度感觉我是在打东方，满屏的“弹幕”，豆子在中间钻空隙......当然黄手镯的格挡相当好用，可惜消耗太大，不能连续多次使用。
[h1]剧情方面俗套[/h1]
剧情质量和6差不多，内容是比较精简的，甚至感觉剧情走向也是差不多的，收集完后幕后黑手出现，召唤最终boss，豆子打完拯救世界（没有豆子的话，世界已经毁灭多少次了啊！），感觉和6一样都是重战斗轻剧情的，剧情方面要求不必过高。
[h1]总结[/h1]
这部伊苏的整体水平不错，也许是受了时代影响，个人对F的感觉没有那么神作，相比6，O来说，还是O的感觉最好，不过就算没有那么亮眼，也算是值得一玩的佳作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198851864936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1701738069}

author: {'steamid': '76561198850888839', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1665634806}
review:
I would give this 2/5 stars, but I can't really dis-recommend it, so that's why I'm giving it a thumbs-up. It looks very similar to Origins, but there isn't much similarity other than that (and some recurring items/skills). The bosses are far too difficult. I died a few times on the very first boss on very easy mode, which I think is pretty ridiculous. There aren't even any healing items or dodge ability. Given the boss difficulty, I probably wouldn't have even finished the game if I hadn't found out how to turn on debug mode and cheat my character to be powerful enough to breeze through. (Some people might like a challenge in games. In some cases, at least, I just want to be able to experience the story.)

The story, in my opinion, was pretty weak. It was rather generic for the most part. There were some interesting twists, and Chester kind of had an interesting thing going on. But in the end, it went for some pretty cliche turns, needless tragedy when a happy ending would have been far more satisfying, and what I think was meant to be a generally happy ending just left me feeling kind of sad and lonely. So, the story just didn't hit me very well, and it could have been a lot better.

I played it with the English voice dub, and while it was nice to have it, most of the acting was not all that good. Too cartoonish. Some characters, like the innkeeper lady, were particularly horrible. Most were just ... not that great. Some were fine. 

Overall, a pretty 'meh' experience for me, but I don't really want to give it a thumbs-down because it wasn't *that* bad. But if you're thinking of playing it mostly for the story, I would not really recommend it for that. (Even if you're a huge Ys fan, unless you're specifically a big Dogi fan, I'm not sure how much you'd get out of the story. Adol, the star, is a silent protagonist with no personality or ability to react in this one.)

Well the yes is a kind of excessive.  This is a middle ground.  I love Ys games and this is no exception but the damn controls.  Why is the jump on the opposite side to the special when the two go together.

Other than that, this is Ys Origin but not as good.

If you don't have Ys Origin, then get that instead.  Although I'm not sure what the Ys Origin buttons are like on Steam as I have it on PS4 and Switch.  Yes both, cos I like it that much and yes Origin smashes Ys8.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073017457', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1656847721}
review: 曾以为玩不下去现在的游戏的原因是因为审美疲劳，而过去游戏数量少，自己的选择也不多，所以会觉得格外好玩，直到最近补票重温伊苏F。依然好玩到停不下来，2.5D的画面依然精致而不过时，音乐依然抓耳秉承jdk一贯的高水准，而难度也依然是印象中的那个划破天际的高。正常难度不刻意练级，你会享受黑魂版的受苦待遇。这里要点名杜兰同学，游戏中的第一场boss战和倒数第二场boss战居然都是她，并且从始至终的虐的我情绪激动，口吐芬芳。

author: {'steamid': '76561198269288609', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2253, 'last_played': 1705562821}
review: So I'm going to start this off by saying I have never been good at ARPGS. I started the Ys series with VIII but I didn't really enjoy it too much . I remember hearing praise for this and Origin so I decided to give these games a shot . I fell in love with the gameplay which is rare since I suck at arpgs so this was new to me . I Played Origin on hard since I played VIII on hard as well so I decided to do Oath on nightmare , It took me 36 hours to finish the game which is apparently a lot longer than the average time . I got my ass kicked by bosses multiple times but it was always fun even though I was getting my shit rocked . The bosses are memorable / the ost is great as well . Overall this game is honestly a 10/10 .

author: {'steamid': '76561198151630143', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1700446672}
review:
This is almost certainly my favorite Ys game of all time. I've played some of the newer ones as well as the older ones, and by far, the 2.5D is my favorite of Ys's many engines. The story is amazing, the characters are great, and above all else, the gameplay is really fun and entertaining. Soundtrack is brilliant as well.

Amazing game that I would recommend to anyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983545926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1658600439}
review:
I've given this game a few tries now. So far, the only way I can describe these Ys 'revival' games is obtuse. Some of the bosses in this game don't really make a lot of sense until you randomly do something and realize it won't hurt you; or you just look up a guide and realize you're already running the strat but it's not working. I also didn't appreciate that the trick to beating the first boss was 'Run all the way back to town and buy a new weapon' otherwise you'll only chip away at their health. Ys Origin had these problems to a lesser, more tolerable extent. For the minimal story, I've already lost interest to keep playing this game with questionable pacing and design.

It does have nice art direction, but for the pacing and other problems, I'd give it a pass. I will say, I read that these were ports of Japanese PS2 games from the mid-2000's 'revival' era. Perhaps the console versions aren't as bad, but it seems like this version is still too rough around the edges for me to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427272513', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 3844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3844, 'last_played': 1658546749}
review:
パーティ制になるより前の、主人公アドルが一人で戦う頃のお話。クリアタイムは約8時間。ボスが強く、戦い方が身に着くまではVeryEasyでも何度かやられるくらい。操作にはもたつきがなく、ボスの猛攻を耐えしのぶのが苦しくもあり撃破したときの喜びも増しました。手強いボスとアレンジ楽曲がアクションをより際立たせます。

[h1]日本語化可能[/h1]
ストアページでは未対応表記の日本語ですが、ダウンロードファイルに含まれていました。簡単なファイルの差し替えで言語切り替えできます。方法は検索で。音声の方もどうにかすれば変えられますが、ごく一部のボスの掛け声くらいで『イースSEVEN』ほどの恩恵はありません。FHDの解像度にも対応されていました。FHD化前は隠れていた部分が見切れるのは許容範囲内。
完全にとはいかないまでも、不自由なく日本語でプレイできました。

[h1]攻撃手段が多彩なボス戦[/h1]
1周クリアに数時間といったところですが、凝ったボスが多いからかそれ以上にプレイしてる感覚がありました。第一、第二形態と変化するボス、HP減少や選択難易度で攻撃パターンが追加されるボス、新しく入手したリングアーツを活かすボス。どの敵も毎回異なるアクションが求められ、創意がみられます。
しかしボス戦は基本的に逃げ回りつつ隙をうかがってちまちま削る戦法となります。場全体に弾をばら撒く様はまるで弾幕STGかのよう。行動パターンを頭に入れて弾幕をかわした後に攻撃します。殴り合うと勝てません。近年のイースシリーズにある「戦闘中の回復アイテム」「手軽にダメージが出せるスキル」「フラガなどの攻撃無効化」を経験していると、そこが辛く感じるときもありました。
慣れれば私は最高難易度Infernoでもクリアできましたし、全実績解除までやり込むくらいはまりました。同じシステムの『イースVI -ナピシュテムの匣-』よりアクションが洗練されています。

[h1]ボタン配置変更の勧め[/h1]
リングアーツを溜めながらジャンプ直後に攻撃する場面が多々あります。コントローラを使っていると初期設定のボタン配置だと同時押しがしづらく、思うように戦えません。そこで私のボタン設定を書き残しておきます。ゲーム内はコントローラのキーコンフィグ未対応のため、Steamクライアント側で変更します。表記はXbox基準。括弧内は元のボタン。
・LB…リングアーツ（X）
・RB…リング切り替え（LB）
・A…ジャンプ（B）
・X…攻撃（A）
・Start…メニュー（RS押し）

戦い方のコツも。下突きを入れると多段ヒットしやすい。リングアーツで攻撃キャンセルでき、キャンセルした分属性も乗る。「ダッシュ習得後は常に使用」にチェックする。実は地のアーツで攻撃が無効化できる。
難易度を上げながら周回していると自然と身に着く技かもしれませんが、これらを意識すると攻撃効率にだいぶ差が出ます。

[h1]まとめ[/h1]
難しいけれど短時間でさくっと終えられます。言語、解像度ともにプレイ環境に支障ありません。近年のイースとは戦闘の感覚に違いがありますが、キビキビとしたアクションはこの頃から健在で楽曲もノリノリ。「バレスタイン城」とかもう入った瞬間からテンション上がりっぱなしです。
弾幕を張るボスとの戦い方に順応できさえすれば、やりごたえがあって燃えるアクションでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198124014248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 1400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1400, 'last_played': 1657849871}
review:
Ys: Oath in Felghana is everything one would expect from the Ys series; good music, fast paced action and masochistic difficulty. This game belongs to the "one character, three kinds of magic" gameplay style, which also includes Ys: The Ark of Napishtim and Ys: Origin.
I should also mention that Oath in Felghana is a remake of Ys III, but it's not strictly necessary to play the Ys games in order, although it does enhance the story aspect if you do. This entry has voice acting too, but it's trash so I recommend lowering the voice volume to 0. 
However, the music remains excellent and it's possible to play with the older versions too so that's neat. This isn't a 1:1 remake either (especially since the original is a sidescroller) so there are new bosses, enemies and such. I think the new content in the second portion of the game is specially good, once you have all the magic types and encounters are designed for that.  
That being said, I have some reservations about certain bosses in the nightmare difficulty, which is usually the best to play since it gives enemies new attacks instead of merely inflating their health values. The Ys series is largely skill based so it's a bit of a shame that Gyalva and Gildias exist to introduce a significant amount of RNG into the equation. Some stuff feels like a step backwards from The Ark of Napishtim and Origin.
To conclude, I think the game is pretty good. I would definitely recommend it to people who already like the Ys series and want more of it, or pretty much anyone who likes top-down action games. It's weaker than Origin, and possibly The Ark of Napishtim too, but it's still pretty good on its own right anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999661840', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1657888057}
review: Ys, one of the most underrated action rpgs we have. Oath in felghana offered killer soundtrack, smooth action and stability from start to finish without any crashes, the only thing that this game is missing is the TurboGrafx-16/PC Engine CD soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085514359', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4150, 'last_played': 1657744783}
review:
Encore un bon YS (Et probablement le meilleur par rapport au autre YS avec le même gameplay.)
Le jeu se termine en environ 10-15h en mode normal.
Les musiques sont bien et l'histoire est correcte (sans plus)

Le gameplay par contre, oui il est bon et tellement bon que les boss sont fun à faire même quand ils sont très difficile.

Pour la difficulté maximum, vous allez devoir apprendre les paternes des boss.
Au début vous allez vous dire "Mais c'est impossible WTF"
Puis en progressant pas à pas dans les stratégies du boss, vous allez probablement vous dire "Ouai en fait il est bidon, trop facile"

La progression du personnage est très importante et se fait ressentir contre les monstres / boss.
1 Level pour avoir une grande importance.

Du coup ouai, je recommande ce jeu si vous voulez un bon JRPG à l'ancienne avec un bon système de combat et de progression sans trop se prendre la tête sur l'histoire qui est "OK" tier.


---------------
Road to 100%
---------------

Alors pour finir le jeu à 100%, vous pouvez compter entre 50-75h sans problème.
Des hauts qui seront répétitif, du grind bien violent et un challenge qui une fois accompli récompense le joueur mais aussi donne une satisfaction particulière et un gout de victoire sur le jeu.

Le boss rush est ma foi bien dosé mais reste quand même bien plus compliqué par rapport au mode histoire donc armé vous de courage et de patience, les bonne stratégie paie toujours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972907969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1655369168}
review:
Simple, fun, basic action RPG. The Ys series is among my favorites and this is a solid, old school feeling title. More in line with Origins if I recall than Celceta but an absolute blast and overall solid game. 

Exploration, dungeon crawling, various armor and weapon sets that can be upgraded, etc. Classic Ys. Game play is simple with a jump button, attack and at certain points you acquire a bracelet which allows magic attacks. Great game well worth checking out if you're into the series or even if you're just into old school RPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049337033', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1659645687}
review:
[h1]Ремейк третей части серии Ys.[/h1]
[i]И, скажу вам, достаточно удачный.[/i]
Одна из самых сложных игр серии. Самая неприятная игра серии. Но, внезапно, не в коем случае неплохая игра. 
Геймплей:
Изометрический хакенслеш с кнопкой атаки и магическими умениями. Герой управляется бодро, хитбоксы почти не раздражают, монстры весело крошатся на куски. Ну а боссы рвут на куски уже игрока. Баланс у игры шатает во все стороны и иногда она ОЧЕНЬ сильно раздражает. Особенно на максимальной сложности.
Графика: Для начала нулевых, достаточно приятная. Анимации красивые, атаки боссов хорошо считываются.
Музыка: Как обычно легендарна. Ys и этим все сказано.
Сюжет. Достаточно простенькая история про очередное злобное зло которое хочет пробудиться. На свою беду, в том месте где объявился Адол. Хорошие персонажи и несколько "вотэтоповорот" в комплекте.
Хороший, годный Ys, но, зараза, сложный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375305183', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1536, 'last_played': 1613060649}
review:
I don't know why I haven't reviewed the game back when I played but... Oath in Felghana is one of my favourite Ys games! I'd say it's a little worse than Origin gameplay-wise, with slightly less cool elemental powers and much more so-so boss battles, but other than those two, OiF still has that sweet, addicting Ys gameplay with a cool visual style and ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE MUSIC. Plus, it features a lovely retelling of Wanderers of Ys's story and world, which really needed to get out of its original game - widely considered to be the black sheep of the series ><

But yeah! I don't love it as much as Ys Origin - I also find checkpoints to be a little *too* spaced out - but I can absolutely still recommend this game! It's really, REALLY fun <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198025151422', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1653365357}
review:
It's just the 2005 version with voice acting (finally) injected. If you want the better experience, play the PSP version, which features:
- All dialogues voiced
- Switch Accessory button
- Double Boost so you can heal some in a pinch
- New Game Plus! (which makes any difficulty above Hard doable)

Only downsides of the PSP version are that it has low res textures and sprites, and is not available (unless you use illegal means, or that you buy used).

It's also worth noting the RNG can create unavoidable attacks during bosses (one of which can happen DURING THE BOSS INTRO, when you can't move!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198121413521', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1697502477}
review:
For a game released in 2005, the story and characters are so good. Played it on my PSP before and revisiting it on PC with enchanced features made me appreciate it so much yet again.

🔵 PC port is excellent, has unlocked framerate for a game released in 2005
🔵 Really good story which is fully-voiced
🔵 The voice-overs were really awesome
🔵 Combat is simple, but the game is quite challenging especially the boss fights
🔵 Every NPC has unique portraits which makes it quite a unique and interesting experience to talk with them

author: {'steamid': '76561197994157254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1652846855}
review:
An absolute banger of a game. Top tier Ys - you've gotta play it if you like JRPGs. 

So far playing Ys in chronological order per the story I'd rate them the following:

Ys Oath == Ys Origin == Ys I/2 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Ys Celceta

Basically every game I've played in the Ys series so far has been phenomenal except Celceta which was a solid 5 or 6 out of 10. The rest are all solid 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020798482', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1651916518}
review:
Absolutely love the YS series, but I would only recommend this if you're a hardcore fan of the franchise who wants to experience the old entries. The game itself is a solid arpg with an okay combat system. The boss encounters however feel bad due to dated graphics which make it hard to navigate and avoid attacks and badly telepgraphed mechanics, which will often leave you with a feeling of disappointment after thinking you've avoided something but the game disagrees and kills you. There's also a lot of randomness and one shot attacks. A boss can be a cakewalk if it randomly decides to use the attack that exposes it to damage twifce in a row, or it can be undoable if it chains an attack that's close to unavoidable 3-4 times. Would definitely not recommend playing this on higher difficulty settings, this is likely to just end in frustration and/or require excessive grinding to even stand a chance.

This isn't PSP port as one might think, so it doesn't have a New Game+ mode, and all the changes from the newer version, such as elixirs giving +10 hp instead of +1. All the challenges and achievements that require you to complete different difficulty levels require playing from scratch every time, and because the game offers no variance at all it just gets boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561199057984845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1651248369}

author: {'steamid': '76561198247130576', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1651042363}
review:
The way I understand it, Ys : The Oath in Felghana is a 'remake' of Ys 3 : Wanderers from Ys, a game that was poorly received at launch back on the SNES. They took the music and remastered it, making a rough retelling of the story and a completely different kind of gameplay. I haven't played the original, and i'm only getting around to really getting into these games this year. How's it hold up?

Pretty awesome game! Probably my favorite Ys title that i've played, out of the four i've picked up so far. The combat is nice, killing standard enemies requires enough tact that it's not too braindead, the game doesn't really go out of it's way to waste your time (fast travel anywhere), it's pretty easy to level up if you're behind, I liked the story okay, it's pretty standard. The music is badass, and the bosses require actual strategy, it's not just a dps race. 

I will say, you can definitely tell when you're underleveled, or when you skipped a new weapon/sword in a dungeon. Also, strangely, there's a lot of content and items not in this game that are in the PSP version, namely a enhanced version of the boost gauge. I think so far, this is my favorite Ys game. I'm moving on to Napishtim next, which visually looks similar, so i'm hoping for another great experience like with this game. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208281208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1696, 'last_played': 1651010989}
review:
Een vet spel waar ik enorm van genoten heb, loopt super op 4k met een ryzen 5800x en een gtx 1080.
De caracters en verhaal lijn zijn allebei super en zeker de moeite waard.
In deze 28 uur ben ik op normall tot lvl 52 gekomen vd 60, hier zat wel een paar uur grinding in.

Jammergenoeg heeft de laatste baas het spel verziekt, (Gabalan) deze was zo moeilijk dat ik het niet heb uitgespeeld en het einde op youtube heb bekeken, zeer jammer want ik heb genoten van de rest.

Houd je van een goed verhaal en vind je oldschool grapichs mooi dan is dit zeker een aanrader.
Klaar is ook echt klaar hiermee. 
Bazen zijn alleen veel moeilijker dan de rest van het spel ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064592485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1648886462}
review:
It was recommend for newcomers to the Ys series start here. The Ys games thrive on simple combat-centric mechanics that make the player work to beat the game rather than ease you into it. The settings and music liven up the experience to wrap it all neatly into a bombastic action-adventure.
The story is dreadful, boring, voice-acting and plot remain entirely painful. Some people say  Oath In Felghana is the best of the series, don’t want to see the worst.
It was a really fun, challenging game until get very repetitive and grinding. I played in normal difficult, fucking mistake. 
This game was my first and the last to the Ys series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973220761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1597, 'last_played': 1648760207}
review:
Review in 2022

Ok, to enjoy this game you really need to approach it correctly: it's not a normal action rpg, it's more similar to a souls like. Sure, trash mode are easier, but boss fight are hard even at normal difficulty and sometimes you'll need to grind a lot to be prepared enough. 
How does it play in 2022? Well , quite ok: graphics in 2k look crisp and pleasant. Just check for vsync or any form of FPS limiting form because it goes up to 1k plus FPS quite easely and this break game dinamics ( you can't double jump properly).

author: {'steamid': '76561198186530370', 'num_games_owned': 2632, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1861, 'last_played': 1648520180}
review:
The Ys series has undergone numerous changes throughout the years, but the things which really define it - difficult well designed boss encounters, simple to learn but challenging to master gameplay, insane difficulty options, and kick ass soundtracks - are all brought together to such a high polish in Oath of Felghana. 

I would suggest that newcomers to the series start here - you're introduced to Adol, the main protagonist of the series, but aren't required to know any of the lore of Ys to fully appreciate the game. I think the more linear storyline - a solid affair which ends on a genuine tearjerker followed by a moment of complete badassitude - would also ease newcomers into the series as well, as Origins (similar in gameplay to Oath) is a bit tangential at times. 

Buy it, love it, get your ass kicked by bosses, come back again for more on Insane difficulty - not even punching down walls with your bare hands can match this level of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016859256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 6506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6437, 'last_played': 1672657499}
review:
In my opinion, the best action rpg of all time.

It blends adventure game roleplaying with platforming, bullet-hell shmup elements, and challenging hack and slash. Dungeons play like manic murder gauntlet obstacle courses where you run and jump and slash and dodge through countless enemies and platforming sequences at breackneck speed. Boss fights have you running all over the arena like a super mobile madman dodging shmup-esque danmaku attacks and varied, creative patterns. There is absolutely no other game like this on the market that combines so many oldschool arcadey genres into one cohesive whole.

Even the story/writing has soul. Every NPC has a face and constantly updates their dialogue throughout. The story is simple and archetypal 16-bit era jrpg stuff (it IS a remake of a 90's game, after all) but characters have just enough depth in their dialogue to feel like actual people.

If I had to name a flaw it's that the game is pretty brutal on hard/nightmare but at the same time some might find the beginning of normal mode a bit tepid, so it can feel hard to recommend to newcomers. But that's minor.

I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171229350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3181, 'last_played': 1643479273}
review:
Beautiful and addictive game with a greast OST.
Interesting boss battles that resemble bullet hell shooters, every boss has a unique mechanic, learning the patterns is challenging and satisfying.
Recommended to anyone that likes JRPGs with action combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112447748', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1703880914}
review:
It's satisfying to play and the challenge is ok. It's an old game so sometimes the input lags when jumping, or nothing happens at all when you press jump.
I have played YS I and II, Origins and Lacrimosa of Dana before this and I just myself liking the combat and exploration. Like YS I and II this is also quite straightforward in story and exploration. The combat isn't too hard and the bosses are fun, I've mostly needed a few tries to get through some and more to get through others.
There is a bit of a need to grind to get through every boss but I feel like that's okay.
Other than the jump at times the controls are very nice and responsive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350999370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1642722022}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975850292', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1642673858}
review:
적당한 볼륨 지만 난 세일가에 사서 아주 만족.
게임 전체적으로 영어 성우가 아주 마음에 드는데 특히 엘레나 성우 연기가 아주 마음에 든다.
적당한 시나리오. 적당한 탐색범위원하는 난이도의 적을 썰고 나가면 되는 게임.
아무튼 베리에이션은 요즈음 게임에 비해서 적기는 하지만 그 말은 반대로 생각하면 머리 아플것도 적다는 이야기. 

간단한 스낵 옆에 두고 아돌의 모험을 체험해 보고 싶은 분에게 추천한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838897166', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1642559588}
review: Another action RPG gem by Nihon Falcom. Fast-paced action and epic music. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198838324179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1635672070}
review: If you want a fast paced stay on your toes introduction into the Y's series, then look no further. Or if you just want a fun challenging game by all means and dive right in. It's not a long game, and that's perfect for the busy adult or those that work longer hours. 10-15 hrs of fun depending on how much you grind and boss attempts. Did i mention the ost? Oh no i didn't? Well well friend you are in for a treat like no other. The y's series never lets you down with its music, but oath in felghana is in a league of it's own. Makes traversing the dungeons and outdoor areas you come across a fun trip, That and whacking monsters with your kick butt sword. For it's price especially on sale, you can't go wrong here. Oath in Felghana gets a solid 8/10 imo. Now get out there and save the day !

author: {'steamid': '76561198043728918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1642135349}
review:
Phenomenal remake. 

	Ys 3 (1989) is considered the 'black sheep' of the franchise, and frequently compared to Zelda 2. Like Zelda 2, it is a sequel (Ys 1&2 really are a singular game) that goes from an overhead perspective to a 2D side-scrolling plane. For as much as it is disparaged, I personally had no issue with Ys 3. For as much as you think a change in perspective would change the game, it really didn't. It still played like Ys, with its only issues being the need to grind and how some bosses were almost immobile.

	Either way, Falcom must've taken the criticism to heart, because Oath is the first game in the series to get such a drastic remake. Oath in Felghana takes the plot and dungeons from Ys 3, and either expands or clarifies whilst staying faithful to the source material. If you play Felghana, there is absolutely nothing you are missing from the originals. The soundtrack is the same, but of higher quality (with live instrumentation). If anything, you're missing out by playing the originals. 

	Mechanically, it uses the Ys 6 engine and borrows its game mechanics from that title. Ys 6, Oath, and Origin all used the same engine and game systems. So if you've played one, you're at home with the others. Even the three magic attacks are mostly the same. Even for its time (early to mid 2000s), these games are nothing to write home about in terms of combat. But there's also not much to disparage either. You have a basic 6 hit combo off your singular attack button, and a magic button with three spells to alternate between.

	What's really worthy of note is the re-written script. Oath follows the original game's plot almost verbatim, but either expands character roles, introduces some minor characters, or elaborates on others. The game's plot threads make more sense than before.

	In the originals, the frail Elena manages to go halfway into dungeons teeming with enemies. In Oath, she makes the trek whilst accompanied by the capable Dogi, or already imprisoned deep in enemy territory. In the original, Dogi is always there and capable of helping you, but...doesn't. In Oath, there is either a plausible explenation why he is absent, or a rational explenation as to why he is incapable of doing so. 

	I know its Ys and the plot shouldn't be the MAIN priority, but it makes this so much more enjoyable for me. Especially when the voice acting is as good as it is. ESPECIALLY for a lower budget PSP game, with such low brand recognition in the US that it would've been easy to mess that up. Xseed are Gods for bringing this franchise over to the West the way that they did.
	If you've played Ys 3, you'll attain a level of appreciation for it that you otherwise wouldn't. I haven't played all the Ys games yet, but I already enjoyed it more than Origin. I assume that those who place it above Origins and 6 love it for the same reason. Even if it isn't your favorite of the 3 Ys6 engine games, it still merits respect.

	With how disconnected the games are generally from one another, you can easily jump into Oath without having played any of the other games. Or you can play it out of order from the rest of the franchise. Which is to say, it doesn't matter how you're playing these games as long as you play this one.

review: I played this game originally on the PSP, after beating it this game became one of my all time favorite games. Everything about it is just amazing. The story, the music, the characters, the dungeons and the bosses. I love this game so much. It's brutally hard I mean I spent 3 hours on the PC version playing nightmare mode and I just beat the first main boss. It's no easy game I can assure you but its that perfect level of difficulty to where you won't rage quit and instead want to keep on going and going, until you finally beat the boss in which you are given this massive level of satisfaction. The ending to this game is just a beautiful thing honestly it made me cry. 11/10 I'd by this multiple times if I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054470322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1639985336}
review:
難易度ノーマルでプレイし、約15時間でクリア。

英語の勉強がてらイースシリーズをプレイする、ということでイース I&II、オリジンに続いてフェルガナの誓いをプレイ。

難易度が高く、他のイースシリーズと比較するとレベルが1～2低い状態でプレイしているような感じ。ストーリーは王道だがシンプルで短め。それなりに面白かったが、若干物足りなさはある。道中は細かくレベリングに励んだのと何回かゲームオーバーになったのでクリアまで15時間かかったが、うまい人ならもっと短い時間でクリアできると思う。

英語の難易度はI&II やオリジンと同程度に感じたが、ストーリーが短いの英文量も少なめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198063905948', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1702352694}
review:
Memories of celceta是4代重制
本作是3代重制
5種難度 本作、起源我都選第二種難度 本作明顯農一點
難度很高 一個王攻擊一分鐘 我只有幾秒可以攻擊
本作裝備要錢買 起源的裝備都是寶箱
本作要跑圖(一堆要飛、二段跳的寶箱、破牆  前期無法拿 之後要專程跑去拿)
起源是20座樓塔 幾乎就是一直打 沒有村莊
而本作有村莊 村莊到洞內都要走一段路
再來是打擊就是aaa 起源的技能搭配比較多玩法

英文配音員都很有感情  起源之前的+celceta都沒配音
主線都有配音 甚至一些npc第一次講話也有配音
劇情對話、遊戲時長都比起源短;整體地圖設計、小王 起源都好很多

author: {'steamid': '76561198858757532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 890, 'last_played': 1638736489}
review: A solid entry to the Ys series. The battle system is the older one also used in Ys Origin: it's simple but works smoothly. The graphics are old-ish but hold up pretty well. The game has some really good battle music which is perfect considering you'll need to fight bosses multiple times to learn their patterns and get past them. I managed to get the achievement of dying to the same boss 10 times on just the first boss. Retrying has practically no delay in between though, and the fights feel fair which makes it really satisfying once you do beat bosses. The story is not particularly complex but has a couple of nice twists. There are hints I picked up on which clearly connect it to the prior games in the timeline (for anyone playing in story order), and I am looking forward to having that lore fully explained in Ys VI (next game in story order, excluding V which was never re-released) which is supposed to be lore heavy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086332757', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17910, 'last_played': 1668143620}
review:
The short of it: One of the greatest and most challenging ARPGs of all time. Great introduction to classic Ys. Seriously hard as hell, so start out beating it on normal. If you liked the game on normal, give nightmare and nightmare boss rush a shot. Bosses have more difficult attack patterns. Not much more than a 10 hour game, but it has kept me coming back for my adrenaline fix for the past like 8 years.

If you're a skill-oriented challenge junkie, this is the game for you. No grind loops, no fluff, fast-paced action, quality boss after boss after boss. Doesn't stop here either,  Ys Origin is just as good if not better and plays similarly. I was gonna write a bunch more, but just play it dude. There's nothing I could possibly say here that would do this masterpiece justice. You just have to see it for yourself. One of my favorite games of all time. Also OST is insane, but you probably knew that already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067464631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1634398312}
review:
This game has pretty much the best voice acting I have ever heard in a game. While not being my favourite in terms of dungeon and boss design, the second game of the Napishtim engine (and a remake of Ys: III) highly improved upon its predecessor. I love the atmosphere created by all these lively people that you get to meet - a quality of many Ys games, but the voice acting really raises the bar higher. Of course, that would be nothing without a good story. I enjoyed that one. It kept me engaged until the very end.
Some fights were a bit frustrating because I'm bad at avoiding attacks. The problem could usually be solved by grinding one more level, though. Not much of a sacrifice, because of how well the rest of the game was made. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198798989697', 'num_games_owned': 1610, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1635861970}

author: {'steamid': '76561199139596458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1635712521}
review: This game is quite fun, and the story is compelling for an Ys game much like Origin. But sweet mother of all that is good and holy in this world this game is DIFFICULT. I'm just saying this as I finished this on Normal, I don't even want to imagine Hard, Nightmare, or even Inferno. I'm talking like more difficult than any Soulsborne game with the boss fights as you CAN'T HEAL. It could just be me being bad at the game, but there is some difficulty and I raged hard on the final boss, but it's worth it. This game is about 12-18 hours long, so it's pretty short but it has the quality to back it up. Definitely play this, but be warned about getting knocked around like a ragdoll on your first few attempts at a boss. Or over 10 like me because I'm used to turn-based and absolutely suck. Oh, and Chester MAKES this game. Chester is one of the best  Ys characters and he's why the story is interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110389626', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1635390119}
review:
bon par ou commencer, deja c'est du tres tres bon, comme tous les episodes de cette serie j'ai l'impression meme si il y en a encore que j'ai pas fait (3) mais dont 1 que je connais deja un peu.
 - la difficulté, meme en normal c'est difficile, sans level up un max (et ca level pas vite du tout) et anticiper l'equipement superieur super cher c'est le game over assuré aux boss
- la bande son, on le souligne jamais assez, mais la musique dans un jeu c'est super important et la comme dans les autres episodes elle est aux petits oignons
- sinon c'est diffcile ce jeu est sans pitié et faire un game over sur les premiers ennemis random qu'on croise c'est tres possible
- graphiquement superbe, meme si ca peut sembler depassé, il ne faut pas oublier que ce sont des portages de la psp
- sinon c'est toujours aussi difficile et j'adore
- le systeme de combat, qui, comme a chaque fois dans ys est jouissif, on change de systeme dailleurs dans ce 3eme opus, exit le systeme de foncer dans les ennemis pour les tuer comme dans le 1&2 et on revient a un systeme plus clasique toujours aussi bourrin
- sinon c'est difficile...
- le gameplay meme si vu qu'on est en "fausse" 3D la profondeur est souvent difficile a apprehender
- et au fait c'est difficile lol, bref comme dab mais les opus 8&9 sont eux quand meme beaucoup plus simple je trouve par rapport aux autres

author: {'steamid': '76561198189695297', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1635054391}
review: Chester

author: {'steamid': '76561198010840436', 'num_games_owned': 1679, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1641553433}
review:
イースシリーズといえばやさしめな難易度のプレイのしやすさ。…ですが、このタイトルのみ超難易度です。
横スクロール風（奥行きあり）のアクション操作なのですがこれがむっずかしい！！！
マリオも苦手な私には相当厳しく、フェルガナの真価である二回目のチェスター戦やガルバランにたどり着けずにプレイが止まっています。
ストーリー展開やアドルのスタンスはいつものイースです。

音楽はやはり最高ですね。
「翼を持った少年」「バレスタイン城」「時の封印」「Chop!!」「最強の敵」と名曲のオンパレードです。
このタイトルの救いはこれらを含む曲のおかげでプレイが苦でないことですね。

また驚嘆の爆速ロード、操作性自体は快適、ボスは何度もトライすることで慣れて勝てるようになる絶妙な戦闘調整ですので、アクション下手でない人なら普通にプレイできると思います。
それでも超難易度ですが。

author: {'steamid': '76561198372615064', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 7900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7885, 'last_played': 1637202499}
review:
So you have chosen death by coming here...



[b]Anyway, Oath in Felghana is not that harder than Ys Origin in my opinion, it is just they hit harder[/b]. The most epic fight is definitely [spoiler] Chester V2 [/spoiler], the rest is about being aggressive with awareness, and [spoiler]Istersiva, Galbalan[/spoiler] can go f*** themself with the RNG in attacks, 

Other than that solid simple storyline of Ys classic as usual, same as soundtrack with The Boy Who Had Wings being the most memorable, sadly none can beat Beyond the Beginning from Origin, and the same for visual which is unique mix between 3D environment and 2D sprites.

For hardcore achievements they are not as horrifying as Ys Origin as there is only one boss rush and one Inferno run, so do not worry, though you need to run the main game at least 6 times to get everything.

Final Rating: 8.5/10

[spoiler]Well while I said the hardcore is not horrifying like Origin, be sure to visit Doctor for mentality check[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198254210107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1632581167}
review:
I haven't played this much on STEAM - yet - I had this on PSP however. 

So far, I like this version better than the PSP version. The music is just fantastic.

This game is a remake of Ys 3 - Wanders from Ys. The OG game was a side scrolling ARPG, one of the very few games of the genre - at least what they export to the USA. It played like games like Faxanadu, Castlevania 2, or Zelda 2. I had it on Genesis, but it was also released on the SNES, and in Japan PC and Famicom. It was a fantastic game, though difficult.

This remake is 3D, not side scrolling which I admit is disapointing because I really enjoy side scrolling RPGs as I don't get to play them very often and it seems like the majority of them that came to the USA are metroidvania titles. But this version is fantastic, a hell of a lot of fun to play and the soundtrack is just fantastic - probably my favorite in the series.

I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325316395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2351, 'last_played': 1631308484}
review:
Ys Oath in Felghana, released in 2005, is a remake of Ys 3: Wanderers from Ys. It's the second game to use this engine; the first being Ys VI: Ark of Napishtim. Gameplay wise, it's way different from the original. Ys 3: Wanderers from Ys is a sort of side scrolling action game, similar to Zelda 2, while OiF is a 3D hack-n-slash. I prefer OiF's gameplay but it's not the same without the parallax scrolling.
With almost every Ys game, the music is really good. Although I'm biased towards the PC Engine's OST, the new remixed soundtrack is pretty good. A Searing Struggle is really good (but I prefer the PC Engine and the Pre-Arrange versions), The Boy Who Had Wings is bumping, Illburn Ruins is catchy, and Valestein Castle. I don't need to say anything else about Valestein Castle. However, I wish they added the PC Engine OST as well when they updated the game to include voice-over and the PC-88 and X68K OST. So far, I haven't found a mod to bring the PC Engine OST back in but I'm not complaining. TLDR: I think the PC Engine's OST is better.
The game is 15 bucks, and one playthrough on Nightmare difficulty will net you about 30 hours playtime wise, if you're bad like me. If I remember correctly, my first playthough on Nightmare is about 15 hours long, and I don't think that time counts the boss retries. The game isn't as short as a playthrough in Ys Origin, but it's still relatively short. Still though, its got good dollar to hour ratio. The PC Engine version I believe it took me about 10 hours to beat so it's definitely longer than its source material. But enough about me crying about the PC Engine's Ys 3, it's annoying.
As per usual, the older Ys games are known for being incredibly difficult and OiF lives up to that expectation. However, it's not without its faults. On higher difficulties, the bosses rely on RNG. It's not hard to figure out when the boss is going to attack, it's the matter of what that attack will do or how many times that boss does that attack. Some good, like Dularn and Ellefale but I struggled and often needed to overlevel. Gyalva and its randomised platfom flipping, whether its the front or back one, who knows. I can go on but I'd be spoiling. [i]Maybe I'm just bad[/i]. Outside the bosses, the game is fairly balanced between difficult and unfair. [spoiler]If you manage to beat the time attack boss rush on Nightmare AS WELL as beating the first secret boss that unlocks after beating boss rush, you unlock debug mode, which is just cheating. It's not bad if you want to just breeze through the game on the unlockable harder difficulty but it's not worth suffering unless you're sadistic or hardcore enough.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025137290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1628306463}
review:
It's not bad. The automapping to xbox controller leaves a bit to be desired, though - it places the "use magic" button at X on the controller and the jump button at B, making it impossible (basically) to press both. This means you basically have to turn on "hold attack to use magic" in order to make magic-assisted jumps; which leads to problems where the game thinks you are spamming the "use magic" command instead of "attack" right after releasing a held magic attack.

Otherwise, if you've been enjoying the Ys series so far this game will allow you to continue to do so. I can't really recommend it as a jumping-on point, though.

review:
It would be a good game if not for the boss fights which are pretty basic, repetetive and sometimes drawn out. Also you usually can't even make use of your special power up ability (the only one). And considering that bosses are not easily beaten and often take double-digit number of attempts the game simply gets boring as I personally couldn't find the motivation to deal with another poorly designed boss.

Also worth mentioning flying enemies which are frustrating to deal with because of the angle of the camera.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052462154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1627924115}
review:
Es ist besser als das Orginal damals auf SNES. 

Ich bin erst mit dem dritten Teil in Berührung gekommen und es war einfach Awesome damals als ich es auf den SNES gespielt habe. Schon immer liebte ich den Soundtrack. Diese Version ist der Remake vom dritten Teil und das nicht die erste. Aber die beste. Während der dritte Teil einen Stilbruch in Sachen Gameplay damals machte ähnlich wie Zelda 2, so war es dennoch eine sehr tolle aber harte Erfahrung. Einer der wenigen Teile die damals auf den Konsolen im Westen Released wurde und dann so ein Bockschweres Ding. 

Darum Vorweg, Dieser Teil hier ist nicht schwerer als sein Orginal. Ja klar die Bosse erfordern Koeographie. Das tun viele Spiele. Aber ich empfand zu keiner Zeit wirklich das Spiel als unfair bisher. 

Es ist alt und schon echt in die Jahre gekommen. Es ist schade, das man keine Settings in den Grafik Einstellungen machen kann. 

Es ist liebevoll synchronisiert worden und viele schöne Cutscenen und andere Sequenzen wurden gemacht. 

Es ist ein gelungener Remake vom dritten Teil und eine weitere schöne Geschichte von Adol. 

Wer noch nicht in den Genuß gekommen ist sollte dies nach holen. Der Soundtrack war damals wie auch Heute schon wie in vielen YS Teilen legendär

Ich bin Froh, das ich endlich noch mal nachgeholt habe. Die YS Teile sind einfach Super tolle Spiele. Besonders IV / V / VII und VIII den neunten kenn ich noch nicht hole ich aber noch sicherlich nach

author: {'steamid': '76561198042271587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1627574930}
review:
Un jeu plutôt sympa, fait dans la foulé de  Napishtim, mais je l'ai trouvé plus intéressant.

Pour commencer, l'histoire de Felghana est un peu plus captivante dès le début, avec un peu plus de dialogues liés au scénario, même s'il y a quelques clichés et qu'on se doute un peu de pas mal de choses. Le jeu est un peu plus long, il m'a fallut 14h d'après steam, c'est un peu plus que  Napishtim, mais notons un grind moins présent également.

Niveau gameplay, on perd le jump dash (qui était un peu ch**nt à placer ^^') on gagne 3 sorts, cela dit semblable un peu aux attaques spéciales de  Napishtim.
L’inventaire reste assez léger là aussi, d'ailleurs, cette fois-ci il n'y aura pas de potions, les ennemis peuvent lâcher des items de soins, mais ce sera utilisés directement, on ne conserve rien. ce qui peut rendre ardus les combats de boss.
Combats de boss qui sont parfois un peu pénibles, dur de réussir du premier coup, et mélanger à certaines phase de plateforme, il est des fois difficile de viser correctement avec les sorts (à l'image du boss final). Phase de plateforme qui en dehors des combats sont aussi plus intéressantes, mais parfois frustrantes à cause de la caméra et sa perspective.
Pour revenir aux boss, ils auront généralement des schémas d'attaques qu'il faudra retenir (détecter le mouvement et/ou les sons pour savoir quel type d'attaques ils feront), mais c'est un peu ch**nt car il faudra attendre toujours le même court moment pour attaquer, ce qui fait une boucle +/- pénible. J'ai d'ailleurs trouvé un des premiers boss (un oiseau en feu) plutôt compliqué, je comprenais pas vraiment comment esquiver certaines attaques (problèmes de perspectives en partie) et quand exactement l'attaquer. Les suivants étaient moins gênant, mais en général il faut améliorer son équipement au max, et gagner quelques petits niveaux pour pas subir trop de dégâts. On est assez dépendant des niveaux et de l’équipement ici, en partie dû au manque de potions notamment, mais aussi parce que sinon vous avez d'un niveau à l'autre limite le double de dégâts subit !
Ceci étant dit, le grind est moins présent comme dit précédemment, on a pas forcément besoin d'avoir trop de level en plus, et ça monte assez bien.

Globalement c'était assez plaisant, un peu plus amélioré que  Napishtim sur tous les niveaux, avec des décors un peu plus travaillés et variés. Je note cependant quelques petits bugs : notamment le fait de devoir utiliser la synchro verticale sinon je ne pouvais pas avancer dans le jeu (à cause d'un double saut qui étrangement n'arrivait pas assez haut si désactivé), ainsi qu'un crash.... au moment où je voulais sauvegarder. Heureusement que je sauvegarde souvent, cependant, c'est arrivé une seule fois au début du jeu (mais du coup ça me faisait stresser après certains passages un peu chaud ^^ ')

+ Graphiquement plus travaillé que  Napishtim
+ Scénario un peu plus bavard dès le début
+ des combats de boss plus travaillés
+ du grind moins long
+ des phases de plateformes plus intéressantes et travaillées

- reste un poil court
- un peu trop dépendant des levels
- des combats de boss un peu répétitifs/longs sur certains points
- phases de plateformes parfois un peu pénibles à cause de la caméra (fixe) / perspective
- magies et équipements un peu limités et basiques

bref, sans être une perle, cela reste un bon jeu d'action rpg assez plaisant à parcourir

author: {'steamid': '76561197993376686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1626661867}
review:
I just went through both Oath of Felghana and Ark of Nepishtim.  

I really enjoyed the game play improvements in Ys Oath of Felghana.
The story was excellent and the characters were very good.The added voice acting definitely added to the experience.

I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys the Ys series.  The game is also great as a starting off point for newcomers to the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561199183831874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1676318522}
review:
To begin with, Oath in Felganah is one of favorite RPG ever and I think this HD port is fantastic. YS is a serie that went many directions along the course of it's history, but to me, this era of Origins-Felganah-Naphistim was, and is still the best. After that, it went for a team character-driven type of game instead of a solo character inventory filling up style like it had always been, and personaly, I didn't like the change. I'm not saying the new era is bad, lots of people enjoy it, but I don't like it much. I prefer my RPGs when they are simpler with tons of scripted equipments to find, like old games like Soul Blazer or newer ones like Dark Souls. 
Now don't be fooled with my limited time spent on my games. I just recently discovered Steam, but I have already played most of them on other consoles well above 100 hours each. 
Back on YS Felganah, this is awesome, especially for old-schooled gamers who enjoyed the 90's when games were just about questing 15 hours or so on good mechanics and a well written story before moving to another one, just to come back to it months later because the experience was so good. I hope that now that we are going back so strongly to 2d metrovanias, another trend will also surface for these 3d zelda-ish pretty soon. By that, I mean, no time grubbings fetch quests, but strong gameplay centered around a good atmospheric story where you develop your character as you go from temples to temples till you get to the ending, and with that, sidequests that feels more like minigames than repeated chores.
If that day happens, Felganah would be a perfect blueprint to start with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056148924', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1626464394}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013747395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1626206645}
review:
Good story, art and music. Fairly simple gameplay for normal monsters and dungeons, but its enjoyable enough. Minor gripes with controls and especially rebinding them. What really ruins the game, though, are the boss fights.

The boss fights mostly just heavily punish you if you try to play aggressively, which forces you to play in an extremely boring "jump around like a jackass until X happens, attack a couple times, run away, repeat." Some of the bosses are cycle based, but others seem to be completely random in which attacks they use and are only vulnerable after very specific ones, or sometimes only after a singular attack, which they sometimes just won't use.. until your winning attempt where the boss happened to use that attack often. These problems combined with high HP totals makes for frustrating and/or boring boss fights.

Its been a while since I played Origin and I know this is a remake of an older game, but I guess I still expected better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031503958', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1626053299}
review:
fun game, one of the better written ys game imo 
especially because i liked the cast and cared about some characters 
i give this game a Dogi out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000689363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5237, 'last_played': 1703911949}
review:
I would say that Ys: The Oath in Felghana is likely what I consider to be the overall best of the "old style" of Ys games (before they became 3D party-based Tales-esque games) and is what I would recommend to anyone looking to dip their toe into the series for the first time. The combat is fast and responsive, bosses are challenging without feeling cheap (well, most of them anyway), the town atmosphere as well as its various colorful residents are very charming, the exploration is interesting without feeling as cryptic/maze-like as earlier titles, and the music is top-tier across the board. 

The only real negatives I would levy against it is it feels like a game that should have more unlockables than it does and its achievements are just a troll. I am not an achievement hunter at all but Ys games are some of the few that I would consider it with since I find them so enjoyable and appreciate their short length compared to contemporary action RPGs, but this game really does not respect your time when it comes to achievements. Several are charming/funny easter eggs and I appreciate that in this game and the two preceding games, but then some are just absolute shameless grinding, like the infamous escort achievements you have to do six ~50% playthroughs for as they are a missable event that occurs in the game that the achievements ask you to do once for EACH difficulty and does not count retroactively. That is not fun or interesting; that is just busy work. I don't think most people will care, though, and I really only do on principle since I don't care about achievements most of the time and just care about doing the "hard" stuff like beating it on Inferno.

Also don't start on Inferno, lol.

TLDR; If you loved Ys VIII (as it seems like the most popular one nowadays) then I think is the BEST example of seeing where the series really came and developed from. If you loved SNES action RPGs like Mana/Soul Blazer then this is a great example of where that kind of game could have gone if they kept being made. If you've never touched any of those things, then I would recommend this game if you are seeking a fast-paced action game with very minimal RPG elements and a brisk pace that you can wrap up in 6-10 hours while jamming to extremely good string-rock-percussion music the whole time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198442623402', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 4754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1700630764}
