author: {'steamid': '76561198237625574', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1625303066}
review:
A pretty good action RPG from the PSP era, with a simple but charming graphic style.
Combat-wise, it's simple but fun: with basic sword combo attacks and three different spells.
Story-wise, it's basic and self-contained (Adol arrives, kills the dungeon bosses, grabs the plot devices and saves the day).
Music-wise... yeah. It's [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ATBcYQjE6rw]fantastic[/url].
Difficulty-wise, most bosses on Normal were manageable (with a few exceptions that forced me to grind for a bit). If i knew what i was getting into, though, i would have played on a lower difficulty.
Overall, aside from the overly simplistic story and a few BS bosses, it's a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045392149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1635571941}
review: What a magnificent JRPG. I beat this game on Normal and I was blown away by the experience. The game is a top-down action RPG very much in the style of Hyper Light Drifter, Cross Code, Seiken Densetsu and the 2D Zeldas. It's a nice tight package with very little fat- I cleared it in 20 hours and still I found a great JRPG experience. The game gives you three spells, a double jump, a combo and a plunging attack and fully fleshes out these simple controls with tight platforming, fun exploration, really great enemy designs and tough bosses, all of which will have you making use of every bit of those controls in a very profound and satisfying manner. The NPCs you converse with are humble but charming to talk to, and many react to the events of the plot as it unfurls. There are some small, well-executed twists here and there, and all in all this is a lovely little perfectly-sized portion of a JRPG game I strongly recommend. I started my Ys journey out with this game and cannot wait for the next adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163348231', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1624191262}
review:
[h1][b][u]Ys 3.[/u][/b][/h1]

[b][i]Ys: The Oath in Felghana est un remake de Ys III: Wanderers from Ys, sorti juste après Ys : Ark of Napishtim. Techniquement, même si chacun des deux jeux à du mieux et du moins bien par rapport à l'autre, c'est globalement la même chose.[/i][/b]


[b][i]Ys III[/i][/b] ne dispose pas de traduction française officielle, mais une fan-trad réalisée par [url=https://www.nanami-ys.fr/?page=Traduction] Nanami[/url] est disponible et facile d'installation. Vous n'avez donc plus d'excuses pour ne pas vous lancer dans cette aventure !

[b][i]Graphiquement[/i][/b], c'est comme pour [b][i]Ys VI[/i][/b], ça ne me plait pas particulièrement, mais je ne les trouve pas moches pour autant. De plus les portraits des personnages sont toujours très beaux.

L'[b][i]OST[/i][/b] est correct, mais il y a encore des musiques bien trop technos à mon goût.

Le [b][i]gameplay[/i][/b] n'évolue pas beaucoup lui non plus, mais il reste sympathique et relativement plaisant. Dans cet opus on perd la possibilité d'équiper plusieurs accessoires, ce qui est bien dommage. En revanche, la magie fait son retour et c'est bien plus sympa que les armes élémentaires de [b][i]Ys VI[/i][/b].
Les niveaux et l'équipement restent extrêmement importants. Prendre un niveau ou changer une pièce d'équipement pourra vous permettre de passer un boss qui vous posait problème.

L'[b][i]histoire[/i][/b] est encore une fois relativement classique, en revanche, il y a moins de mise en scène dans cet épisode quand dans [b][i]Ys VI[/i][/b].


[b][i]Sans grands changements par rapport à Ys : Ark of Napishtim, Ys: The Oath in Felghan n'en reste pas moins sympathique. Il vaut largement le coup, si vous aimez ce style de jeu.[/i][/b]

Si l'évaluation vous a plu, vous pouvez en trouver celle de [b][i]Ys : Ark of Napishtim[/i][/b] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198163348231/recommended/312540/] ici. [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198042138384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1622315082}
review:
Pretty good, but I liked Ark of Napishtim way more.

+ Story won't light the world on fire with its originality, but it's good if you're in the mood for a simple, retro fantasy RPG story.
+ Combat is basically perfect.
+ Looks good for its age.
+ Amazing soundtrack.

- Characters are pretty meh. I found the NPCs from Ark of Napishtim way more interesting.
- Judging by the number of Inferno Boss Rush videos online, I might be in the minority on this one, but I found the boss fights way more frustrating than fun. The lack of healing items means almost every boss fight is an extremely punishing trial and error process with almost no room for mistakes. The final boss's second form reminds me of a bullet hell game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961199872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2314, 'last_played': 1619995146}
review:
Precision & timing based JRPG with real-time fights. I played it only on Nightmare, and it definitely took a lot of retries, learning the bosses, and farming - but after failing for 2-3 hours, finally barely besting a boss is very rewarding.
Highest difficulty is only unlocked after you beat the game once, which is a bummer for people familiar with other Ys games on the engine, as it's barely worth replying on Inferno after you beat the game on Nightmare. For people who want to finish all achievements, for some reason there are 2 achievements that require you to finish a missable event near the end of the game on each difficulty separately (it doesn't propagate to lower difficulties if you beat it on higher), which is just plain stupid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029729935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1621616981}

author: {'steamid': '76561198351707295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1620538792}
review:
TLDR: In 2021 Ys: The Oath in Felghana is NOT a GOOD game. It's also NOT a BAD game. It's definitely not worth the time/money.

I loved Ys: Lacrimosa of Dana, so wanting to play more Ys, I bought this game on sale for around $5. I played and beat the game on the hard difficulty. My in game time played was around 13 hours and  I did all of the optional quests and got a few of the optional achievements. My steam time was 20 hours, therefore I spent 7 hours redoing stuff after dying and failing to reach a save point. There is roughly 13 hours of content in this game if you want to do a full completion.

Game play follows this pattern:
1. Talk to people in town -> You get asked to go somewhere.
2. Go to next dungeon -> fight monsters and explore -> unlock new item/ability -> reach the next boss
3. Fight the boss and lose -> go back and grind 1-2 levels -> fight the boss and eventually win.
4. Repeat until end of game.

The game is NOT an unplayable buggy mess and exploring the dungeons is actually fun, therefore this is not a bad game.

Unfortunately, all of the characters and the plot are completely predictable. There is nothing interesting or shocking that will happen in this game.  The dialogue is 90% skip able and you will still know what is going on. The frequent need to grind out level ups to beat the next boss is slightly frustrating. Therefore, this is not a good game.

Overall the only reason I bought and played this game was because I really loved Ys: Lacrimosa of Dana and I wanted to learn more about Ys Lore, but in all honesty the only thing I got out of this game was a little bit of back story about the blue haired sidekick Dogi.

My suggestion is to skip this one and read a synopsis online if you're truly interested to know what happens to Adol on the island of Felghana.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964141417', 'num_games_owned': 874, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1620339915}
review:
A pretty good throwback to the days of sprites on 3D levels with 3D enemies, but the game's somewhat marred by the way that enemies can sometimes hitlock you to death and the bosses rely extremely heavily upon having them the few attack patterns where they're vulnerable to attack afterwards.

Combine that with the way that your sprite doesn't always cast a shadow to indicate where you land and you can just wind up in situations where you're evading around but not quite sure exactly where you're going to land amidst a bullet hell -- combine that with some iffy hitboxes and it can make for a very frustrating boss fighting experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034807985', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1919, 'last_played': 1620333611}
review:
Отличный пример как делать челенжевые игры.
Игра похожа на первое знакомство с соулс серией. Ты не понимаешь правил игры и почему эти боссы тебя крутят как тряпочной куклой.
Но потом ты начинаешь заучивать их движения и тайминги, в итоге получая удовольствие от победы над сложным противником.
Боссы все тут отличные, интересные механики и арены , кроме одного огненного змея.
Визуал неплох даже сейчас, приятная картинка и модели боссов.
Сюжет все так же прост: Приплыл на остров, нашествие демонов, Адол иди разберись.
Музыка все так же замечательна как и в остальных частях Ys.
Еще тут появились сайд квесты, но они чисто для разнообразия и ачивок, на основной сюжет не влияют. 
Рекомендую для хардкорных любителей челенжей, фанатам соулс серии.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975612422', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1619896911}
review: I started the series with Origin and 8 recently which were both amazing experiences, and the series quickly became one of my favorites in JRPGs. I picked this up and couldn't put it down, I think it's the best of the Naphishtim engine games I've played. I also tried 6, but the combat felt extra clunky and I couldn't get through it. The level design, variety, and combat are so much better in Felghana, even preferred to Origin. On top of that, it was the most challenging I've played. Great time all around and excited to a 2nd playthrough down the line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183449339', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1620003521}
review:
Game was good, first Ys game for me and it was highly recommended. 

The only con that I had was getting stuck on the double jump to get into the Elderm Mountains. Turns out it's an issue with the frames and after restarting the game running Directx8 and turning on V-sync, I was able to finally get up onto the ledge. 

Story was good, voice acting wasn't terrible, characters are memorable, and the world (while small) was fun to explore. 

Bosses are pretty easy except for the last 2, but I can't see them being easy on any difficultly. 

Combat was surprisingly fun? Having been my first hack n slash in a while, it was fun to run at enemies spamming the attack key. 

All in all, I would say that it's a solid game and I had a lot of fun playing it. 

Also, completely forgot to mention, the music goes HARD. Played cohesively with the story and added that extra oomph at certain parts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969880352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 1787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1787, 'last_played': 1577559344}
review:
This is the third Ys game I've played on Steam, and that was very purposeful, because The Oath in Felghana is a remake of Ys III: Wanderers from Ys. I had played that game as a rental on the Super Nintendo back in the 90's, but given my skill as a little kid and the lack of time during a rental, there was no way I was going to beat it. This is a nice way to finally experience that game, which I had read about in magazines like Nintendo Power, and after playing even a small amount of I wrote fan fiction for it - that was some of my first creative writing ever. Clearly the idea of being a sword wielding hero in a fantasy setting appealed to me, and here there's a lot more story and world building than in something like the early Zeldas.

This is the first time I've played a 3D Ys game, and I was a little bit worried about the shift from 2D, but it's done surprisingly well. The action and gameplay translate to this new perspective quite nicely. There are some areas where the game is effectively 2D and doesn't take advantage of the 3D, but in most of those cases I think it was a good choice because it helps with the platforming.

The one odd thing is that some animations on the 3D characters are pre-rendered in 2D - this looks very strange, though not necessarily bad. I can only assume it was done as a performance optimization, because if it was a stylistic choice it's very unique and generally seems out of place with the rest of the visuals (if you've ever had an enemy in Halo 5 switch to a lower resolution while animating in order to maintain framerate, then you've seen a comparable effect, except here it will happen 100% of the time).

The gameplay is fun - I particularly liked the gem system with its various upgrades that granted you different abilities you were forced to choose between, but that you could easily swap out at a moment's notice, like fire immunity or an extended wind-swept jump. Otherwise it's pretty hack 'n' slash.

I played on the normal difficulty, and for the most part it was excellent: challenging, but I could improve and move past the tough spots. There were a few bosses that I got very aggravated by, but leveling a little bit and learning their moves better usually did the trick.

Though, my biggest complaint about the game is around its achievements, and how they're related to the the difficulties. Achievements do not stack, and there's even a specific achievement for doing the same quest across every difficulty. I have no desire to repeat a game like this 5 times, let alone on a [i]lower[/i] difficulty than I initially beat the game. It's a poor choice and I don't know why they chose to do it this way.

This game has a long, long history to get to the version available today. First released on consoles in 1989. The initial version of this remake came out for PC in 2005 (but was Japanese only), PSP in 2010, and then English text in 2012 - which is when it finally came to Steam. Mad props to the developers for still supporting this game for so many years. After I finished playing they released a patch to include an English voice track in 2020 (so I have no comment on whether it's any good or not). That's over 30 years to get to this version of the game. Wow.

Ys: The Oath in Felghana is not the best game ever, and certainly there are plenty of better action RPGs out there. But you get to experience modernized version of an entry from a seminal series first hand. It is a great continuation of the Ys on Steam, and the updates ensure that this remake is the definitive version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053313570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1620026417}
review:
Enjoyed the game up until I got my @$$ handed to me by a boss near the end. Two of my 30 attempts had the boss on the ropes with one hit left. Frustrating. I didn't consider myself a low level. I'm somewhat of an OCD player, as in I like to finish off every enemy in an area before going forward. No, I don't sit there and intentionally grind, but for this boss I had to! I went back to a particular area and grinded for idk 20 minutes. Then went back and FINALLY defeated them after 40 or 50 attempts haha. I'm not sure how I feel about that.

Everything else about the game (graphics, sound, mechanics) is great. The story is very basic classic RPG but enjoyable.

One oddity I notice is that sometimes double jumps will sort of "slow down" causing you to not fully travel in the direction you want to go, (including when using the wind power move). It almost feels like the character might be slightly rubbing against the wall? Possibly the background wall, or the foreground invisible wall? It doesn't happen a lot but then when you really need to travel that extra bit of distance midair and it messes up, it can get really frustrating. It's happened during boss battles but mostly I notice it when I'm trying to reach secret ledges and the character will suddenly start to drop off short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089345', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 2932, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1619263306}
review:
[h1]伊苏：伊苏菲尔盖纳之誓约，有汉化，流程大概16个小时，
游戏是3D场景+2D人物，基本大部分电脑都能超级流畅运行！
依旧是超棒的音乐和超棒的剧情！
迷宫比起源简单很多，但跳跳跳比起源恶心很多~
[/h1]
老游戏，不看攻略容易卡关还容易漏东西。比如我第一关就少拿了东西导致进入Boss关后没办法攻击Boss！

和前作差不多，所有Boss战之前都有存档点，大部分Boss都是又高又大的！主角从多高的地方跳下去都不会扑街！
上一代的没用围栏的滑滑梯继承了下来，但也不多！
本作多了跳跳跳的坑！而且很多、很难，后面那几关我跳到吐了！
[h1]不过多尝试几次也能过，不算特别难~

剧情流水账：
[/h1]
[spoiler] 亚特鲁和多奇坐船到了8年多没回的多奇的故乡菲尔盖纳，刚到故乡就亚特鲁英雄救美救下了多奇小时候玩伴爱蕾娜·斯托达特！
麦克盖亚伯爵这似乎在调查什么奇怪的力量，而他手下的骑士切斯特·斯托达特似乎有头绪了，开始准备进行搜索。
亚特鲁和多奇住进旅馆，第二天多起准备去山上找老师并调查魔物变多的原因。
亚特鲁则在小镇逛街，找爱蕾娜，并得知她一直在找她失踪半年多的哥哥切斯特···在小镇广场听说提格雷采石场坑道出现魔物，需要救援，镇长和矿工头都在里面很久没出来了···于是亚特鲁前往救援。
采石矿的隧道中遇到矿工头杜伊并给了主角仓库钥匙让主角随意拿取，去仓库路上遇到魔道师杜兰并试探性打了起来，而后杜兰似乎觉得亚特鲁实力不咋样但是还是打算回去和某人汇报下···进入仓库取得最近刚挖掘出来的炎灵之手镯，允许主角丢火球了！
在采石矿深处遇到了镇长埃德佳，他希望亚特鲁帮忙调查采石矿里面的遗迹！
进去后打Boss，而且只能用炎灵之手镯丢的火球攻击···干掉后获得星月雕像。
出去的时候镇长和切斯特·斯托达特骑士对峙，似乎采石场被封锁了，而切斯特似乎对照顾爱蕾娜很反感，总想着当领主的骑士！
回到小镇后埃德加镇长和亚特鲁说小镇在麦克盖亚伯爵就任后政策一直不好，而切斯特居然丢下自己妹妹去为他卖命。但恰好被爱蕾娜听到了！爱蕾娜不敢相信伤心地跑了出去，亚特鲁追出去并和爱蕾娜聊天。
爱蕾娜不知道切斯特为何会变成这样，但是只要哥哥还活着就好很多了，她感觉东北方的“埃鲁邦兹遗迹”那是她哥哥切斯特性情大变的原因。

在教堂时候发现皮埃尔神父去了“埃鲁邦兹遗迹”，于是接受委托救神父，还得到遗迹钥匙。

进入遗迹的祭祀场，看到了切斯特和皮埃尔神父，切斯特对充满好奇心的亚特鲁很不满，于是打起来，打赢后神父劝架却被剑指着怂了，而麦克盖亚伯爵突然带兵进来，伯爵本想干掉亚特鲁，不过切斯特打算将其踢下熔岩断崖！神父被关进地牢。

可惜主角没扑街，在熔岩断崖下，还在宝箱里捡到能在熔岩里行走的神器火龙之守护，熔岩最深处找到能跳起来飘一段路的风灵之手镯。拿到后杜兰突然出现嘀咕着主角拿到了第二个杰诺斯之力，不能让主角继续玩下去，顺带召唤boss，打Boss~在大空洞那获得布雷西亚秘药，使用后终于能高速移动冲冲冲了！再打一次Boss后获得落日雕像。

回到遗迹上面的主角遇到正在等着主角的切斯特，他威胁主角交出雕像。
不够这时候爱蕾娜和多奇来阻止切斯特，不过切斯特嫌弃爱蕾娜碍事，而8年前离开小镇的多奇和现在的切斯特没啥差别。并声称自己成为骑士舍弃过去，and别再妨碍他！

回到小镇上，埃德佳又开始数落切斯特，尼古拉斯主教想办法让神父出狱，以及杜伊想起了废坑深处的壁画上似乎画着和雕像有关的东西。于是多奇再去找老师咨询，而亚特鲁去采石场下面的废坑。

在出城前往废坑的时候，爱蕾娜追上了将自家祖传的可以在存档点传送的翼之护符送给了亚特鲁，并称切斯特始终是她哥哥，希望切斯特一切都好！

在巴雷斯坦城门口女仆弗兰在埋怨看门人安德烈没看好孩子！
在遗迹门口遇到跟着他城主父亲跑出去的男孩，这男孩又脆又慢还容易扑街！送回去后城主夫人伊莉莎贝特要亲自答谢主角！于是又要等半天ing···（其实是要和几个人都对话一次），然后获得辉石之佩饰，装备后可以获得更多的矿石。本以为还能继续摸鱼，没想到切斯特突然出现并将其赶走！

从采石场里断桥对面捡到的鲍勃的挂坠，交给村子里的爱达的老妇人，换取鬼火之宝珠可以照明+分辨真伪物体！而且爱蕾娜也在那！

进入采石场废坑通道，看过壁画后得知说的玄乎其玄的信息，整理起来就是：勇者杰诺斯用剑和神器封印了魔王加尔巴兰，而亚特鲁是杰诺斯意志的继承者。并得到杰诺斯留下的使命之石板，并获得2段跳！并得知神器一共4件！而使命是在神器落入恶徒之前获取到！在废坑最下层打Boss并获得暗黑雕像！

这时候去镇长埃德佳那会看到神父皮埃尔在主教的帮忙下被释放了，并从镇长知晓一个传送，加尔巴兰的魔王征服了菲尔盖纳，被魔王支配的人和精灵变成了魔物，杰诺斯勇者借助众神的力量消灭了魔王，而附近海域有个杰诺斯的海岛上的居民在12年前因为瘟疫扑街了！镇长建议亚特鲁拜访多奇的老师贝鲁哈特他似乎知道更多信息！

陪镇子上的小女孩安娅玩寻宝游戏，最后东东都给主角！
在码头，爱蕾娜述说这个地方风景很棒，小时候她哥哥总是忧伤地看着对面的小岛，然后送爱蕾娜回小镇！

进入亚鲁登山脉寻找贝鲁哈特，在山腹处又遇到等待多时的杜兰，并丢出Boss跑！并找到了贝鲁哈特，得知之前知晓的故事都是真实的，在杰诺斯消灭加尔巴兰时候，将加尔巴兰的力量分为4份封印在神器雕像中！没办法根除魔王只能封印，而1年前魔物出现就是因为封印松动的原因，而麦克盖亚伯爵似乎想借助雕像的力量自由操控魔物来实现自己的野心。而最后一个雕像就在山上而且多奇已经去找了！

在山脉里能捡到4个巴姆之叶，交给镇上的养比卡多的舒格能换取卡特鲁之灵水。
玩到这时候我才发现翡翠戒指要给酒馆的男人能get更好的东东！结果我给女老板了~QAQ~

在跳不过去的大坑前遇到多奇，亚特鲁跳过去后，多奇给了亚特鲁可以冲破巨石的地灵之手镯。继续探索获得可以在冰面上行走不滑的石之靴！
在冰封之洞里打Boss并获得白光雕像！4个雕像共鸣导致山崩并将路堵住了，地灵之手镯都不行，好在山崩后多奇找过来并撞开巨石一起回去找老师贝鲁哈特。

路上果然遇到切斯特，因为多奇早就看出切斯特并不是真的甘愿做伯爵的手下，这次他道出实情，切斯特和爱蕾娜都是杰诺斯岛出生的。岛上的居民被麦克盖亚雇佣的魔道师召唤的魔物屠了，爱蕾娜失忆！切斯特要复仇，要把巴雷斯坦城变成地狱来报仇！

切斯特刺伤多奇后亚特鲁不得不将雕像给切斯特，将多奇带回贝鲁哈特那得知12年前贝鲁哈特还是巴雷斯坦城的骑士，那时候在不知情的情况下参与了屠杀村民的任务，唯独无法对那对兄妹下手只好将其交给镇长并隐居打探麦克盖亚的目的。1年前魔物出现后切斯特找到他并得知真相并打算复仇。

亚特鲁先回小镇通知镇长，在镇子门口看到好多士兵尸体，镇子里爱蕾娜和安娅被像傀儡一样的士兵围攻顺带英雄救美，然后和镇长讨论的时候修女说爱蕾娜不见了，可能是去城里了！亚特鲁只能去城里找咯！

在城门口遇到女仆想知道城主和城主夫人的情况，而边上的士兵因为危险怎么样都不想进去！在城东顶层遇到了城主夫人伊莉莎贝特和两个孩子。将实情和他们说明后，爱丽瑟会给个象牙白键！
在城东打Boss并获得风鸣之银管！
在城西顶楼遇到尼古拉斯主教，并得知礼拜堂那似乎有通往地下水路的路口，在地下水路遇到爱蕾娜，爱蕾娜了解了实情后觉得切斯特的做法不妥，不应该将无辜的人牵连进来。还get了钟楼钥匙！

通过钟楼钥匙进入钟楼，并跳跳跳！跳到吐了才拿回4个雕像！并在钟楼顶部看到切斯特即将手刃麦克盖亚伯爵，而伯爵依旧在找借口，不过亚特鲁来了只能先解决亚特鲁！

切斯特和亚特鲁战斗的时候伯爵朝楼顶逃去，切斯特只好放下战斗追上去。在楼顶，爱蕾娜追上了，阐明自己在听到切斯特说那些事情后也想起了过去的事情，并希望切斯特放下过去，复仇没办法安抚痛苦地离开的村民，父母也不会愿意看到这样的结果···

突然整个地区开始震动起来，本以为是伯爵还做了什么，没想到伯爵一切都是听从尼古拉斯主教做的···尼古拉斯主教这时候来到楼顶，阐明雕像的力量已经传回加尔巴兰那了，之前协助切斯特复仇不过也是这个目标的一部分！本想解决主教的切斯特哪怕有杰诺斯之剑不敌杜兰的魔法而被击飞，只好亚特鲁出马了！然后呢！亚特鲁也不敌扑街！

尼古拉斯主教打算把作为解除封印的杰诺斯一族的末裔切斯特带走，不过爱蕾娜替代了切斯特并希望亚特鲁帮忙照看切斯特。

回到镇子上，镇子埃德佳很意外居然是尼古拉斯主教是元凶！
而贝鲁哈特回来组织和维护秩序，亚特鲁则前往小岛，离开之前看一下切斯特，他觉得他没资格拥有杰诺斯之剑于是给了亚特鲁！

到达码头，多奇早就等亚特鲁很久了！本打算一起去救爱蕾娜结果到岛上伤口复发倒地晕倒，只好亚特鲁自己出马了！

在神殿前，遇到杜兰，原来修女娜露就是杜兰！！原来娜露这么做都是为了报恩···而现在终于可以放下12年前的罪孽了···(⊙﹏⊙)

进入黑暗神殿，拿到可以消灭不死怪物的银之铃，以及最强的拉巴尔之铠，红莲之槌。在黑暗神殿最深处的存档点保存后回到镇子上打造最强装备！然后回来打Boss！！

见到加兰德的时候他还嫌弃修女不中用···打倒他之后还疯狂地说神的复活已经无法阻止！！进入神殿底部，爱蕾娜让亚特鲁快逃，似乎魔王苏醒已经无法阻止似的，并看着魔王慢慢苏醒ing
好在这时候切斯特出现救下爱蕾娜！！

然后开始打最终Boss加尔巴兰，并封印它！！
不过剧情可不是这么安排的，剧情里打完后Boss依旧在苏醒，于是切斯特打算用杰诺斯之剑和雕像引爆小岛的自爆装置来干掉魔王，并让打晕爱蕾娜让亚特鲁和爱蕾娜先离开！

小镇上，那些死了不断复活的魔物，在爆炸后全部倒下消失了。小岛在爱蕾娜、多奇、亚特鲁的见证下消失了！诅咒、魔王、还有杰诺斯的使命通通消失了~

最后亚特鲁要离开了···爱蕾娜一直闭门不见，其他人要留下来重建菲尔盖纳。只有亚特鲁离开···在码头，爱蕾娜追上亚特鲁为其送行···
留下总有一天会和哥哥一样守护菲尔盖纳的誓言，将来亚特鲁回到菲尔盖纳的时候见证爱蕾娜是否履行了自己的誓言！
 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197965158099', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1419, 'last_played': 1615070679}
review:
Music: Fantastic,
Gameplay: Most of time it's great. The last two bosses excluding the sword woman one had me tearing my hair out even on hard difficulty, I dread to think of how bad it is on higher difficulties, Just save your spirit amulet for the final boss second phase and unga bunga his hands. You are a robot if you can finish this without being hit.

The voice acting that they added from the PSP version is comically bad for the most part. you can disable it but I think it is worth it for Elena, Chester and Galbalan's performances. TASTE MY PAIN! PARTAKE OF MY SUFFERING! AHAHAHAHAHA!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992532783', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1617757274}
review:
Me pasó algo raro con este juego, me lo di vuelta pirata por el 2008/2009 y me pareció el mejor juego de la saga, años después me lo compré (2013) pero no lo volví a jugar hasta hoy (2021) y, desde las perspectiva que tengo hoy, no me pareció tan disfrutable o tanto mejor que YS VI Ark of the Naphistim como me lo pareció en su momento.

El juego sigue las mismas estructuras de siempre de ir del punto A al B siguiendo un orden más o menos estricto (aunque te podés llegar a olvidar de terminar alguna mazmorra y vas a tener que volver para avanzar en la historia) pero lo que más me chocó fue el hecho de que el diseño de niveles híbrido entre entornos abiertos y entornos simulando una vista en 2D con scroll lateral no me termina de convencer, entiendo que lo hicieron así por el juego del cual se basa (Ys III - Wanderers From Ys) pero contrariamente a lo que pensaba hace más de 10 años el uso de mapas pasilleros se me hacen predecibles, algo repetitivos y siento que me lastran un poco la exploración. Por estos motivos me gustan mucho más los otros dos YS que comparten motor con este.

La música es FANTÁSTICA así con mayúsculas, te alienta muchísimo a jugar con su ritmo frenético aunque no sé si será porque jugué en normal pero el hecho de farmear cada tanto me cortó mucho el ritmo de juego casi sin pausas que recuerdo de antaño (quizá haya jugado en fácil antes), dicho esto es otro juego de la saga que tiene una música muy memorable y muy disfrutable.

En fin, antes yo recomendaba este juego para iniciar en la saga, hoy por hoy prefiero recomendar YS VI Ark of the Naphistim -por las razones que voy a explicar en la reseña que haga en un futuro-, luego este y por último YS Origin -que también da para otra reseña-.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074190941', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3388, 'last_played': 1600935818}
review:
Más de 50 horas después llenas de acción, un poco de frustración (en la máxima dificultad y el último Boss Rush) y todos los logros desbloqueados, no me queda otra que recomendar esta joya.

Jugabilidad: Lo mejor del juego y de la saga en general es la fluidez con la que uno se mueve y ataca con el personajes, la respuesta a todos los comandos que introducimos tienen respuesta rápida, el personaje se desplaza a gran velocidad y reacciona instantáneamente a todo, el combate siempre se siente fluido

Duración: Lo justo y necesario para que te den ganas de rejugar en dificultades más altas, una primer partida puede durar alrededor de 8 horas

Dificultad: El juego es un reto desde la dificultad normal y en los niveles más altos requiere de aprender patrones y explotar cada segundo de debilidad de los enemigos, el mínimo error es un Game Over, sin embargo muy pocas veces el juego se llega a sentir injusto.

Rejugabilidad: El aumento de dificultad hace que un jefe que pudo parece fácil en la dificultad anterior empiece a requerir cada vez más estrategia no es solo un aumento de stats sino que a veces se acomplejan algunas habilidades.

Sonido: La música es típico rock épico al que nos tiene acostumbrados la empresa Falcom con esta saga, te llena de energía para seguir yendo de frente enfrentándote a todos los enemigos que te cruces.

Historia: No es nada de otro mundo pero teniendo en cuenta la duración del juego se sabe mantener a lo largo del mismo, nunca llega a ser una molestia.

Resúmen: YS: Oath Of Felghana es un ARPG con controles muy fluidos, pero una jugabilidad muy adictiva, uno puede pasarlo tranquilamente en fácil o proponerse un verdadero reto y sufrir en las dificultades más altas pero siempre sabiendo que todos los retos son superables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159656909', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1638900570}
review:
If you liked all the other Ys games, you'll like this one too, this is your typical Ys adventure and it plays wonderfully, and controls very well.

If you haven't played the other Ys games and you're looking at this for the first time, I recommend the game, it's got really good game play, Exceptionally Good music, and some really solid Voice acting and at the very least a simple yet engaging story to boot. I absolutely recommend this game to anyone out there looking for a solid adventure

author: {'steamid': '76561198064508218', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1614304957}
review:
I wanted to try this game to get into the Ys series, mainly because VIII and IX look really appealing to me. After starting the game on Normal, I went through it and it generally was a pretty enjoyable action RPG experience. Was a bit on the easy side, but it was satisfying slashing through enemies to the tune of some pretty adrenaline-pumping music and classic video-gamey sound effects.

Then came the first boss, which I died to at first. I laughed and tried again. And again. And again. And again. It seemed like there was something I was doing wrong, like there was a puzzle or mechanic to the fight I wasn't figuring out, but no. You really just have to jump around wildly to hope to dodge the attacks and get your hits in when you can. After what seemed like a dozen deaths, I finally beat the first boss.

After a few minutes more of dungeon crawling, I ran into the second boss, and this is where the frustration started to settle in. I kept dying and dying and dying and dying until I just couldn't take it anymore. Again, there isn't any deep learning mechanic to this boss, it's literally just jump over the wide projectile disc it throws at you again and again, while simultaneously trying to angle yourself just right so that your tiny fireball will hit the boss. 

You may say that I just don't like games that test my skill, which might be a fair enough statement. But I like a game to start with a reasonable difficulty and slowly ramp up as I get accustomed to the controls and mechanics. For example, I always play Kingdom Hearts games on Critical, the highest difficulty, because I've mastered the controls and overall feel of the game and the most difficult setting is the most fun.

Also, before anyone says it, yes. This game has an easy mode and even a "very easy" mode. But after already investing 90 minutes before I discovered this wasn't something I wanted to play, I'm not willing to go through all that again for a chance at it being something I actually like and want to continue playing. Not to mention, I'm already frustrated and put off by it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104052219', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 2613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1616025214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198431683052', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1672463705}
review: This game is an odd duck in every way imaginable. It's a nearly 20 year old remake of a 30+ year old game. The gameplay is nothing like the modern Ys games and yet it's every bit as good in its own way. It has one of, if not the best, osts in the franchise and the plot+gameplay are snappy with very little down time. Its difficulty could be toned down a bit, but the boss design was a small price to pay for a thoroughly enjoyable experience. If you're new to the franchise through Ys VIII or Ys IX and want to see how the franchise was before the shift to a party based system, this is the game for you. If you're interested in the franchise but don't want to snap your controller in half because a certain lava boss is busting your balls, maybe try Ys VI or the newer games before hitting this one up.

review:
Прошел на найтмаре, очень советую тем кто ищет клевую челенжевую игру.
Игра очень сложная, каждый босс рвал анус супер сильно. 
Жопа горела так сильно, что Хаттори Хандзо мог запросто выковать при таких температурах меч самурайский.
А если серьезно, то игра отличная. Играл во все части Ys в стиме и эта одна из лучших.

Еще тут неплохая история,  музон, управление.

review: 咋评价呢，游戏肯定是好游戏，不过作为伊苏重置三部曲来讲，这部的难度个人认为是三部里最高的，很多区域需要一定的技巧才可以过去，敌人的整体设置感觉有点偏难，尤其的后期，很多敌人那个攻击力，就算配合了地魔法也不一定能误伤，尤其最终boss，建议手残的还是尽量刷刷级吧，再回商店多买几瓶圣水增加血量上限，要不然，这个boss不太好过

author: {'steamid': '76561198263017803', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1612456244}
review:
Macera avcısı kızıl saçlı Adol'a katılmaya ne dersiniz? Serinin 3. oyununun remake'i olan Oath in Felghana aksiyon sekansları, aşırı güzel bossları, hoş soundtrackleri ile herkesin denemesi gereken bir oyun.

Hikayeden girişecek olursak ortalama bir hikayesi var. Tipik bir kahraman hikayesi olan oyunumuzda kahramanımız Adol'la Felghana'yı kasıp kavuran canavarların gizemini çözüp halkı bu kötülükten kurtarmamız gerekiyor. Her ne kadar hikaye sıradan olsa da işleyiş araya serpiştirilen güzel noktalar ile sıkmayacak bir şekilde devam ediyor.

Grafik olarak oyunun tarihi itibariyle günümüz standartlarında daha iyi örneklerini görmüş olabilirsiniz ama tasarım açısından iyi olması nedeniyle bu eksikliğini bayağı ölçüde gideriyor.

Karakter ve düşman dizaynları ise cidden iyi. Zaten dizaynları güzel olan düşmanlara değişik patternler ile bayağı süslemişler. O konuda da iyi altından kalkmışlar.

Oyunun en iyi olduğu konu ise bosslar. Harbiden her bossun patternleri, tasarımı vs. cidden çok güzel olmuş. Sadece bu bile oyunu satar.

Sonuç olarak seriye daha önceden girip girmemeniz farketmeksizin herkese önerilir. Belki bir başyapıt olmayabilir ama kesinlikle parasına ve ayıracağınız vakte fazlasıyla değiyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859464087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1618546199}
review: Siendo el tercer juego de la Saga Ys y el que canónicamente sigue la historia después de Ys Chronicles I y II, Ys Oath in Felghana se supero en cuanto a jugabilidad, dialogo y desarrollo, ahora con voces y una fluidez al jugar que dan una sensación más viva de acción al combatir, sin embargo los jefes a mi parecer no están del todo balanceados y los logros por terminar el juego como que rayan en lo ridículo, así que si piensas en re-jugar el juego te recomiendo que sea para disfrutar de la historia, que es uno de los puntos fuertes de la Saga, ya que si vas apuntando a un reto este juego no te va a decepcionar... para nada, en resumen, es un buen juego, excelente continuación de los 2 primeros, balanceado en combate pero difícil en los jefes y los logros, recomendado para los fans y un poco para los casuales de la saga

author: {'steamid': '76561198285698554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1612243918}
review:
这作难度挺大啊，话说不能在游戏中途改难度早说啊，顶着normal难度受苦，，，不过也因此第一次玩ys有种玩动作游戏的感觉，还行吧。
地图，战斗，解密玩起来感觉都很舒服，作为系列粉丝当然是好评。如果是路人，感觉先会被这个画面劝退吧（
不过战斗系统有个小问题就是使用魔法之后如果立刻进行蓄力会直接放一个小魔法浪费你的魔力条，没这个就打得更爽了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198203412952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1633457329}
review:
I was thinking of writing a review AFTER getting every achievement in the game but let's face it, there is no way I am doing that. I am just not that proficient at this game. So let us begin and talk about Oath in Felghana.

Gameplay:

In terms of gameplay, it is basically the same as the other 2 Ys games from this era. You run around with tight controls, advance through the story, find 3 artifacts that serve as your special abilities, upgrade your weapons and armor, level up, beat the bosses and complete the game. A very simple, yet tried and true formula that I can never get enough of.

The wind ability allows you to spin, do lots of damage and, most importantly, hover in mid air. The earth ability allows you dash attack and block enemy attacks and finally the fire ability allows you to shoot fire balls. Unlike in Ys 6, thank the lord, you have a double jump in this game instead of a poorly executed dash jump. You buy new weapons at the shop or find them in treasure chests. Upgrading your equipment is done through applying cleria ore, sorry, I meant whatever the ore in this game is called. Luckily for us, a lot of treasure chests contain a bunch of this stuff, so you should never have problem upgrading your equipment. 

Difficulty:
This is the one Ys game where I have to talk about this because I do legitimately think that there are issues here. Now, I have beaten this game on Inferno mode, so I am, at least, somewhat proficient at this game but even I find myself having to grind for levels for boss fights. But that is not the problem. The main problem is after the sparta moment. Basically, you are dropped off to an area with lots of powerful enemies and 2 boss fights back to back. You do not have access to the shop during this segment and it annoys the f out of me. Now the first boss is not too much of a problem, at worst you can just level up and overpower it but the second one not only requires you to level up but also get used to its stupid platform mechanic. I am all for difficulty, but this game has way too many sudden difficulty spikes early and especially mid-game, imo.

The Presentation:
Jesus.....like....wow!! This game has a phenomenal soundtrack on top of using what I consider to be the best art-style in all of Ys. It is not my favorite Ys soundtrack, that honor goes to Origin, but I would be lying if I didn't say this was a straight up banging soundtrack. For those who are feeling nostalgic or curious, you can also switch to the original soundtrack from Ys 3: Wanderers from Ys. Oh yeah, this is actually a remake of a really unique but bad game). I say unique because in Ys 3, Adol actually speaks....... a lot. Something I miss in the rest of the series but not much we can do about that. This game also has english voice acting and I ABSOLUTELY adore it. It is REALLY good.

The Story:
While a part of the of "Winged Ones" story-line, all things considered, this game is mostly contained within itself. Like, the only connections to the "Winged Ones" is shown with the backstory of the island and the Hero Genos who actually worked with them to stop an evil Ash Esmelas creature known as Galbalan. We wouldn't see the origin of this monster until Ys6, a game that came out before this remake. All things considered, it is a simple yet charming story.  

Overall:
Unlike with Ys6, I can, without any worries, recommend this game. With its tight gameplay, phenomenal soundtrack and beautiful graphics, this game manages to stand out among the series. I do think that the sudden difficulty spikes are a problem BUT the game is still fair. Sure, I can't beat Nightmare Boss rush but you can find youtube videos where people basically destroy this game using its mechanics. Casually, it is a fast game with some grinding here and there. Professionally, it is a fast and technical yet simple Action Rpg with excellent presentation. If you are an Ys fan, I highly recommend this game. I still prefer Ys Origin, Ys 1 and 2 over it, and I do think that Ys6 has the better town and NPCs but the quality of this game is simply undeniable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219754817', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1606153392}
review:
YS series the best action RPG and one of the famous Falcom games.  

I will write what I care points for each game as below:

- GamePlay:
Each YS game has different gameplay between all YS series.
for "Ys I" and "Ys II" are the same gameplay with little more development for "Ys II", they are simple & fun for an old and short game.
For "Ys VI The Ark of Napishtim" and "Ys The Oath in Felghana" and "Ys Origin" are the same gameplay system with little difference.
I don't know why, somehow "Ys Origin" gives me feels like "The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky the 3rd".
For "Ys VII" and "Ys Memories of Celceta" and "Ys VIII" are the same gameplay concept, the development becomes better from "YS VII" to  "YS Memories of Celceta" and a lot better for "Ys VIII".

- SoundTrack:
This part should be notified because it's very important and I will no say more because the "Ys" Series one of Falcom games if you don't know why because they care about soundtracks on their works.

- Story:
If we talk about a story, I will not write about it letterly.
all I say is, "Ys" games are the same world and each part in a specific area of it. they are connected indirectly, Regardless of the main story for each game.

overall as always I saying for Falcom games, I enjoyed every millisecond of the "Ys" series.

I write my view after completed "Ys VIII" and looking forward to upcoming "Ys" games.

Note:
I Played the "Ys" series in order as the following:
-Ys I & II Chronicles+
-Ys Origin
-Ys: Memories of Celceta
-Ys: The Oath in Felghana
-Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim
-Ys VII
-Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of DANA

author: {'steamid': '76561198331257082', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1610850725}
review:
Easily one of the best the series has to offer!

Story: Aside from the typical 'collect 4 magic artifacts and defeat the ancient evil' plot, it's one of the best Ys stories. The story of Chester and Elena is one I won't be forgetting any time soon and the voice acting dub patch was well done and certainly helped me connect more to the characters. It definitely pulled at my heartstrings at times and Chester was a really relatable antagonist with a good backstory that I can't elaborate on because of spoilers.

World-building: In Memories of Celceta you learn more about Adol, but in this you get to learn more about Adol's travel companion Dogi. It was cool coming to his homeland, seeing the town he grew up in and learning his backstory.

Art/Graphics: Really charming and have a very 90s anime style to them. Much like all of Falcom's games from this era.

Combat: It is the same as Ys: Origin due to being on the same engine, it's a lot more simplistic than newer Ys games where you get skills and can combo and stuff, but simple isn't always a bad thing and it's still a fun system, it has a very old school Zelda feel to it.

Bosses: They are VERY difficult, some people might not enjoy it, but I'm a masochist so I really enjoyed it. All I'll say is tfw your action J-RPG becomes a bullet hell.

Level/Dungeon design: Your typical Ys. Lava level, ice level, underground waterway, forest, cave, etc, but even though I've seen these levels many times they're designed well with good platforming sections and secrets to find and are always fun to explore so I never mind the formula.

MUSIC: Peak Falcom. Among one of my faves of all their games. Incredible. Super catchy melodies, shredding guitars and keyboards that sound like they came straight out of an 80s Yngwie Malmsteen album, beautiful violin pieces as well.

I really don't have any complaints, for a simplistic, old-school low budget J-RPG from the early 2000s, this game is pretty damn great and I can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025697963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1609669931}
review:
A game about a random dude with a sword dealing with ever increasing amount of bullshit thrown his way, Felghana is both amazing and rage inducing. To be more authentic to the gameplay, this review will contain lots of swearing, along with traces of the raw manly emotion you get when you prove your superiority to a bunch of pixels.

The game is a mix of action adventure with very light RPG elements, and those work about as well as they do in any other early YS game – really fucking awkward. The story is okay, there are plot twists and stuff, and it taught me a very valuable lesson that it’s okay to be a mass murderer, as long as you’re a noble or somewhat sorry. 

But the main dish, the main reason to play are boss fights and Adol. 
The boss fights are awesome. They are quick – or at lest they feel quick –, they favor player’s aggression, they are varied, and they are absolutely fucking brutal. Controlling Adol is no less great, as long as you get all the tools. He’s fast, but not too fast, he’s got good range, but nothing to ridiculous, he’s got his own kind of bullshit to throw at things, but it’s minor in comparison. 
The bosses and Adol combine, and the end result is something truly, honestly, swear to god amazing. When I finally beat the boss, I don’t just scrap by, I fucking speedrun it. I feel like I’m actually good at videogames, and that illusion persist up until the next boss fight. And this stuff is addictive. About a third of my game time in other YS games is just them idling in background, but here? Here for two days I spent almost my every waking moment swearing at this motherfucking lizard, this motherfucking robot and that motherfucking Chester, who probably ought to marry me after all he did.

Seriously, this made me remember that I actually still love videogames. You can’t buy this. Well, I mean, you can, but I’m talking about the feeling. The only reason I’m not replaying it right now is my fear of the game getting old. And I don’t want that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043840211', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 4188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1610767869}
review:
People say this game is so good it's even better than Origin.
It's not
1. It doesn't feel like a story about you, not a grand adventure. You're  an NPC in a background who does all the dirty work.
2. Main characters are not great, including "love interest" and Dogi is a boring bland forced companion with no cool traits.
3. Grinding and weird difficulty curve.
There are very few manual save points and no autosaves in the game, that makes every death very frustrating and a huge time waste.
Every area requires certain lvl to be rather comfortable to be in which means you're going to grind even on normal.
What's even worse - last area has only 2 saves - at the start and at the end.
And last boss absolutely requires you to grind your weapons and armor to the max lvl.
4. No reasons to replay the game and only one character
5. Character can only move in 8 directions, which makes aiming with magic and  dodging in bullethell bosses battles a huge pain in the arse.
6. Abilties are boring to use.

Music is cool, boss design is cool, japanese VA(look up guides online) is amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268537934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1609664618}
review:
I have already completed the Good old games version of this game on another computer. But my laptop is too slow so I can't beat the final boss of Steam version. Well, I don't mind about it.

Ys: The Oath in Felghana is a nice game. Because it has an excellent story and some puzzles. In fact, I think story is the only best design. These puzzles are more easier than standard platform games.

Cons:
-You can't open menu and change equipment in the boss fight. It means that if you want to give up or restart, you must wait until boss kill you.

- Some achievements are very terrible. You must beat the game over eight times or more. It's a waste of time.

- I stuck into a wall after a long jump. Sorry I didn't make a screenshot of this problem. But it's true.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053713226', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1595595208}
review:
If you were to ask me which game in the series I'd describe as THE Ys Game, Oath in Felghana would be the one I'd name in a heartbeat, despite it being a remake of the third game in the series.

This 12-13 hour long action RPG is a simple and short but extremely sweet ride from start to finish. The combat is simple, but fast-paced. The OST is by and far my favourite in the entire franchise, and the bosses are a blast to fight. And the story, while nothing groundbreaking, does its job of moving the game along quite well.

I may hold Ys Origin and Ys VIII in higher regard, and if you're planning on really getting into the series, Ys I & II chronicles+ is definitely the better starting point, but if you're someone who's just a bit curious about the series but don't know much about it, I would recommend Oath in Felghana as a starting point in the series any day of the week. To me, Oath in Felghana captures the purest essence of the Ys series like no other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035165180', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1609423574}
review:
An easy to pick up and progress hack and slash game with ancient JRPG elements (it's based off an old JPRG, after all)
I did need a walkthrough to get through some dungeons of the game since the art-style makes it hard to see certain hidden switched (they really are hidden!), but as soon as I got the hang of that it only added to the (fun) challenge!
That is to say, the game is not hand-holdy at all!

Due to how easy it is to pick up, and that it almost runs on a potato, this game saved me countless of hours on train and airplane trips!

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1609186297}
review:
[b]The Oath in Felghana[/b] is easily one of the best Ys games, and an excellent choice for both newcomers and already existing Ys fans.

Technically it's a remake of [b]Ys III: Wanderers from Ys[/b] (a 1989 game) but only in a very loose sense. Only the very basic skeleton of the story was borrowed, with the rest being expanded and rewritten to better fit the lore of the later games (in particular [url=store.steampowered.com/app/312540]The Ark of Napishtim[/url]), plus all the NPC's in the town now have unique portraits and personalities with their own little stories to tell, just like in other modern Falcom games.

This game was made right after The Ark of Napishtim and runs on the same engine and follows largely the same gameplay formula but massively improved. It's much more fast paced with Adol getting access to many movement abilities and the magic was overhauled to be much more useful. E.g. you can run at great speeds, double jump and do a whirlwind attack for both crowd control as well as gliding through the air, every type of magic can be charged Mega Man style. Virtually all grinding is gone, important upgrades are just given to you as you progress naturally, you don't need to farm materials to upgrade your magic, and it's impossible to run into enemies outside your level range (except for 2 tiny secret rooms). You can safely play the game blind as there are only 2 missables ([spoiler]Augite Brooch and Talisman of War[/spoiler]) and they're not very important and easy to find on your own anyway.

With the grinding gone the focus is now on the mechanical skill. The bosses are much harder than before and you can't heal during a boss fight. Generally speaking, the bosses are pretty well designed and definitely the highlight of the game, however there's a few overtuned bosses towards the end of the game, and some of the hitboxes are questionable. It's definitely the hardest game in the Ark engine trilogy, providing a tough challenge even on Normal. However, if you're a fan of hard games like Dark Souls you will feel right at home, retrying the boss fights and learning their patterns. Still, going back and grinding just one level can often make a huge difference due to the way the damage is calculated in this game.

The story while expanded is still not much to write home about. It's your classic "collect 4 MacGuffins and defeat the ancient evil" formula, but some of the characters are nice, especially Elena (the main girl) and some of the villagers and clergy. Ironically, background characters are better written than the main cast if only because they don't have to be so dramatic all the time. The game was recently updated to include the English voice acting (from the PSP version) and it's a pretty decent dub with Heather Hogan giving a great performance as Elena, and there's even Melissa Fahn voicing one of the kid characters using her Neptune voice. Sadly, there's no Japanese audio (yet) as XSEED doesn't own the rights to it.

When it comes to Ys games, the soundtrack is always a joy to listen to and The Oath in Felghana is no exception. It has some truly beautiful and blood pumping tracks like [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ATBcYQjE6rw]this[/url] or [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HSzaK_ueHY4]this[/url].

Overall, The Oath in Felghana is classic Ys at its finest, only falling a little short of [url=store.steampowered.com/app/207350]Ys Origin[/url], the final game in the Ark trilogy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988328815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1608171530}
review: Uma evolução incrível de Ys I & II, Ys the oath é um remake do 3o jogo da série. A ação é ainda mais intensa e o visual é uma mistura de 3d com 2d muito bonito. A trilha sonora deste remake continua a bela tradição de violinos e rock. É uma combinação estranha mas empolgante. É um RPG de ação, mais RPG do que um Zelda, por exemplo, pois existem itens melhoráveis, experiência, level up e até um nível considerável de diálogo. A história é muito boa também. Terminei o jogo em 10 horas e o recomendo totalmente. Em breve vou até fazer um review dele no meu canal do youtube (Gotaplays), pois acho que mais pessoas devem conhecer a ótima série Ys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021638367', 'num_games_owned': 706, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1606408317}
review:
Beautiful, fast paced action JRPG. The story is pretty by the numbers, but then again, it is a remake of a 1990 game, Ys III: Wanderers from Ys.

Challenging difficulty (although you can choose between 6 different difficulty modes, so you can go super easy), addicting hack and slash gameplay, that pushes you to go to the next enemy as fast as you can, since slaying enemies leaves active power-ups that you can pick up. These include XP multipliers, added defense or attack stats etc., that are timed, so if you want to keep these active, and even raised, you have to kill more enemies while they're active. Very rewarding and addicting.

The graphics are simple, but have a very pleasing visual style, with fully 3D modeled levels and 2D sprites for the characters and normal enemies (the bosses are polygonal, because they are HUGE). The music is simply magnificent, and IMO the best the Ys series has to offer. The devs are still actively improving the game from time to time, so they've patched in the English voice track, that was exclusive to the PSP version before. And 2 new soundtrack options were included this year, from the original Sharp X68000 and PC-88 versions of the game!

Pick this game up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122681974', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1680139624}
review:
Another great Ys game. However for those more into playing higher difficulties, this has a fair share of flaws (I played through on Nightmare).

Compared to Ys Origin which uses a similar gameplay style, this game is a bit more challenging in terms of general dungeon  progression which I really enjoyed. But then the boss fights happened. 

Unlike Ys Origin where almost all the bosses, while challenging, still manage to be fair, that's not the case with Felghana. Most of this game's bosses are hard to an unfair extent for their own various reasons, almost rivaling a certain couple infamous bosses from Ys I. This game has quite a few bosses, so this frequency of unfairness might be off-putting to some people.

Apart from the bosses, Felghana's gameplay style is probably my favorite of the series so far, and the story here is also pretty good. If you can look past the bosses, this game is absolutely worth considering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035259906', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1595109539}
review:
The second of the Ark-Engine games, and one of the Ys entries highly valued by fans, Oath in Felghana is perhaps *the* quintessential Ys game; fast-paced action, a gem of an OST, and a story involving digging the past civilisation and stopping it from destroying the world. Oath in Felghana is truly brilliant.

Learning what worked and what did not work in the previous game, Ark of Napishtim; OiF streamlined Adol's abilities somewhat to keep the gameplay smooth. This time around, Adol's main powers come from gems found out in the world. These grant him access to magic powers that he can take advantage of in battle. Furthermore, slain enemies now drop healing and vials that temporarily boost Adol's damage, defence and MP regen; keeping the fast paced gameplay continue much easier.

If you are even slightly interested in Ys, or even action RPGs as a whole, I cannot recommend Oath in Felghana enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025439235', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1218, 'last_played': 1703544563}
review:
Another classic Ys game! 
...But maybe not my favourite one.

--Gameplay--
It's classic Ys. You know exactly what to expect if you've played Origins before this one. Felghana does have a bit more of a 2.5D platformer style, though it also certainly has normal 3D area's.
You fight, level, grind, upgrade and explore your way through the story, getting frustrated at bosses every other few hours.
Bosses as usual also are very hard, and I needed to grind and upgrade a bit to slay them all. Unlike Origins, this game only has 1 character and 1 story path to play.
Personally though, maybe because I played Origin before, I did think this game was a bit less fun than other Ys games. Not bad at all, but just not my favourite Ys game.

--Graphics and Artstyle--
It's Falcom. Also looks a lot like the Trails in The Sky series, mainly because they were developed around the same time!
Felghana has a bit more of a bright, colorful artstyle and is a lot more varied than the very dark Origins, which I seem to keep bringing up because they are so similar.
So yeah, not the best graphics, low-res textures, rough geometry, but brimming with charm IMO. Character portrait art is just so good again as well!


--Music and SFX--
Very, very good soundtrack. This is standard with any Falcom game, we know that by now!
It's not my favourite Ys game in terms of music though, but still VERY solid.
Some specific tracks I'm still listening to weeks after playing!
The sound effects are fine as well, though I do recall having heard some of them before, like in Gurumin!
I played the game with the Japanese voices patch installed, so I can't comment on how the English voice acting is.


--Story--
Yeah, okay. I think the story was kinda weak this time. It didn't seem to tie in with the other Ys games at all, almost standalone. I never really felt connected to any character or anything that was happening.
The plot generally also is pretty predictable and standard. Especially if you've played a lot of other Falcom games, there's a lot of stuff that will feel very familiar to you.


--Technical and bugs--
I think I had 1 crash, making me lose a bit of progress... But other than that, no problems! Ran at a solid 60fps, which you should expect from a game this old I guess..

But yeah, If you like Ys, play this one too! Play all of them! Please!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063530380', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 725, 'last_played': 1596947619}
review:
I don't get why there are so many positive reviews, it must be due to nostalgia...

Story: Very cliché
English voices: Very cringy most times
Gameplay: For this game, difficult means annoying. I recommend playing on easy. You have to spend a lot of time grinding to do reasonable damage, more difficulty means more boss HP, so it just makes the game more boring, repeating the same attack patterns of the bosses time and time again (You can't change the difficulty either).
The combat is dull in my opinion, on the flip side you get to unlock new skill from time to time and boss fights are kind of fun at first.
There is a lot of backtracking too, checkpoints are sometimes too far away from each other and most times this game wants to be a platformer, seriously, if you are not into them you might find it very boring.

TL;DR: Came looking for a good RPG, ended up with a platformer with heavy grinding, mediocre story and voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198351618677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3105, 'last_played': 1595592297}
review:
fantastic game that ive had a great time playing in the past few weeks.  ive played ys 1 and 2 and then this one back to back now and im still ready for more so i think ill get ys memories of celceta for ps4 next which happened to have been released in europe just now actually

i believe the developer is especially well known for their trails of cold steel series, but ive heard those games are uber long, with lots of reading, and turn based combat. i just dont really like any of those things, rpg games are generally already long enough as they are. but the ys games are nice and punchy, short but not too long (my playtime as of this review says 51 hrs but almost 70% of that is just from idling bc Steam keeps recording the time played even when the window is minimised), real time action combat based rpg games. the level design is decent and the sense of adventure is really good. the challenge level is of a good standard (ive only played normal diff for now) and yet the games are very fair, ive beaten all 3 games ive played so far without any guides or videos, which is a good thing

the music is also really good. i found the dub to be serviceable though i thought the inn lady sounded a little funny but ok

would totally recommend this to fans of just good games in general, and rpg fans in particular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198977533052', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1624026976}
review:
游戏有些难度，对新手来说，boss战基本上需要好好练几遍才能通过。
游戏系统很有趣味，第一次接触伊苏就觉得很特别。这是个好游戏，而且是需要静下心来，好好琢磨品味的好游戏。虽难度不小，但是目前为止我还是想要坚持玩通关，想了解后续会如何发展。游戏热情没有被打击到消失。
战斗的BGM很有代入感，人物语音也不错。一些秘籍、小技巧设置得也很不错。对于一款有历史的老游戏来说，这些都是非常优秀的特点。不难想象为什么伊苏得到这么高的评价了。
总体来说，物有所值的一款游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007540184', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 9133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8143, 'last_played': 1638059919}
review:
Of the "middle" period [i]Ys[/i] games I've played ([i]Napishtim[/i], [i]Felghana[/i], [i]Origin[/i]) I think I like this one the best. The plot is basic, the characters stock JRPG, but the care and attention put into the game overcomes whatever weak points might be inferred from this. There is only one town in this game, which seems like it would limit the story and immersion, and truthfully the townspeople are not deep characters [i]per se[/i], but they really feel like a little community, and you can tell the writers cared enough to update their dialogue as the story progresses and give all of them little hooks to connect them to our hero Adol. 

Of course, most people probably play [i]Ys[/i] for the gameplay, and it's really good here too. The controls are tight, which helps for platforming sections, you unlock abilities as you go through the game and to my recollection all are useful in different circumstances. The environments and dungeons are all varied and it just feels satisfying to go round killing enemies, which is what most of these games are made up of. The bosses are genuinely challenging and it feels good when you come up with a strategy to beat them.

Because of the game's difficulty, it's pretty brutal for Achievement hunters. A casual player can choose their difficulty but if you want all Achievements you'll have to get crazy good at the game. Other than that I recommend it absolutely. A great example of taking an average JRPG story and doing the best you can with it, adding lots of charm and care, so that WE care.

Edit: After an update, the game now features voice acting! This is a bit of a mixed blessing. I really like hearing Heather Hogan as Elena, she was Colette in [i]Tales of Symphonia[/i] and her voice will always be iconic for me for that reason. The guy who does Dogi is fine, but the guy who does Chester was way too hammy for me - which is weird, cause he's done good work in the [i]Danganronpa[/i] series. Additionally I found a lot of the minor NPCs' voices annoying, either too exaggerated (Margo), or over-emphasising every other word in a failed bid for some degree of [i]gravitas[/i] (Chester, McGuire, Edgar, etc.). Honestly, it sounds like it could've been a problem with direction, or just a rush-job, which is a bit of a shame. Still, you can skip through dialogue from characters you don't care to hear.

They've also included the option to play with music from the PC-88 and X68000 versions of the game, which is a nice little touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043905938', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1558814970}
review:
Ys III: Dogi's Big Adventure, just kidding that's Ys Seven.
Felghana's a big favorite and that's probably because it has quite possibly the highest CBT pain potential of any Ys game. You heard it right here folks.
BUT BESIDES THAT, it improves on Napishtim's basic gameplay and fixes the jank dash jump into something you won't have pained recollections of when you get to be in the nursing home. The bosses are better, you get a cool rival (which you sort of have in Napishtim, but it's done better here I think), and overall it's just a solid hack and slash. If I had to critique, it's that the game only really starts showing what it can do in using your skillset in platforming when you get to the Sealed Tower and by then the game's almost over. It does make that area very memorable though, just wish more of the game was designed to make use of your skills like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063096193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3524, 'last_played': 1616038313}
review: This game is like Legend of Zelda if Zelda were fast paced, challenging, and had great music. The entire Ys series is among the best out there, and this particular entry is one of my favorites!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038544131', 'num_games_owned': 876, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 3138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1682341654}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043341011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1594312751}
review:
Started the game on Very Easy, got an achievement mocking me for doing so, then after struggling against the first boss, I had a realization. Where's the dodge button? How am I supposed to avoid attacks? Jumping!? 

That was when I realized that I had to refund the game because I didn't want to put up with janky gameplay.

Just play YS Seven instead, it's better... by miles. Ignore all the people who recommend this game, they are clearly blinded by Nostalgia, there are good YS games out there nowadays but this game has aged like mouldy cheese. It's literally the most bare bones Action RPG ever made. YS SEVEN makes this game look like a freaking joke by comparison, you have more attacks, you have dodging, you have charge attacks and also the ability to play as lots of different characters each with their own playstyle. Get that game, don't waste your time with this trash.

Honestly if you absolutely have to play this game, you might as well play the PC Engine version because as bad as it is, at least the music is good, that is... if you want a history lesson on how bad Action RPG's used to be because quite frankly, though the YS series may have pioneered the genre... it didn't really start out well, bumping into enemies to hit them!? Why do people still think that is acceptible today? Let alone this.

Every YS game before YS SEVEN is obsolete now, they are important to play if you care about the history of the genre but otherwise, let that history remain history.

Now what games should you play? Well I highly recommend YS Memories Of Celceta as a starting point, really easy to pick up and play, very forgiving too, it's the best way to learn how the modern games work. Afterwards you have YS SEVEN and YS VIII, both great games that are worth your time.

As for this game, just listen to the PC Engine soundtrack on Youtube because it's amazing and leave this game in the dumpster where it belongs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333273476', 'num_games_owned': 901, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1597327623}
review:
First off this is my very first Ys game and I must say they just nailed it.

Let me start off with some Pros.

Pros:
-Fast, Fluid combat with rewarding feedback
-Silky smooth gameplay
-Tough as nails boss fights
-Lovable characters (excuse my lack of narrative taste)

Cons:
-Tough as nails boss fights
-The back tracking is a bit punishing but it's probably the grind factor kicking in

What else? Go get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110162657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1612630295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094633295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1640182396}
review:
So this game is a remake of YS 3 and is a solid ARPG, if a bit short. Im nearly through and despite my steam playtime being 9 hours my in game time is about 5, I'll explain why in a bit. The game plays like a mix between the first 2 YS games and the modern style YS games and is a unique entry in the series, its overall a great game gameplay wise. The OST is incredible too, is starts strong and keeps its momentum and the story and characters are good. This is also the first game to give Dogi significant screentime.

Now onto my next point, this game is hard as crap even on Normal, the amount of deaths I've had is probably around 100, deaths in dungeons also tend to be quite punishing as the save points are rare, usually at the beginning of a dungeon and then just before the boss, a death while going through a dungeon resets you to your last save point. Deaths against bosses are fair as youre allowed to retry instantly which is really helpful because you'll be sure to die to certain bosses a lot, like upwards of 15 times. This is assuming you don't take ages to grind, which will make the game easier but will take ages.

I'd recommend playing on Easy for your first run if you're playing blind and while I'd recommend getting it on sale over full price either works. Recommended for those looking for a great, very challenging ARPG or fans of the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840069225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1593996013}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126608274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4429, 'last_played': 1629988736}
review:
played this game a lot on my PSP before buying it on steam and since I had a lot of fun, I couldn't miss the opportunity when I saw it on sale. This game is a masterpiece and anyone who enjoys a good hack and slash, or an action RPG game, it is a must try and it has a lot of replay value if you like to challenge yourself on various difficulties and go for a better time on the leaderboards, be it on finishing the game or on boss rush.

From here I'll mostly talk about my experience with it compared to my experience on the PSP version.
From the start I noticed it lacks some content such as the gallery that unlocked pictures as you finish the game or the boss rush on each difficulty, and new game plus which kinda sucks since it not only allowed you to keep your items, it also granted bonuses that were really fun to mess around with. The boss rush is missing the easy and nightmare difficulties, and when I saw that this port didn't had the double boost that heals the player when used, it scared me to think of how hard would it be on harder difficulties, however it was not as hard as I expected, and an interesting extra challenge for anyone coming from the portable version, there is also the matter of voice clips that when I first played where completely absent, however that's not the case anymore since they were added into the game but some parts are still missing which can be a bummer.

The one advantage it has over the PSP version is the graphics, the higher resolution really makes everything looks cooler, and regardless of these very little issues, it's still an awesome game. The gameplay and plot is unchanged from previous releases, the controls are very fluid and can be changed to however you prefer. If you're a Ys can and haven't played this yet, you're missing out on a wonderful experience

author: {'steamid': '76561198048843945', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1611773010}
review:
Think back, to your worst nightmare. The feeling of dark isolation and helplessness. The feeling that an evil force controlled your destiny. Perhaps we can compare these emotions with the terror that enclosed the people of Kenai. Their peace had been shattered by the domination of an evil demon named Demonicus. His long arms of decimation swept over the lands, and burned all life in an inferno of slaughter and destruction. Yet even the worst of nightmares offer some hope of survival...

Kenai's fortunes lay in this stunning warrior of indomitable strength. His bravery was renowned throughout the land, as he had once saved the ENTIRE world from similar destruction. But now his challenge was greater than ever before. The insurmountable ferocity of Demonicus was frightening, even to our courageous hero. But a  R E A L   M A N  never shows his fear - And Adol was, in fact, a most gallant soul. He battled Demonicus with equal intensity in this horrific struggle to the death. The skies had darkened, and the Earth shook as Demonicus applied his brutal force and displayed his savage rage! There were to be no prisoners in this holy war of Good over Evil. Demonicus unleashed his awesome size and strength against our hero, but Adol's cunning wit allowed him to avoid and eclipse all of the Aliens' fatal blows. 

There was more than just a miracle behind this saviour of tormented lands. Who could fight such courageous battles and manage to pull victory from such impossible odds? Who was this strange raider of evil foes? His legend, and the legend of this land, are about to be retold. The adventure is in the spirit of the warrior, and the warrior is YOU.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087210166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1592389388}
review:
I think most people looking for a challenging RPG will like this one. 
I'd say I mostly like it however I would warn that the bosses can be incredibly hard and require development of a good strategy which means you could die many times before you find a way but at least there's a save point before them. The monsters are cool and the bosses look awesome. It takes time to get used to the control and gameplay but I'd still say the game mechanics keep it interesting. Grinding is boring in some games but in this I kind of enjoy it - there's always a bit of challenge to it since each type of enemy needs to be defeated in a unique way - and the more money and orval you collect means the better weapons and upgrades. Initially, some of the level/area choices are pretty standard and not too imaginative - like mines, lava world, ice world, that sort of thing - however it seems like it's hard to find imaginative world ideas in most games. It is cool though that you can enter new areas with new abilities by melting ice or breaking rock. The voice acting is good, the music is fairly basic, and sound fx are good. The motivations of characters often don't SEEM to make much sense. I still have no idea who the main character is, why he's there, what his background is, what his motivation is, etc... he doesn't even have a voice actor - instead his words are narrated. So to me that's a weak point, however there are elements of the story and other characters that look quite promising (I'm not quite done the game yet).

author: {'steamid': '76561197972313322', 'num_games_owned': 1525, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1591306393}
review:
(Time inaccurate - beat the game in around 10 hours, also have it for the PSP. Planning on re-doing at a higher difficulty later)

Graphics: Colorful and varied; amazing transition from the PSP.
Music: Falcom. Industry's best in-house music people. Fight me.
Sounds: Shares a lot of sounds from other Ys games of the period, which is fine. English voice acting incredibly corny, but I find it endearing. Love the narrator.
Controls: XBONE controller feels natural. Everything is tight and responsive. Feels like it should.

Who it is for:
Honestly, more than just JRPG people. In fact, many JRPG people are going to be turned off by the skill requirement, which I think is the case for many of Falcom's games.
I've played practically every 8- and 16-bit JRPG over the past 20+ years, gotten insanely bored of how easy they are designed to be, and it feels like this and the other Ys games were designed specifically for me.
Wish I would have played these games in the first place =/

I would recommend it as an entry point into the series if you can't handle Ys I/II.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050805223', 'num_games_owned': 1600, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1592775931}
review:
4.5 / 5.0

Another great entry in the Ys series that uses the same Ark engine also employed in Origin and Napishtim, making the gameplay fast paced and easy to pick and play (but difficult to master and beat bosses if playing on Normal difficulty and up). 

Very solid story that includes plot twists and Adol meeting a number of interesting characters in Felghana. Falcom has recently (early 2020) provided voice audio to this Steam version so it was the perfect timing for me to jump in and play and complete this game. The voice acting is not complete (only important characters and story dialogues are spoken) but it's actually very good and adds to the immersion and character development of the game.

https://youtu.be/WdEUozdRTpM
