author: {'steamid': '76561198267463051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2035, 'last_played': 1589828463}
review:
Like everything Falcom makes, this game does not disappoint. A lively world with unique NPCs that have their own personality, portraits and backstories. 

The story is rather simple, and yet it offers a few plot twists and keeps you entertained until the end. The characters have their little twists and are lovely written. 

Gameplay is fast-paced and the different kinds of magic and jumps attacks let you experiment to your heart's content. Though prepare to get your butt kicked now and then: Even on Normal mode, this game definitely deserves its "Difficult" tag. Especially boss fights will require a lot of skill and thought. 

Music. The music is wonderful. If you are a fan of quick guitar riffs that get your blood pumping, this soundtrack will not disappoint you.  

RPG beginners shouldould try the game on "Easy" or "Very Easy". If you are already a fan of Ys or Falcom in general, I definitely recommend this game. Same goes for fans of the Action RPG genre. Ys is a wonderful series you should definitely check out! 

That's it, and never forget: Dogi rules!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030123832', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1590113927}
review: I played this before it had voice acting, so I have no idea if that ruined it or not, but...this game was surprisingly good. There's a bit of cringe-worthy anime fanservice stuff (o-oh, Elena-chan!) but the actual hack 'n slash mechanics are pretty satisfying. The soundtrack does some exhilarating things with piano and electric guitar, and the bosses are...fiendish. I actually found this a little too hard, but I'd recommend it regardless. Satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452656285', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2346, 'last_played': 1589411025}
review:
This is a great game, i beat this on hard on my first playthrough and i totally recommend doing that, is a fair amount of difficulty and fun, the game never feels unfair, it requires practice and patience. The bosses in the game are so much fun to fight, the battles are full of adrenaline, speed and acomplishment when you finally defeat them.

The level design is really fun, the platforming feels good, the exploration is on point and there are some side quest to fulfill but nothing too crazy in that aspect though.

The music is AMAZING, this is a remake so every song is a cover of past versions of the game, which are available in the package. The voice acting is a LOT of fun, is was recently added to the game and is a really welcome update to an old title in steam.

The only thing i don't like is that when a boss kills you he continues attacking your corpse and is really annoying.

I totally recommend this game, is awesome and there is a difficulty setting so is accesible to everybody.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040452979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1589003016}
review:
(This game is a Remake of Ys 3)
If anyone needs to be brought up to speed on the Lore of the Ys games here's what you missed.
Red headed hero guy goes on many adventure & his friend Dogi is there too, no I don't know what he does so stop asking!

- The story is a textbook Japanese fantasy adventure (90's adventure game).
- It's a very basic adventure game.
- Difficulty is low in most areas but spikes randomly (mostly bosses).
- Weirdest mapped controls on game pads if seen & no way to remap, L3 is the menu & shoulder buttons aren't used.
- Very short game there is achievement for completing this in 5 hours & that wouldn't be hard.
- Hated fighting every boss, it just stops being an adventure RPG & stats are worthless here.
- All locations look very boring, I miss the 16 bit backgrounds.
- Maybe wait until this game is on discount.


I played the SNES game as a kid, so I may be biased. I just think this game worked better as a side-scroller, but if you want to swing a sword around this can work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000807456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1588887164}
review:
I really enjoyed this game. I only wanted to play it for its simple story, so I picked the Very Easy difficulty and blasted through it relatively easily. Only a couple of the bosses ever gave me a little trouble.

It took me 11 hours to leisurely beat the story, and I can happily say I enjoyed my experience. The story wasn't anything special, but I enjoy short, simple stories like this from time to time. Plus. the Ys series isn't really known for its characters or story, but for its music and challenging gameplay.

I also felt the game to be much more informative on how to progress through the story, unlike the previous Ys I & II, where it wasn't always conveyed very well to the player on what you have to do next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387315167', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1651270543}

author: {'steamid': '76561198272131070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2314, 'last_played': 1609876418}
review:
The third game in the Ys series (or the remake of the third game anyway) is a great entry in the style of action RPGs. You're not going to find anything groundbreaking, but if you're looking for anything from "casual" to "very challenging", this game has it - just pick the corresponding difficulty and away you go.

The game recently had voice acting added to the Steam version in February. Some of it is better than others, but the main characters are all solid, especially the Stoddart siblings. The story is pretty good, with ups and downs where you might expect them, but overall enjoyable. The game will probably take you about 10 hours to finish, although that is highly dependent on how much you look around and the difficulty you're playing on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126282284', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1627528597}
review:
If you want to play a great classic, play this.
I can't recommend this version for replay value or achievements though.

The music is give and take in terms of composition. Some songs are better on older versions of the game, but there were some nice choices here as well.

The story was changed in some peculiar ways, but it retains the original sequence of events well enough with some added spice. Nothing drastic or damaging.

Some of the achievements feel more like menial tasks than something secret or an accomplishment. They want you to play every difficulty setting, but the aggravation and time associated with that isn't worth it unless you like punishing yourself.

There's a debug mode to make the game a little more user friendly but I'd hardly say it's necessary. Using it also prevents you from earning certain achievements, which feels really cheap to me. Either let it work for all achievements or don't include it at all.

The only thing I'd say debug mode is good for is getting to maximum level for the achievement. For whatever reason they put in a weird failsafe to prevent you from being too powerful; monsters give you less experience each time you gain a level.
Max level is 60, but by 50-53 gaining levels slows down into an absurd amount of time.

Artificial difficulty is an understatement in terms of how the game tries to be challenging.
Boss Rush Mode will make you angry and that's all I have to say about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151715319', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1588114715}
review:
Ys: Memories of Celceta'nın sonlarında gördüğümüz mavi saçlı adamın(bu oyunda ismi Dogi) köyü olan Felghana'ya gidiyoruz ve olayları çözmeye çalışıyoruz. Kısaca bakacak olursak:

-Grafikler Ys: Origin kalitesinde... Piksel olarak çok kaliteli ve göze hoş geliyor.

-Oynanış süresi ortalama 8-10 saat arası sürmekte.

-Müzikler önceki oyunlarına göre gayet kaliteli. 1-2 müziği oyun dışında dinlenecek kadar güzel(buzul kaplı yerdeki müzik favorim)

-Rpg öğeleri Ys Origin, Ys 1 ve 2 deki gibi ama + olarak bu oyunda aldıgınız silahların seviyesini yükseltebiliyorsunuz(max 3 seviye)

-Bu serinin en iyi yanı zaten Boss savaşları söylemeye gerek bile yok.

-Hikayesi bu zamanda sade ve tahmin edilebilir. İngilizcesi basit... Lise düzeyindeki ingilizce ile rahatça anlayabilirsiniz konuyu.

-Bu oyunun tek eksi yanı ingilizce seslendirmeler. Duygu derinliği ve hissedilebilirliği yok. Okulda düz yazı okur gibi tatsız tuzsuz dümdüz okumalar... Birisi ağlıyor mesela ama ne o sesi yansıtabilmişler ne de uğraşmışlar...

Bu serinin her oyunu gibi bu oyunun fiyatı da indirimli indirimsiz hakkını veriyor.

Kendime göre puan tablom ise;

50 < Oynanmaya değmez
51 - 59 = Çok Kötü
60 - 69 = Kötü
70 - 79 = İdare Eder
80 - 89 = İyi
90 - 95 = Çok iyi
96 - 99 = Mükemmel
100 = Yok öyle bir oyun.

PUAN = 86

author: {'steamid': '76561198098546533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1586399738}
review:
Now the reason i'm saying to give this a pass is because the game is very dated and just not as much fun to play. I played this after playing YS Origins and if you played you can tell that Origins is a very polished version of this game. it was also more fun to play and the story was more interesting in that one.

the save points are way too far apart, and the enemy levels felt very random. it's not a BAD game, but i think your time is better suited to play the other YS games at least. i don't see the story here being too important in the overall plot, all YS games are in a way standalone too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126706272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1592499108}
review:
RECOMENDO ESTE PARA SEU PRIMEIRO JOGO DA SÉRIE! (e para presentar para os amigos que não conhecem a série)

Joguei o Ys Origin, I, II, III (Celceta) e finalmente cheguei nesta maravilha que é o Felghana, sinceramente, é o melhor Ys que joguei até agora.

Simplesmente incrível em todos os sentidos, trilha, história, vilão. É realista e não deixa de ser interessante por nenhum segundo! E o melhor de tudo, é dublado em Inglês! É demais ouvir os ótimos atores que dublaram fazendo as falas. Não sei por onde começar, esse é Ys é demais! 

Vale cada centavo e minuto jogado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079494836', 'num_games_owned': 2194, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2069, 'last_played': 1602567036}
review:
Tercera parte de la saga Ys (renombrado como Ys: The Oath in Felghana), dejo una pequeña aclaración: si uno quiere jugar esta saga CRONOLOGICAMENTE hablando esta entrega debe ser jugada despues de Ys Memories of Celceta (4ta entrega), habiendo aclarado este punto doy inicio a mi reseña de esta entrega:


Pros:
- Poca exigencia en los requerimientos de PC, ya que es un juego muy antiguo es algo que se agradece, anda hasta en una tostadora
- Historia simple y facil de seguir con algunos puzzles sencillos
- La música de calidad, algo típico del Falcom Sound team JDK (btw tengo la partitura para piano del tema principal si alguien la quiere agregue y se la mando.)
- Jugabilidad divertida, nada como destrozar a esos enemigos que te masacraban cuando ingresabas a una zona no acorde a tu nivel.
- Duración: me tomó 33,3 horas (lo hice a posta xD) para completar el juego al 100%.

Contra:
- El farmeo, es común que en esta saga uno deba farmear ya que al estar por debajo del nivel de los mobs / jefes uno no provoque ningún punto de daño a estos, es algo tedioso pero entendible.
- La falta del Español (este un tema bastante debatible, sé que las traducciones cuestan dinero, pero este juego en particular no tiene tantos textos), dejando de lado esto es un juego EXCELENTE.

Puntuación final: 8/10, por ahora es mi Ys favorito. recomiendo comprarlo en oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110717365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2485, 'last_played': 1585258748}
review:
Après avoir joué à YS VIII ; I et II j'ai attaqué le III...

J'ai joué en nightmare le I (oui je suis un fou) et le II.
J'ai donc attaqué fleur au fusil cet épisode en nightmare sans savoir la galère dans laquelle j'allais.

En effet le III est une regression sur plusieurs plans.
Il n'y a plus d'item de soin, on ne peut pas sauvegarder quand on veut.

On se retrouve aussi à jouer à Mario en sautant de plateforme en plateforme...

Le saut parlons en, avant d'obtenir l'attaque du vent, c'est une vraie plaie de combattre les créature volante.

Enfin les combats contre les boss sont extremement dur et pour certains la difficulté se rapproche du I, je pense notamment au dragon de glace qui fait en boucle son attaque ultime (qu'on ne peut pas éviter entiérement....) et le boss de fin qui m'a demandé 3h de try...

On est obligé de levelé avant chaque boss, alors certes sur YS on a toujours cette phase de farm, mais là c'était systématique et surtout c'est loongg.... quasiement 2h de farm à chaque fois, pire à la fin les mobs max sont lvl 48 !!! 
Le lvl Max d'Adol est de 60, le boss final demande au minima etre 53 (je l'ai fai lvl 55) imaginez le temps que cela prend !! Et bah je peux vous le dire 5h !!!

Si on enleve le temps de farming le jeu m'aurait pris 15-20h...

Le dernier point noir, les succès steam.
dans les 3 autres versions d'YS que j'ai joué, on peut faire tous les succès en une seule partie ! Ce qui est génial, mais dans celui-ci il faut refaire le jeu 6 FOIS !!
C'est n'importe quoi !! Alors oui les succès en soit sont inutiles, mais je le vois comme des défis à compléter pour finir le jeu à 100%. Et j'aime bien finir mes jeux à 100% sauf que là, c'est imbuvable...

Le scénario quand à lui est disons assez court et simpliste, on a cependant droit à quelques rebondissement et belles scènes, mais le jeu (hors difficulté) est assez court.

Si comme moi vous voulez faire tous les YS, je vous conseille fortement de ne pas jouer celui-ci en nigthmare.

Mon prochain YS sera le VI, celui-ci ayant servit de base pour faire le III, je vais l'attaquer direct en normal car je n'ai pas envie de revivre les mêmes chianteries que le III à savoir les heures interminable de farming et les phases de plateforme qui apparemment sont pire que celui du III (Comme en témoignes les commentaires)...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1371193071}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#368 out of 612)... it's time for Ys (III): The Oath in Felghana.

I've said it before, I'll say it again: Falcom has never made a bad game. Ys: Memories of Celceta is no exception. If you've played any Ys game before, you know what to expect: a fun ARPG with lots of combat and exploration and a simple, but nonetheless compelling story set in a fantasy world heavily inspired by real-world history and mythology. The joy of an Ys game, usually, lies in the invigorating, fast-paced hack-and-slash gameplay.

The Oath in Felghana is, perhaps, the best of the "classic" Ys games. There's very little narrative, and the overall structure of the game is very simple—cliched, even. But while the story may be lacking, the combat (and dungeon design) is brilliant. The Oath in Felghana is a compelling that that always feels delightfully energetic as you hop about hacking and slashing your way through hordes of monsters. And, of course, being a Falcom game that musical score accompanying the action is fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352330418', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1584353409}
review:
买了好几年，正好ys9通关了来补补前作，因为汉化补丁没打上去所以下了个三大妈版通关（喂）有空再回来刷个成就。
虽说是15年前的作品，不过整体素质就算放在现在我觉得也是个优秀的作品，BGM自然不用说，毕竟是法老控大换血前的jdk，不管是哪一首会留下深刻的印象，钟楼那首更是刻进dna(艾蕾娜，教我爬楼）改革前的伊苏操作相比现在磕个苹果派无脑放技能来说还是有技术含量多了，每一个boss都设计得很有特色，不像伊苏9通关了我都没有一个记住了的boss（非要说也只有前作复刻的大蜈蚣和古代种）不过ys9的立体地图设计得也非常棒，法法还是有用心做的。
主要还是想谈谈剧情（伊苏系列的男二真是每一个都精准的集中了我的性癖，不管是盖修还是修梅尔还是阿鹰还是切斯特，怎么都这么香的）关于切斯特的人设和剧情安排，感觉和库洛还是挺像的，不过切斯特嘴更毒，做事也更狠，两个人相似的地方就都是为了复仇当了幕后黑手的枪，切斯特的复仇比起库洛完全针对岳父，更像是一种自虐行为，和镇上的npc对话我们可以知道，切斯特曾经也是个阳光向上又积极的好青年，如果不知道真相的话，也许他只是把亲人的逝去永远埋在心底，但是那场屠杀他应该是从来也没有忘记过的，他一定责问过自己，为什么活下来的只有自己和艾蕾娜，家人族人都那样凄惨的死去，只有自己得到幸福，真的是可以的吗？切斯特最大的罪，就是AOE式复仇，将整个巴雷斯坦城的人卷入这场灾难，明明城里的人都是无辜的，他为什么会这么做？真的只是被神父蛊惑了吗？我个人认为，他这样极端的行为，正是他自虐的表现，他无法原谅活下来的自己，就像X花雪月的帝弥托利一样，他觉得，对于族人来说，仅仅只是把“幕后黑手”干掉根本就不够，只有把当年施加在他们身上的这份痛苦完全还给他们，才能平息族人的愤怒，杀人对他来说也是痛苦的，也只有自己也承担下这份痛苦，才是赎罪，切斯特的思考模式，完全是基于逝者身上的，他以幸存者的身份去理解逝者，这就是他痛苦的源头，艾蕾娜由于不记得当年的灾难，心理要健康的多，所以想得开，至于救下夫人和她的两个孩子，可能也是看到了他们想到了当年的自己和艾蕾娜，也可能是想给自己一份最后的救赎，切斯特的死是必然的，他的罪过是无法偿还的，有一个弥补过错的机会，自然，该落幕时，是不会怯懦的。
说来也是讽刺，勇者的后裔成为了打开潘多拉魔盒的罪人，和这篇土地完全没有关系的人，反倒成为了救世主，最终结束灾厄的人，却是罪人。
最后的boss也很有意思，被抽干魔力的干尸竟然不止一个，魔王复活这件事，是不是已经发生过很多次了呢？所谓的魔王，也只是被造出的道具，给世人降下天罚的，不是神明，伊苏系列的神和人类的关系也是有够奇怪的，感觉每一部都不一样，也许到了罗门篇能好好填坑吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198097512483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1583589496}
review:
Ys: Oath in Felghana é um remake do jogo Ys III - Wanderers of Ys (sim, aquele jogo em que um pezinho encostado no boss dá instakill!). Para muitos, esse remake é o melhor jogo da série Ys. Pessoalmente, não posso afirmar isso pois não joguei todos, mas certamente está entre os melhores. Sou suspeito para falar pois joguei ambas as versões, mas essa review não vai focar em comparações.

Adol Christin e seu amigo Dogi visitam Felghana, cidade-natal de Dogi. Uma série de reviravoltas acontecem, surgindo novos inimigos e cabe a Adol proteger a cidade dos vilões. Acredito que a história de Oath in Felghana não é razoalvemente bem explicada, e as vezes fica até mesmo em segundo plano.

É na jogabilidade, no entanto, que Oath in Felghana se destaca mais. É um JRPG de ação, praticamente hack'n'slash, em que hordas de inimigos são derrotadas, com três possibilidades de skills, além de efeitos de boost na movimentação e velocidade de ataque do herói, que tornam o jogo mais divertido e empolgante. Alguns inimigos requerem skills ou itens específicos para serem derrotados, o que obriga o jogador a revisitar dungeons, aumentando o senso de exploração. Esse é um aspecto interessante, visto que afora isso o jogo infelizmente é muito linear...

Mas talvez o aspecto mais marcante desse jogo é a dificuldade. Há vários níveis de dificuldade para todos os tipos de perfil, dos mais iniciantes em JRPGs aos mais hardcore. Felghana é um dos jogos mais desafiadores que já joguei, mas isso não significa que a dificuldade é balanceada, pelo contrário... em algumas situações há poucas alternativas para se esquivar de um ataque inimigo, dando a impressão de que não basta apenas ser muito competente nas batalhas (em especial os bosses), mas também contar com um pouco de sorte... (ou desviar de projéteis à la Matrix)

O jogo em si só possui um final, o que é um pouco frustrante, visto que, com tantos níveis de dificuldade, seria mais compensador obter um final alternativo depois de tanto esforço. Infelizmente não é o que acontece. Aliás, o jogo possui várias limitações: existe um número muito limitado de espadas e equipamentos, e o upgrade desses requer o farm de ores que podem ser facilmente obtidos encontrando um chest numa dungeon, por exemplo. Isso quer dizer que a evolução do personagem é limitada ao progresso do jogo... Dificilmente você vai ficar OP nos primeiros capítulos do jogo.

Felghana é um JRPG com uma proposta de jogo um pouco diferente dos outros JRPGs. Quando se explora uma dungeon, o intervalo entre um save point e outro costuma ser grande, e dependendo de qual nível você esteja, é necessário retornar ao último save point (o que pode consumir muito tempo) ou retornar à cidade para upar seus equipamentos. É possível avançar nas dungeons, mas é muito arriscado. Você não sai carregando um monte de poções no bolso como em outros JRPGs, mas depende do drop de alguns monstros para recuperar HP por exemplo. É importante ressaltar isso, pois pode se tornar uma experiência muito frustrante morrer no meio de uma dungeon e recomeçar do zero...

A trilha sonora é memorável. Em alguns momentos te deixa "pumped up", e anima as batalhas. Mas, as vezes varia de acordo com o cenário do jogo: de repente muda de uma melodia triste para um rock energizante, rs.

Concluindo: devido as limitações de época, não se pode exigir muito de Ys: Oath in Felghana. Recomendo o jogo se você é fã de JRPGs das antigas e procura uma experiência bem desafiadora. Atualmente, a XSEED acrescentou dublagem e opção de trocar de BGM para os jogos originais, o que deu um pouco mais de vida ao jogo. Apesar de tudo, é um dos meus JRPGs favoritos. Você vai chorar de raiva, eu garanto. xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198102954038', 'num_games_owned': 4434, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 766, 'last_played': 1600215166}
review:
玩过的第三部伊苏作品，Steam入手只为补票。

这一作的爽快感以及BGM的优秀程度在那个年代给我留下了非常深刻的印象。尽管当时玩的是日文版，但是因为有着伊苏I的基础，没有对我通关造成任何困扰。当然有个小漏洞，学了二段跳之后本来是要去矿坑进行后续剧情，但是却也可以去之前去不了的雪山，只不过无法触发雪山中段BOSS的剧情。这个问题当时困扰了我蛮久。

很感谢能在当时互联网并不如此发达的时候玩到这样一部作品。我觉得即使票价是现在商城标价的十倍，都不足以与当时带给我的快乐划上等号。前几天刚通了怪人之夜，希望2022年在伊苏35周年的时候，能继续玩到伊苏系列的优秀作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198399766036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1609257046}
review: E' meraviglioso. L'aggiunta del doppiaggio aggiunge moltissimo, vale la pena di rigiocarlo anche solo per sentire la voce di Elena, Dogi e degli altri. La voce di Galbalan nello scontro finale aggiunge tantissimo alla concitazione della sfida. E' molto più divertente affrontarlo sentendo che ti provoca, pur di distrarti... Imperdibile per tutti i fan di YS, o degli action RPG in generale.

review:
之前在 PSP 上通关一次，这次又在 Steam 上通一次，满满都是回忆。最终 Boss  把我虐个半死，来来回回硬生生摸清楚 Boss 的所有套路，熟练的让人心疼。

快节奏动作游戏，绝对配得上伊苏作为法老控看家之作的名声。伊苏音乐一向优秀，这作 BGM 特别燃，一听就跟打鸡血似的；玩起来特别爽快，买就完事儿了 ：-）

其乐 keylol（原蒸汽动力）有中文补丁，翻译质量优秀，不影响成就解锁。唯一遗憾的是 Steam 版打了中文补丁后没有任何语音。

review:
2.5d的时代过去了，但我很怀恋它。

2.5D这种形式比2D更有想象空间，但又不像纯3D那样让人头晕。日式RPG之类的衰落就源于一窝蜂的都想上3D

author: {'steamid': '76561198383577446', 'num_games_owned': 6114, 'num_reviews': 496, 'playtime_forever': 7557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 967, 'last_played': 1678437044}
review: 法老控的游戏大家都懂得。价格作为日厂游戏简直是白菜价。可惜旗下多款游戏都被国内代理了，中文有版权独占了。网上找的汉化补丁链接都失效的。但还是趁着史低买来花了一天多通关了。这次更新了英语配音，那么老的上古游戏最近还在更新，感觉还算不错哦。地图虽然不是很大，但迷宫和谜题设计的非常棒，剧情也很紧凑，虽然我之前并没玩过这代..啃着英文有点难受呀。关键是用原版玩还不能加速，有的地方不练级会很苦B。但这剧情看一半后面套路就差不多摸清了。一共就那么点NPC，果然后面那老哥要洗白然后GG... 这代有部分场景做的像横版闯关一样非常有意思，特别是最后的城堡，钟楼场景。印象最深的还是最终BOSS战了。BGM也是超赞啊！

author: {'steamid': '76561198023136804', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1584976723}
review:
Adol and his stalwart companion Dogi have travelled to the quaint country Felghana, childhood home to Dogi and his friends. Things are not as peaceful as they expected, however, with aggressive monsters roaming the land and a ruthless local noble issuing increasingly heartless edicts upon the population. It's up to Adol to investigate exactly where these monsters are coming from, hopefully without drawing the Count's ire...

If, like myself, your first experience with Falcom's long-running Ys franchise was through 2017's Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana, you're probably expecting certain things from an Ys game. Let me be clear right away: The Oath in Felghana is -not- like Lacrimosa at all. No flash guard or flash dodge mechanics, no dialogue choices for protagonist Adol, a much more sparse narrative, and higher overall difficulty. Bosses in particular are unforgiving even on Normal difficulty; make sure you're prepared to grind out some levels on a regular basis!

However, as long as you can adjust your expectations accordingly, I'd say there's a lot to love in this little action JRPG. Exploration is still satisfying as ever, and whilst the story is fairly basic, it's still engaging enough to desire seeing it through until the end. I'll happily recommend this to people who wish more Ys in their lives, or people who are looking for a relatively short (10-16 hour) action JRPG!

review: There's not many Steam Games that make me go out of my way to get all the achievements, but this is definitely one of them. This game is one of the best games in the Ys series, and one of the best Action RPGs ever made. The Boss design is second to none, and each one is beatable without taking any damage whatsoever. This game was doing "Tough but fair" long before Dark Souls or Demon's Souls made it popular, and it did it well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991261799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2712, 'last_played': 1580858762}
review:
I you have played [i]"Ys VI"[/i] or [i]"Ys Origin"[/i], then you already know what the gameplay is like.
If you have not: It is simple action-combat with a jump- and attack-button. Attacks are based on the movement of the character. (Example: If the character is falling, he will automatically stab towards the ground when attacking) You will also obtain simple spells, which can be used both offensive, defensive and to get past certain obstacles. There are no dodge or parry, except for simply getting out of the way with basic movement and/or spells.

Story is pretty classic. You have your hero, a town/land that needs help, a bad guy, and some mystery on the side. I love the simple stories that does not try to make things more complicated than it needs to be, but it also means you can probably see a few things coming a mile down the road. So if you want a game with shocking twists and turns, then this is probably not the one.

If you have not played any of the games in the series before, then fret not. Most of [i]"Ys"[/i] are unique adventures that, although experienced through the eyes of the same protagonist (Adol Christin), can be played in any order. There is a timeline to follow, if you want to, but there is only one connection to the games/adventures before this one, and that is Adol's friend Dogi. This game is the remake of the third in the series ([i]"Ys III: Wanderers from Ys"[/i]), but it is the fifth in the canon timeline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198858190851', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1579736988}
review:
[h1]One of the greatest adventures so far[/h1]
Ys: The Oath in Felghana is simply amazing and incredibly fun to play. The Ys series has always been about fast paced action, challenge and great music, and this one excels in every one of these aspects improving a lot from the previous game Ys IV: The Ark of Napishtim. I think Felghana is one of my favorite Ys games so far. 

The gameplay is like a hack n' slash mixed with exploration to get new items and equipment. Soundtrack is excellent in this game and the supporting cast is also very good. The story was interesting although very short.
It took me around 11 hours to finish on Normal. Gameplay is quite challenging, the bosses are hard and requires you to learn their attack patterns, pretty much like a Dark Souls of action games specially on harder difficulties.
The controls are great, feels very fast and responsive and the difficulty is awesome even on normal.
Graphics look very nice and I had no issues or frame drops here, runs perfectly and stable.

It's incredible how a 15 year old game is still a lot of fun even in 2020. It's even more fun than a lot of current action hack n' slash games these days.
This game is well worth it's price and it has a lot of replay value since you can always try to improve your skills playing on Nightmare. Totally recommended!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961766118', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1579653483}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111355675', 'num_games_owned': 884, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3677, 'last_played': 1643522778}
review:
A fantastic entry in the Ys series, simply brilliant. If I had to recommend a Ys game from this generation, it would have to be this one. Ys Oath (3) takes what was created in [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/312540/Ys_VI_The_Ark_of_Napishtim/]Ys Ark (6)[/url] and refines it into high quality material. Nearly everything in this game is an improvement over the previous, which was already reasonably decent. The following is a list of great positives present in Ys Oath, with some comparisons to the previous game, Ys Ark:
[list]

[*]Combat has been redefined and improved. For starters, magic does not directly affect sword mechanics directly anymore. Instead, magic is a secondary accessory to the main, consistent swordplay, which is a far better combination. This allows more creativity, as now the player can decide which magic to input at what time during a combo. In addition, Adol can swing his sword much more often in a single combo, making movement during combat very fluid and natural.

[*]Movement has much more freedom. Dash jump/lunge attacks from Ys 6 were finally removed, making exploring much less of a pain. New features in Ys 3 include the ability to double-jump, the ability to dash (run faster in general), and using magic as a means of transportation to explore otherwise impossible to reach areas. For example, wind magic can be used to float over a gaping chasm, or earth magic can be used to direct Adol in a specific direction if on a slippery surface.

[*]Story and characters simply have more depth. Simply because Ys Oath is one of Adol's adventures before Napishtim, Falcom can afford to give characters much more background stories, especially Chester and Elena. It seriously does not hold back on showing the drastic changes some characters have undergone in the eight years that have passed [spoiler]since Dogi left[/spoiler]. There are even serious references to Ys 6 in this game!

[*]Music has been given more life. In general, the music in Ys 3 is more upbeat and catchy, perfect for a fast-paced action game all about difficult boss battles. This is a Falcom game though, so a decent, if not fantastic soundtrack is guaranteed anyway.

[*]Boss design has generally been improved. No longer can [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814880836]a frog lick you once to death[/url], but more strategy is now required overall. I believe boss battles in this game overall are a lot more enjoyable and fair, especially the final boss. They may seem much more difficult at first, but there is much more freedom of strategy to beat each boss battle compared to all the previous Ys games.
[/list]

Ys Oath is not perfect however. There were some infuriating parts which made the game slightly tilting for me personally:
[list]

[*]Two achievements require six playthroughs of the game, where at least two need to be fully completed in order to finish some other achievements. Now I do not mind needing two playthroughs, but one on each difficulty is a tad excessive. No other Falcom game I've played has done this type of achievement.

[*]Slip, shockwave mechanics, and boss battles heavily dependent on RNG [spoiler](Looking at you, Gyalva and Istersiva)[/spoiler]. The very same from Ys 6, slip and shockwave mechanics are back, and they provide a significant challenge for some bosses. While I do appreciate the increased difficulty from it, I was definitely peeved whenever I did lose to it. As for RNG, while it was manageable, it became less of a patience check and more of a way to unreasonably extend the battle.
[/list]

In summary, Ys 3 is an excellent action RPG, whose small blemishes do not detract noticeably from the finished product. Between its smooth gameplay, its deep and engaging story, and its decent worldbuilding, there's a lot to love in this game. Just be prepared to spend a bit too much time on this game if you plan to 100%; otherwise, the experience is well worth the cost.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034076265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1703806097}
review: Its good

author: {'steamid': '76561198070971744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1582576866}
review:
Most favourite to not so favourite:

Ys: The Oath in Felghana *
Ys I 
Ys VIII: The Lacrimosa of Dana
Ys Seven
Ys II 
Ys: Memories of Celceta
Ys VI: The Ark of Naphitism
Ys Origin
Ys IX: Monstrum Nox

Overall this game has the best of everything in the Ys series. The engine and gameplay from The Ark of Naphitism was improved by a long shot, the soundtrack is incredible, and the bosses were some of the best but most challenging in the series.

But on top of that too this game felt like it had a real sense of accomplishment every time you took down one of them. I felt like when I had a long grind session into a boss fight I couldn't beat, and had the patience to finally take it down I was absolutely thrilled. Especially the final boss, whoever came up with that fight is a legend. This game takes the cake for me in the series as my favourite for just how strong and quality it is from start to finish, and I look forward to tackling this game on the higher difficulties.

Edit: Beat the game on Inferno, while a lot of grinding was involved, defeating that final boss was a triumphant feeling. I highly recommend everyone to play through on Nightmare/Inferno to experience just how tough these games can be.

But it's not a bad game. Plus anything by Nihon Falcom deserves my love. <3

review:
[h1]Ys Oath Of Felghana[/h1]
8/10
Playtime: 9 Hours

Synopsis:
Adol Christin and his friend Dogi are traveling to Dogi's hometown of Felghana three years after the events of the first two games. Upon arriving, they discover that evil happenings are threatening the townspeople, and it is up to Adol to put a stop to it.

Plus:

+Shot and Compact RPG
+Charming cast of character
+Quite Unexpected plot twist of Expected story beats

Min:

-Some enemy boss pattern is RNG and Cueless
-GRINDING PADDING

Mixed:
=Dungeon Layout

i can see why Ys origin is the refinement of the mechanic after this...

review: An enjoyable game that Dark Souls fans may be surprised to find right up there alley. Arguably harder than Dark Souls games and faster paced with solid lore connecting between the other Ys titles in the franchise. One of the stronger entries in the Ys series though not quite among the best. Adol Christin is definitely a neat MC even though he never talks going from game to game hearing his feats and legends and you get to see some reoccurring characters, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101122404', 'num_games_owned': 1769, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1573264242}
review:
伊苏游戏都很良心的吧，这作剧情方感觉有点弱，感觉可能是因为老游戏的事吧，感觉大部分剧情一开始就能猜到了。。。
但后续NM非要强行煽情一下，感觉很尴尬，尴尬完然后就完了。。。完了。。。。我去～最后剧情真没猜到...
eas通关后，突然发现我居然错过了福利，隐藏成就因此没拿到....唉！难受了，那块的存档我还没有....
总体是很良心的，
bgm好听
boss 简单难度不难
但我跳格子跳的都要死了,某处的跳桩还是抱着电脑去朋友家，让他帮我过的...hhhh~其他的地方手残还是可以过的

author: {'steamid': '76561198996384594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1573500855}
review:
Revenge of a Red Headed Stepchild

You Will:
Fight a Dragon
Climb a Mountain
Find a Magic Sword (and then lose it between sequels)
Wonder why the blacksmith still charges you when you're the only thing standing between his shop and the end of the world.

You Won't:
Fall in love (The mountain is in a pretty heavy monogamous with a one eyed bearded hermit. You never stood a chance)
Get to color coordinate your uniform unless you are wearing every piece of the set for some reason.
Figure out who keeps putting these ruins and chests full of useful equipment everywhere.
See Dogi with a soul patch (See Larcimosa of Dana)

If you've never played a YS game before and you're a fan of top down Zelda it's probably up your alley. It's pretty bread and butter fantasy ARPG but it's comfort food at its finest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048565955', 'num_games_owned': 1320, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1573570650}
review: Hard time recommending this one. I've finished the first Ys, and a few of the newer, party based ones, and enjoyed them, but Felghana is so hatefully difficult at points, even on normal, that it seems borderline masochistic. There's no checkpointing, so one wrong move and you could lose 30 minutes to an hour of progress. The game requires you to spend around half your play time grinding or you'll die to bosses in a couple of hits (every boss seems to have attacks that are more or less unavoidable). Your character's hitbox sometimes seems far larger than they are. The story is fairly generic, and the graphics are pretty dated at this point. The music is fantastic though, as is standard for the series. Only really for people who are into very, very challenging games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376916468', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2214, 'last_played': 1588979878}
review:
I really hate this game...
Wrote this after finishing my very first playthrough of the game on nightmare difficulty. And boy does It make other action games like Bloodborne and souls series feels so easy in comparison. I think this game gave me PTSD and i probably am not touching any difficult games for awhile.
I do enjoy my whole playthrough of the game though and will recommend it.
Pros:
Gameplay is fun?? The game is Extremely Challenging if you play it on nightmare difficulty and above, requiring you to react under seconds to the point that some bosses can feel very unfair at times. (I saw the psp version on youtube, that game is much easier than this one).
Bad:
Story in this one is just sufficient, don't go expecting something too deep or epic.
Steam version has no character voice which is kind of meh.

review:
The YS series has always been an aquired taste of sorts. It looks abysmal, but the gameplay as well as the mechanics make this a brilliant blend of JRPG, Dungeon Crawler as well as Zelda-esque games. Story isn't always the strong suit and with Oath in Felghana, in my personal opinion, it truly isn't, but the gameplay is superb.

Can't recommend to everyone, but definitely to fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045600', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1670058939}
review:
I'm rewriting this because the audio issues I used to have appear to be fixed now, and after playing Ys Origin I decided to revisit this game.  

I played Ys III for the TurboGrafx CD a long time ago, and compared to Ys I and II it was a much weaker entry because the voice acting was bad and the side scrolling combat wasn't that interesting.  I mostly played Ys III for its excellent soundtrack.  

Ys: The Oath in Felghana improves upon the original in every way except perhaps the soundtrack, which is about the same in terms of quality. 

Instead of side scrolling, Felghana uses a 3D isometric view that makes combat much more enjoyable.  The platforming gets a bit awkward with this perspective but it's serviceable most of the time.  

The spells are also a lot more fun to use, and every type is useful though I used wind magic the most.

While I never thought much of the story, Felghana does a better job at fleshing out the characters.  The vastly improved voice acting helps a lot.  

In terms of challenge, Felghana offers six different difficulty levels that should please everyone.  The harder difficulties live up to their descriptions when I played them during the timed boss mode that opened up after I beat the game.  

Oath in Felghana is a worthy remake that preserves what was good about the original while greatly improving upon it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220223668', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1554579619}
review:
This isn't a bad game, but I don't think it's a good game, either. It's somewhere in between, but I have to skew to not recommending it. There are tons of positive reviews here so a lot of folks love it, but it left me a little cold. The game controls are very smooth and the music is awesome (a staple feature of the Ys series), but the action gameplay quickly grows repetitive and boring. All of that button mashing gets old, fast. 

The dungeons are also poorly designed and either too simple at some points or too confusing at others. It doesn't have the intuitive feel and sense of discovery that you find in really great action RPGs. The story is okay by anime adventure standards but it drags a lot. There are some cool boss battles but they are extremely difficult in an annoying way, peppered by RNG nonsense, and it doesn't feel like the combat and movement mechanics are robust enough to deal with the challenges that these bosses throw at you. The bosses also take forever to kill...the battles just go on and on.

So, it's a mixed bag. There are some solid aspects to it, but there are too many lackluster qualities here. If you're interested in Ys, I'd just track down the first games in the series, which are really great even if they're a bit outdated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014387487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1345273200}
review: Ys: The Oath in Felghana is possibly the best entry in the Ys series, as well as an excellent action RPG in it's own right. The simple yet fast paced combat system is brought together with brilliant level and enemy design to create a game that is easy to learn but punishingly difficult all the same. Combined with an excellent sound track and classic Japanese illustrations, this game is a joy to play and replay from start to finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025029885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1590716281}
review:
TL;DR -- This game is worth the full $15 price just for the soundtrack alone. It's currently on sale for less than the price of one Starbuck, and unlike a single Starbuck this is actually enjoyable AND won't make your pee smell like wasted money and sadness! (A no-brainer decision here, really.) 10/10, highly recommend.

- LONG(ER) VERSION -
The last time I enjoyed playing a game until my hands physically locked up in cramps I was getting my ass kicked by an angry fetus in a jar with a penchant for mechasuits and murder. While (as far as I've played) there are no mechasuit murder fetuses trying to kill you, there is still a great soundtrack, a lot of funky jumping with swords, and everything else in the world is trying to kill you, down to the tortellini-shaped murder slugs and the flowers that have clearly Had It (TM) with humanity's bullsh*t.

This game has relatively minimal controls and no camera control options, but that's not a bad thing and feels like a retro 90's video game, which this game technically is anyway. The player controls are pretty straight forward if you're used to games played only on your keyboard, and if you dislike the feel of it, there are two preset layout options to chose from and customise as you see fit. (The options launcher shows an option for a controller, so I imagine you could also just use your console controller if you prefer.) Haven't figured out sprinting or long jumps yet (my repeated failure at which led to said hand cramping), but it might just be that I need to pick a different set of keybindings; a controller feels like it would work best (button mashing doesn't kill hands), but I don't have one so I can only assume.

Story-wise, I won't post any spoilers. I'm not too deep into the plot yet but it does feel like a classic JRPG, only with significantly better translations than back in the day had -- no All Your Base grammar, no 4kids-era "Jelly Donut" localisation, just good ol' slightly-dated-meets-nostalgic 90's dialog and NPCs implying you're a dumbass to your face. I have a suspicion where the plot is heading and going to twist at, but I've played enough JRPGS to know the genre's usual structure, and the plot clues, should you chose to actually speak to NPCs multiple times, give you just enough info to be curious and move the plot along. It's not open world, but it has more than enough going for it to make that irrelevant. The characters all seem to have backstory, even the guy drinking in the inn/tavern, which is a nice change of pace compared to modern games' NPCs. There's visual storytelling as well as textual story too, such as what appear to be bloody crutches along where a monster attack plot point happens early on, among a few other things.

As for the soundtrack, just pull it up on Youtube. Saying "it's great" is a catastrophic understatement, like saying fire is a little warm. There was a guy on nico nico douga a decade ago called The Screamer who played violin covers of video game music, and while that may sound cheesier than the cellar of a Wisconsin dairy farm, that sh*t slaps. (It's also how I learned of the Ys series.) The town music sounds appropriately explorative, and the dungeon music sounds appropriately motivational sick beats for kicking (and stabbing) some literal asses. The fireball sound effects pair well with the dungeon theme where I left off playing, too.

Overall, if you've ever played on an actual NES, Gameboy, PS1 or N64, it feels and works like that did, but higher quality and screen resolution. At full price it costs about the same as an average takeout lunch, and on sale it cost about the same as one cup of name-brand coffee. It's up to you yo decide if that's personally worth it, but for me? I'll be here being blissfully rocking out to some fireballs and smoldering spiders.

10/10 & having a blast. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198010752029', 'num_games_owned': 1658, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 3815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1945, 'last_played': 1680724969}
review:
YS more like Y is it so Shiddy compared to the first two and the rest of the 3D games.
If steam had a "meh" rating i would use it here. I still give it a thumbs up because YS is a pretty good series.
Pretty much the WORST 3D YS game, regular gameplay is fine and there is a lot more combat involved, (and 2x-3x more grinding in comparison to other games thanks to the new difficulty.) the BOSSES are some of the worst in the series aside from the final boss. I know ARK is generally frowned upon regarding the bosses, they are clunky, glitchy, some of them are super easy and some are absolutely terribly designed. Here bosses are designed SPECIFICALLY to annoy you, and waste your time rather than pose a fun challenge The difficulty is scaled that so the first bunch of bosses are going to be nothing but petty annoyance which reminded me of the stupid BAT fight from YS1. Then the game lets you easily skip up to 2-3 bosses by climbing a mountain instead of going into abandoned mine and frankly, those bosses deserve to be skipped. This game also introduced human enemies like chester, who get to decide whether you live or die depending on their mood instead of a logical pattern, which are fun bosses in retrospect, but even then YS ORIGIN did it 10 times better. The story is fine, it certainly isn't as good as the ARK and it pads out till the very end, but some small town interactions here and there manage to at least distract you from the fact that this is the worst game in term of bosses and progression by far. Barely mediocre and saved by the story+final boss. If you saw combat in ARK and thought "I'd like it if the game resolved around that purely but with more polish" then that's exactly what it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413928624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1553017250}
review: Seria Ys kojarzy mi się... nie tyle z dzieciństwem i PS2 ale także z ciekawym podejściem do rozgrywki, jako dzieciak nigdy nie radziłem sobie w Hack'n'Slashash pokroju Diablo, aczkolwiek czerpałem z tego gatunku frajdę garściami, podchodząc do tej części, pamiętałem klasyki ze SNESa i wiedziałem że łatwo nie będzie, jest to ciężki jRPG, jak każda jego część, obeszło się bez przeszukiwania każdego pomieszczenia w poszukiwaniu kluczy do otworzenia kolejnych etapów jak w przypadku odrestaurowany dwóch pierwszych części, to co mi brakuje w Ark of Napishtim a jest tutaj zaimplementowane to możliwość bezpośredniego korzystania z lootujących herbów w trakcie walki, myślę że zdecydowanie bardziej się to przydaje w trakcie Grindu czy przechodzenia poszczególnych etapów niż Potiony zażywane w czasie potyczki i tak nigdy nie korzystam z healerów w trakcie walk z bossami, a w trakcie grindu nie mam za bardzo uwagi (szczególnie na wysokich poziomach trudności), ciągle grzebać w inwentarzu, aczkolwiek jest to moja subiektywna opinia i nie wbija aż tak bardzo w oko dla gracza który nigdy wcześniej nie miał do czynienia z tą serią, dla początkujących z Ys, ''Oath in Felghana'' to najbardziej komfortowe rozwiązanie, świetne połączenie platforemera (momentami skoski do 2.5D by oddać klimat ''Wanderers From Ys'' co ta gra robi świetnie) z jRPGiem. Ogólnie rzecz biorąc można tą grę śmiało określić jako połączenie Mario 3D World z 3DSa z Hack'n'Slashem i uproszczonym nie wymagającym systemem RPG, który w głównej mierze polega na Grindzie i paru mini questach... Aczkolwiek seria Ys łączy specyficzne mechaniki w kompatybilną całość dając całkiem smaczny torcik wielosmakowy, gra jednak (podobnie jak "Ark of Napishtim''), pozostawiła we mnie sentyment tak mocny, że bawiłem się doskonale w każdą osłonę serii, nie jest to gra idealna, jednak według mojej subiektywnej oceny 8/10, bardzo solidny jRPG, polecam szczególnie hardcore'owcom, wyższe tryby trudności które naprawdę dają solidnego kopa

author: {'steamid': '76561197997453190', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1208, 'last_played': 1667838175}
review:
Este es un juegazo de la saga, divertido como pocos. Nos ofrece una aventura en Felghana, la tierra que vio nacer a nuestro inseparable compañero Dogi.
Desembarcamos y no tardamos ni un minuto en estar solucionando los problemas de los habitantes del lugar. Esto se mantiene durante toda la historia, que no es un alarde de originalidad, pero sin embargo nos ofrece personajes secundarios excelentes y carismáticos antagonistas/villanos. Quizá os pille por sorpresa alguno de sus buenos giros.
El combate y la exploración tienen la misma fórmula de Ys Origin e Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim, así que si los habéis probado, ya sabéis de qué va. Acción sencilla y divertida junto a una exploración de escenarios ágil y satisfactoria. Los bosses, como siempre, de lo mejor del título.

Si quieres seguir leyéndome escribir sobre videojuegos en general... https://www.yukharyan.com/

author: {'steamid': '76561198026007675', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3192, 'last_played': 1634590708}
review:
If you're like me and played the previous Ys games on Nightmare thinking "well gee whiz, besides Dark Fact this difficulty mode is still quite enjoyable and dandy!", I'd like to warn you:

Oath in Felghana's bosses will destroy your shitter, carve you a new one and proceed to also ruin it in ways God would never approve of nor wish to witness. In the end you'll get used to the blood and tears, making for quite a great learning experience to reflect on over the course of your rehab period. Oh and I hope you like boss rushes. And Chester. Everybody loves Chester.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096969070', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1552451397}
review:
首先要说STEAM上伊苏成就太难了。有彩蛋，也有无意义的刷怪，最恶心的是6个难度都做2个支线任务。Normal难度开始，用修改器改了金钱，买了4级套，一路打到城堡才有点吃力，开始刷经验。最后上岛开了+等级秘籍。可是进时钟塔的4层机关花费太多时间，最后没能拿到5小时通关成就。开了秘籍也不显示成绩榜了。
伊苏的精髓在于通关后的BOSS RUSH，可惜一直手残，不靠等级碾压，很难通过。
伊苏F对我，是第一个玩通关的FALCOM游戏，虽然在04年就玩了空轨FC，可惜家里电脑每次读地图就卡死。06年买了这个碟，可惜是日语的，没玩。07年在同学用软盘给我拷攻略的帮助下，才打了一半，那年春节是第一次熬夜，在雪山磨啊，因为家里没有网，没有迷宫地图，迅速过关必须凭借攻略。直到中考结束，才通关了这个游戏。后来伊苏O，7代，双星物语2，空轨3部曲，都是一层一层的回忆。可是只有按图索骥，一点一点攻略的伊苏F，空轨FC，双星物语2，在没有成就的年代，手刷全收藏，才是我的日系RPG的根基。
过去这么多年，那些场景还存在于脑海，（尤其是最终BOSS会弹出的BUG，刷了很多次，全凭运气通关。）还有soundteam JDK的音乐也是功不可没。动作游戏凭借华丽的画面，紧张的操作，给人留下的记忆最深，包括后来玩的鬼泣4，暗黑血统2 ，其他游戏就很难记住。虽然我操作不好，但是凭借自身努力而不是作弊器改数据通关，是最爽快的。你也一定有如此感慨：终于过了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198053635139', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4986, 'last_played': 1606490395}
review:
[h1]This is a brilliant[spoiler]e[/spoiler] game for brilliant[spoiler]e[/spoiler] people.[/h1]

It's been now 1 year since I played my first Ys game. It was this game right here. Back then I didn't know what to expect. I had played through all the Final Fantasy games just recently, and I craved for something new, something refreshing. And I found this game. Curiously I bought it, played it and the rest is history.

So what is the series about?

At its core it is a game series following a red haired boy's adventures all over the world. However, this doesn't mean you have to play the games in order or anything. Each game is a contained experience, apart from Ys I & II, meaning that you can start playing any game in the series, beat it, and continue playing any of the games next. It's kind of like Final Fantasy in that sense.

This game doesn't take too long to beat, but it trades it off with its difficulty. Lo and behold! This is one of the most difficult games I've ever played! My first playthrough took 24 hours because of that! And that was on Normal! Occasionally, the difficulty may seem unfair, but we'll talk about that later.

Story? It's serviceable. And that is actually why I really like this game; I don't need to read silly dialogue too much. After some gameplay, I am treated to a breather in the form of a story session that's more than welcome. It doesn't take too long to get back in the fray. I like good stories, don't get me wrong, but I really like the way this game handles its story. It doesn't get in the way, and if you want more than the necessary story sections, you can always talk to the townspeople.[spoiler]And maybe discover something useful in the process![/spoiler]

At this point I must praise the soundtrack. It is phenomenal! I have never heard such a great soundtrack in a game in my life and my first time playing this game really had me hooked. Part of the reason is most definitely the soundtrack! Despite that, the game has some pretty bad tracks too. They DO fit the place they play in but really, I'd just want more of that awesome violin combined rock action!

And then the meat of the game: Gameplay

The game excels in this department. Nothing is more satisfying than ramming your attack button at enemies and seeing them explode to bits and pieces. That is also a visual style I really like with these older 3D Ys games. I really love how the game gives you complete freedom in maneuverability. You can jump, you can eventually double jump, you can run REALLY fast, and after progressing in the game you'll get awesome magic powers that will help you get around easily. Oh and you can combine your jump and attack to hit enemies directly below you and stagger them OR execute an aerial combo. Of course there are also side quests. Some of them easy to find, others require you to explore a little more. Which just adds to the game's replay ability! There is no way you will find everything on your first playthrough (assuming you won't use guides or watch videos). 

There are also these "dungeons" that you go to, each with their own theme and style (and enemies!). They really make the game feel longer and larger than it actually is. In a good way! You feel like you've done a lot, even though the level is not that big. The game doesn't have puzzles, but it does have minor platforming. That makes this game even more interesting, because it's not just running around and killing things, you also have a level to scale and get through. Sometimes you'll need to light up torches or break walls in order to progress. Oh and killing enemies on platforms is a situation you'll have to apply tactics on sometimes!

Visuals are really nice. Maybe because I just like this kind of style in games, but the 2D sprite/3D environment really gives the game a unique look. Few games have this, which in my opinion is a shame. Environments haven't aged too badly. They still look great even though this game came out in, what, 2005? Something like that.

Usually I wouldn't need to do this, but this game requires it! Let's talk about bosses.

So, this is what the series is known for. Actually brutal boss fights that test your patience, willpower and skill. Each boss in this game is a challenge to say the least, and sometimes it might take you a very long time to beat one of them. Hell, about 50% of the time I spent on my first playthrough was probably just being stuck on bosses! So, are they good then? Yes and No. Some bosses are really fair and a pleasure to fight. This is helped by the fact that when you die during a boss battle, you can restart immediately from the beginning of the fight. No need for a file reload! And no handicaps either! Other bosses can be a pain in the ass, to put it lightly. Especially one boss comes to mind where the boss does random attacks and that can lead to you being stuck on a very small plot of ground. In that kind of a situation there isn't much you can do. There was one attack the boss could use and if it did use that, it would most certainly be almost impossible to dodge in such a small space. However these situations are very uncommon in the context of the entire game, and thankfully you can dodge nearly all attacks from bosses. That is a necessity on harder difficulties, of course, because you cannot heal during boss battles and you die from 3-4 hits (sometimes 1 or 2!).

Everything in consideration, Ys: The Oath in Felghana delivers a very excitable game, that you'll want to play again sometime, if you're like me. In fact, it is my favorite game in the series. I did like Ys Origin and VI, but nothing will beat the environments and select music pieces this game offers. It is a shame, that they don't do games like this nowadays. I'd love to play a modern version of a game like this.

If there was something to criticize, I'd like it better if I could change options inside the game, rather than from a config that you'll have to access outside of the game. But this is a minor inconvenience, hell, you'll even get treated for opening it!

It is by far a 10/10!

review:
Adol is a red-headed, emotionless, bloody murderer who's typical Tuesday involves slaughtering wildlife and killing elder gods. Kick him into a volcano and he will dust himself off and put his headphones back on; killing every single thing in his way to the soothing tunes of
80's power metal.

One of the best action jrpgs I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066445702', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1590097434}
review:
It's a remake of the early-90s game Ys III: Wanderers From Ys.
Included are several remixes of the tracks from the original game.

It's your standard Japanese RPG complete with "collect this number of totems from the boss/dungeons" and twist reveals. It's good for familiarizing yourself with the wider lore of Ys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965229974', 'num_games_owned': 2205, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1546823759}
review: Another fantastic foray into the Ys world, this time building off the foundation of "Ys The Ark of Napishtim" but improving on the core gameplay with more responsive controls, better music, better characters, less frustrating platforming, and much less overall grinding required. You still can't pause during boss fights and now, inexplicably, you can't even carry healing items any longer - making boss fights even trickier than the previous title - but on the whole this was a much more polished, and thus far more enjoyable, experience :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198078437635', 'num_games_owned': 2130, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1673165405}
review:

나에게 팔콤이라는 회사를 제대로 알려준 작품.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972273179', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1546399538}
review:
I'd never really understood Ys. I tried Ark of Napishtim years ago and dropped it before the first hour, thinking it a mindless hack 'n' slash. I later picked up Memories of Celceta as I'm a big PS VITA fan and...You guessed it, promptly dropped it in favor of other RPGs (hello Persona 4!).

Fast forward to Christmas, a friend gifted me Ys VIII on Switch. I was a little cautious due to my prior experience, but thanked them and gave it a few hours. Something wasn't clicking, I was on the verge of enjoying it, but it still felt very...Repetitive, and confusing despite its simplicity. I was sure I was missing something.

Cue Steam sales, Ys: The Oath in Felghana @ 75% off. It looked like Ark, I was wary...But noting the overwhelmingly positive Steam reviews, I thought I'd give the series one last solid try before passing judgment. And goddamn am I glad I did. Ys: The Oath in Felghana was everything I could of hoped for and more. It's one of the best gaming experiences I had in 2018 (and the first game I beat in 2019!)

It starts off easy, and I was groaning that I'd wasted my money. I didn't like the idea of mashing buttons through 10 hours of mindless hoards of enemies. And then the first boss KICKED MY ASS. On my 5th attempt, I knew I'd love the game. Ys didn't care about me, it didn't care about being accessible, it throat-punched me until I knew who was boss. And I loved every minute of it.

After the first boss, I was swarmed a few times which led to quick deaths. Just when I thought I understood how to play, along comes boss 2 and throws a completely different style of combat at me. It was awesome. I was grinning from ear to ear. When I started seeing bullet-hell inspired patterns, I KNEW this was my game. I play a lot of shmups, so seeing that sort of gameplay in a game I was already loving the crap out of made me ridiculously excited.

I'm aware this is getting long and rambly, so I'll just say the following 10-14 hours were some of the most razer-focussed, well-executed action/RPG gaming moments of my life. This game has ZERO padding, it's balls-to-the-wall action the entire ride. Each stat point matters, and while I sometimes had to grind, it was fast-paced, rewarding, and exciting trying to keep my combo going for that juicy 1.99x multiplier!

After beating Ys: The Oath in Felghana, I feel like I understand the design principles behind the series and I'm really excited to get back to YS VIIII on Switch or Celceta on Vita (but not before buying and playing Ys: Origin while it's still one sale!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198005763217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 5862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5803, 'last_played': 1578651296}
review:
I love and hate this game.

Forget about the story. They shouldn't even have bothered. It's an action RPG. More action than RPG actually and as brutal as they get. At least if you play at one of the higher difficulty levels. The game have 6. Yeah that's crazy.

It's fast pace. Very energetic with an awsome soundtrack and with a simple but very neat gameplay. The game is mostly about bosses though. You go through a lot of mob, sure, but it's the bosses that make this game really special. So much so that when you have finished a first playthrough you can play the boss rush mode and if you love challenges that is where your life ends.

The bosses are terrible. They are great too. Their design is crap. or at least until you figured them out and that isn't an easy task. I think I called pretty much all of them unfair until I found a tiny little chi.nk I could work on. Serioulsy I can't think of a game with bosses less forgiving. You will need inhuman skills to get through the Nightmare Boss Rush. That and a full nerve-wracking afternoon + some cold water for your hands.

Be advised. It's not for everyone. Darksouls is for snowflakes in comparison.

Rating: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198368075321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1543513811}
review:
Ys:tOiF is a fun, simple and eminently likeable action RPG that fills a very particular niche. It's quite similar to the 2D Zelda games, but it's more of an RPG, with a leveling system, equipment (though much less than one would find in most JRPGs) and a greater emphasis on story and characters than one would find in a pure actiontitle, though again much less than in other JRPGs. 
It sits right between action and numbers-based RPGing, a kind of missing link between say, the Tales series and something like Zelda or Metroid, which means it has a little bit of something for everyone. Combat against normal enemies is fun, satisfying and not very difficult, with a kind of more-ish quality like popping bubble wrap. Boss fights on the other hand are extremely tough and require pattern memorisation rather than pure level grinding.
The story and characters are very cookie-cutter and unoriginal, but they're well-presented and charming and they never intrude for too long, so even folks who can't stand anime melodrama shouldn't be too bothered.
This is like a cheap and cheerful young adult fantasy paperback, it's a well-crafted, well-rounded but not very ambitious good time. I can't see it being anyone's all-time favourite, but it's still worth a try for basically anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995464727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1543260418}
review:
Το Remake του YS 3: Wanderer from ys.
Αυτο το παιχνιδι οταν βγηκε το 1989 ακολούθισε την λογική του Zelda 2 και το καναν 2D sidescroller, κάτι που ξύνισε πολούς fans της σειρας. Τώρα, το τορινό και πιο πρόσφατο remake του παιχνιδιου παίζει με την Engine και το Gameplay του YS 6: Ark of Napishtim, διατιρόντας όμως σε μεγάλο βαθμό το layout του αρχικού Sidescroller.

Όπως και τα υπόλυπα YS, το παιχνίδι μπορεί να είναι πολύ δίσκολο, ιδικά στα bosses αν δεν κάνεις λιγο Grind, μα επίσεις όπως και στα υπόλυπα YS το Grind ειναι πολύ γρήγορο, πολύ ευχάριστο, και πολύ αποτελεσματικό. Το Gameplay είναι πολύ γρήγορο, η μουσική αριστουργιματική, και όλα τα NPCs έχουν όνομα, πρόγραμμα, άποψη και μέρικές φορές Sidequests ανάλογα με το στάδιο της Ιστορίας που βρήσκεσαι.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993131153', 'num_games_owned': 1131, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1643591203}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048304014', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1629953555}
review: Ys: The Oath in Felghana (Hearby Oath) is a remake/reimagining of Wanderers from Ys (Hearby Ys III). You yet again play as Adol on a venture to Dogi's hometown, Redmont. From there, things take a turn to the forboding, and uultiimately, to a new adventure. I wont say too much here. If you played Ys III, Oath is the same game with some minor changes. For those who played Oath first and completed it, go play Ys III and see how different it is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160600718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1161, 'last_played': 1541908659}
review: As a long time Ys veteran I would say that Ys The Oath in Felghana (A retelling and evolving of Ys III Wanderers from Ys) is among the best in this amazing and underappreciated series. The gameplay is tight and spot-on, the visuals and art-directioin are both pleasing, and the music is among the best you'll experience in any video-game. Falcom is known for awesome and uncompromsing OST's of course so that is to be expected. Of the three Ys games that are created with this specific engine (Ys Ark of Napishtim, Ys Oath, and Ys Origin) I feel that this installment is the best of them although you should definiely play them all if you find this adventure to your liking. The minimalist approach with a focus on fun-factor and a game that moves along at a more rapid pace is alive and well here. One thing that I love about the Ys franchise is that the games have an epic scope and are interconnected but never overstay their welcome; you won't find an excess of bloated content in this game or other Ys installments for that matter. The characters are also very endearing and Adol is a badass hero /adventurer if there ever was one. I've also played through the game on PSP and the Steam version is the definitive edition to own with the upgraded visuals and the ability to play on a high quality monitor of your choosing. I played on normal and the game is a bit more challenging than other Ys games on the same difficulty setting; this is especially true with the boss battles as you can't bail yourself out with healing items like in the party orientated Ys games, which will demand that you learn patterns and use good timing instead. For some of the most difficult sections there are some key areas where you can grind for an additional level or two fairly efficiently if need be so there is some flexibility available there. You will feel a sense of sastifaction after succeeding past some of the challenges that are presented. Have fun.

review:
My fifth YS series game ( I & II --> Origin --> Celceta --> this )
I still half on the way, so I might edit the review later

(+)
- Easy control
- Good soundtrack
- Challenging, especially boss battle I'm starting at hard mode and naively thinking: "I can take on Hard mode boss rush on Origin relatively easy, so maybe the boss won't be that hard". The very first boss and every next boss destroy me more than 10 times before I can beat them. I'm kind of miss this because Celceta boss is completely a piece of cake. Even the normal stage area is hard, maybe the hardest so far for YS series that I already played

(-)
- Back to Origin save style, meaning you can only save the game at certain place. Save as often as you can.

As expected, I prefer the Origin gameplay to the Celceta. Might update the review later after I complete the first playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561198259279940', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1679797104}
review:
Brief Overview after playing 90% of the game:

Ys has always been a series where you rock out and kick some monster ass. The Oath in Felghana is no exception. One thing that really makes Ys stand out against other games is that Falcom’s primary focus is their “fun factor.” These games are challenging, yet crazy fun to play. The Oath in Felghana has decent graphics, an amazing soundtrack, near perfect gameplay and has real replay value. This game is one of the reasons why when Falcom releases a new Ys game, I pretty much scream at them to take my money. I only wish that there were more references to Ys 1 & 2, as there is a very Catholic style church in Felghana which makes Feena and Rhea seem like they don’t matter outside of the country of Ys itself and they’re living goddesses.

In Depth Review:

Graphics:

The Oath in Felghana has graphics like Ys Origin. You have a top down perspective and the characters look okay. There’s not a ton of detail to them, but there’s enough to know that each one was designed completely different. The stage design is detailed but doesn’t go overboard with it. When you’re in the mines, there are things you would expect to be in a mine. There are rail cars, wooden bridges, wooden scaffolding to support the dug-out ceiling, etc. This sort of stage design is carried out very well throughout all the stages.
The character art for dialogue is where you see the most detail in the characters. Even though the art is anime-styled you can see that there was a lot of thought put into each character’s appearance. I personally love the character art and think that this style is sometimes better than using 3D models. 

I only found a few monsters that were palette swapped. For the most part, they were unique and had a lot of variety. The bosses are where the game really flourishes with enemy design. The first boss you come across is a stone statue turned vampire-chick. I think Falcom did a much better job in capturing beauty while also making the boss appear dangerous. Now, the fire-breathing dragon on the other hand could have used a little more work. Falcom is not Square-Enix, they have a very small group of people that make these games, so I really don’t have any complaints.

Audio:

The music in Ys has been one of its strongest points since the original game came out. The Oath in Felghana has an excellent soundtrack. Throughout my playthrough, there has not been a single moment where I thought that the music was lacking. The only thing I wish had been done is some voice acting. It was the only real drawback I’ve found in the game, which is the same for Ys Origin. The lack of voice acting is a bit of a letdown, but it’s far from a deal breaker for me when it comes to buying future Ys titles.

Gameplay:

The Oath in Felghana is the first game in the Ys series to mimic the Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim style of gameplay where there is fast paced action that happens at the same time as moderately complicated 3D platforming. The entire Ys series is so much fun to play that the difficult boss battles aren’t even an inconvenience for me. I will very happily take on the challenge and figure everything out on my own without any assistance from a guide. Even the grinding parts of the game that I did, for fully upgrading all my equipment didn’t feel like a grind. It could be because the game has enough exploration to keep things interesting and the battles can change even when farming if the enemies come at you in different ways than you expect.

I’m not covering the story because I don’t want to risk any spoilers, but it is a much-improved version of the SNES game’s story. Other than Dogi and Adol and how they met, you don’t need to play the other games to be able to understand this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006580639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1691106515}
review:
This game is a mixed bag. Due to a lack of quest information I often ran around endlessly trying to figure out what to do and where to go. At one point a boss battle failed to trigger because I didn't talk to the mayor before hand. 

Sadly YS went with their usual plan of difficult jump puzzles and having to go through a long trek if you mess up. Though there's a non fall mode it keeps disabling itself as soon as you fall, so you have to keep reneabling it. The jumping puzzles are also annoying as you have to use the wind ability but it often won't trigger when you use it. Though this is less problematic when you get the dash jump and double jump as you can avoid using it.

The story and character are okay but nothing special. Though you'll understand pretty much what's happening all the time.

I recommend buying YS Origin instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196814442', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2042, 'last_played': 1584142302}
review:
Це моя перша пройдена гра про червоноволосого мечника Адола Крістіна. В загальному серія нараховує вісім частин і багато перевидань, до яких відноситься і Ys: The Oath in Felghana (в оригіналі Ys III: Wanderers from Ys). Але нічого спільного з першими двома іграми крім головного героя Адола та його друга Догі гра не має, так що цілком можете розпочати з цієї частини.
Гра розпочинається з того що наш головний герой, разом із Догі припливають на кораблі в рідний край другого. Після невеликого ностальгічного діалогу з нашим товаришем ми відправляємось в його рідне місто, але без пригод дійти до міста нам не судилося, і ми зустрічаємо дівчину яку оточили вовки. І тут починається битва під досить жваві метал запили, це була любов з першого звуку, Falcom зі своєю студією композиторів створили дуже динамічну музику яка гарно підкреслює динамічний геймплей, що до графічної обгортки то тут все досить консервативно, але особисто для мене очей не ріже. Ще що хотілось би відмітити так це битви з босами, вони тут просто шикарні, кожен зі своїм підходом і немає таких які подібні одне на одного, ще тут досить великий бестіарій та гарна робота художників які створили портрети персонажів.
З мінусів хотілося відмітити поганий платформінг, деколи персонаж не може просто нормально заскочити на виступ так ніби там невидима стіна. Ну й історія така собі, хоча під кінець є нормальний твіст. І гру я звичайно рекомендую всім хто хоче випробовувань, і для людей які цінують перш за все геймплей, а не сюжет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063010711', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2289, 'last_played': 1524760900}
