author: {'steamid': '76561198069319022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1674180088}
review:
I fell in love with this game since its days on the PSP, and boy it is good.
One of the most interesting aspects of this Ys Trilogy (Oath, Ys VI, and Origin) is its pacing. This game never gives a break! You'll discover new abilities, new weapons and find new places to explore all the time. Time flies when you're hacking everything in seconds and doing it again just for a level up or getting enough gold and materials for the next weapon upgrade. Fun as hell :D

One thing that was kinda of a negative for me though. You'll need to grind a bit, sometimes a lot, because 1 level may be the difference between you getting destroyed in seconds or the other way round. This may put the skill of the player aside sometimes (so the level will be the winning factor), and even maxing your current equipment won't make a difference. It is a gripe of mine, and of course, it doesn't break the game in any way.

Starting Ys VI right now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094626530', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1668804648}
review:
An astoundingly fun Action-RPG that captures everything that makes the Ys series fun, as well as being a great game for any fans looking to get into the series. A very close tie to Ys: Origin for one of my favorite RPG's of all time.
================================================================================================
+Phenomenal Music
+Graphics that, though retro-esque, look pretty good in HD/Widescreen
+Very-responsive and fluid controls, combat is fast-paced and energetic
+Great level design, with varied design and good atmosphere
+The Boss-fights in particular are really what make this game spectacular, probably the best in the series.
+Difficulties are balanced pretty nicely, Nightmare in particular is a [spoiler]blood-boiling[/spoiler] challenging experience even for veterans

-Story is just okay
-Lacks the massive replay value of Ys: Origin, with only other difficulties and Boss Rush really being your options
-Also lacks the voice acting of the PSP Version (albeit not [i]great[/i] voice acting,) as well as the ability to change the OST

author: {'steamid': '76561198057875952', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1582143239}
review:
Ys: The Oath in Felghana is the go-to Ys game for players new to the series. The story is largely standalone (outside of a few minor references), the combat uses arguably the least controversial of the three main combat styles in the series and has been greatly improved compared to Ys VI, the music is great, and the game is of a reasonable length. If I had any complaints it would be that the story is clearly based on a game from the late 80's, but that's about it.

Be warned, it's one of the more challenging games in the series, but there are plenty of difficulty levels to choose from, and you'll know if you've made the right decision pretty early on in the game. It doesn't start off easy, to say the least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053942751', 'num_games_owned': 4622, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1096, 'last_played': 1527979939}
review:
Game: Ys: The Oath in Felghana
Genre: Action RPG
Developer: Falcom
Publisher: XSeeD
System: Steam (PC)
Year of Release: 2012
Length of Playthrough: 18 Hours

Total Score: 90/100
Value Score: 9/10

• Story: 9/10
• Characters: 9/10
• GamePlay: 10/10
• Graphics: 9/10
• Sound: 8/10
• Music: 10/10
• Length: 7/10
• Replay Value: 8/10
• Player Value: 10/10

[u]Pros[/u]
+Great story and cast of characters
+Amazing OST
+Achievements
+Time challenge Boss event mode
+Ability to play Easy, Normal, Hard, Nightmare and Inferno mode for challenge
+Great gameplay elements and design involving strategy, platforming and basic RPG aspects
+Boss battles are well crafted and require strategy rather than hack and slash

[u]Cons[/u]
-Some mini games/side quests for achievements include escort missions which can be annoying/tedious
-Some achievements are very challenging like not getting hit from final boss

author: {'steamid': '76561198104241639', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1627870240}
review:
Jogo [b]FINALIZADO & PLATINADO[/b] !

[b]Prós :[/b]
- Gráficos Ok
- Trilha Sonora 10/10
- História 7/10 , bem clichê não espere algo grandioso ou com plot twist louco :P
- Jogabilidade

[b]Contras :[/b]
- A dificuldade [b]B R U T A L[/b] , do jogo que chega ser desleal , pra conseguir [b]PLATINAR[/b] isso tive que me internar no [b]BOSS RUSH[/b] e selecionar [b]BOSS[/b] específico pra conseguir passar , no [b]NORMAL[/b] já é um porre , no [b]INFERNO[/b] que é necessário zerar pra [b]PLATINAR[/b] meu amigo , você chora , os [b]BOSS[/b] além de ganhar mais [b]HP[/b] , eles mudam um pouco a luta e complica mais ainda , praticamente você tem que virar o Neo do Matrix ! Se você têm uma reação melhor você se dá bem no game tranquilo , essa dificuldade [b]VARIA DE PESSOA PRA PESSOA[/b] , então é um ponto [b]CONTRA E NEUTRO[/b] ao mesmo tempo :P

[b]Nota : 8[/b] , [b]Ys I e Ys: The Oath in Felghana[/b] dão as mãos pra te levar ao Inferno , comprei [b]preço full por confiar na qualidade da série no geral[/b] , então vai de cada aqui nesse caso , e se tá chegando na franquia agora , começe pelo o [b]Ys Origin[/b] que é mais safe e, é frustante também , mas não igual aos jogos citados antes !

author: {'steamid': '76561198105102647', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1529215926}
review:
有人说伊苏03~06这3作是Act而非Arpg，这句话在YSF这儿算是落实了。关卡设计以及对操作的要求可谓系列最强。同时减少场景（相比6）、更强的小怪、更少的道具——虽然同样不乏精美，然而确实少了很多收集的乐趣。
不过虽然简短，但是剧情氛围仍然非常容易让人沉浸，并且个人感觉本作手感堪称系列第一、BGM更是当仁不让的第一、Boss战也是系列第一。是作为伊苏粉决不能错过的一作。

author: {'steamid': '76561198088752220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3268, 'last_played': 1525409473}
review:
This game does not have 55 hours worth of content.

I would say 20 or 30, provided you play it like a normal human being. Interesting story; I'm getting into the Ys series. I played Ys 1 and 2, enjoyed them well enough, I left a review, you can read it. It's funny and erudite, and was written by a cutie-pie. But I found the hardcore difficulties for each game somewhat lacking for the most part. There are some plainly unfair boss fights in Ys 1, but in Ys 2 the bosses are mostly incredibly easy apart from the last boss.

So when I started The Oath in Felghana, which I had intended to play synchronously with the original Console/PC game Ys: Wanderers from Ys of which it is a remake, and still sort of am, I thought 'maybe I'll try Nightmare difficulty'. I didn't really find it all that difficult up until Gyalva, and I honestly can't tell you why I didn't just restart there and play on hardcore. Some heady cocktail of stupidity and stubborness. So here we are, 55 hours and a month or two later, following a long break during which I played and finished Brandish: The Dark Revenant (including the Dela content), another Falcom game which I deeply love and find profoundly relaxing, I only about an hour ago finished off Galbalan on Nightmare.

Wew lad.

My own stubborness and stupidity aside, it's a very good game. I enjoy the Souls games (only technically played Bloodborne, but I've played it a lot so I think I can say that) but I don't generally enjoy when games take things from them, which this does. Particularly it takes the no-pause rule, at least during boss fights. I've always found this feature silly. Apart from that it isn't that similar, and I think when people mention them as being similar to this it's just because they both have very difficult, set-piece boss fights separated by much less difficult but still challenging runs of monsters. And because the kids don't remember challenging games. 

I won't complain that Oath in Felghana doesn't have the bump system, because let's all be honest and admit that Falcom themselves got tired of the bump system about three-quarters of the way through programming Ys (that's being generous) and that's why they implemented magic the way they did in both Ys 1 and 2. And whatever may be wrong with the combat, at least it isn't Wanderers From Ys.

I know that 'dropped my input' has been made famous by that guy who gets paid to jack off on stream, but it does appear that Oath in Felghana does sometimes, for somewhat anomalous reasons, drop jump inputs. This definitely contributed to a few of my deaths. And I'm not imagining it, because I've read about it happening to others. 

It has a fun little animu plot and a bunch of characters with what Harlan Ellison once called 'telltale tics and tremors' that make you remember and become attached to them, like the guy who lost his ring, or the one who likes to eat a lot. You know, those guys. I'm shamed to admit I was genuinely moved by the ending. It was probably the best thing I could have seen after bouncing a ball of magic from my sword to a magic shield while trying not to get sucked into a vortex and shot with a beam by a floor monster.

So yeah, it's good, even great, but don't play it on Nightmare your first time, babies. Now I'm on to finish the god-awful piece of garbage this game is based on, and then to both of the Ys 4s. Those aren't on Steam, but I'll be back to tell you beatiful people about the next time I play an Ys game that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100453812', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3753, 'last_played': 1533984088}
review:
沿用6代引擎重制的3代，收复黑历史失地，将剧情重新归进有翼人主线中。相比前作流程更短，画面细节有提升，操作手感更爽快。
本作大大完善了战斗系统，沿用前作的三属性对应三种攻击方式，但技能更有特色：火属性远程+半伤，搭配下刺有奇效；风属性滞空+大范围连段伤害；地属性突进位移+无敌，运用得当可以无伤。新增了二段跳和爆气，技巧更丰富，BOSS战更刺激，计时战更是让人血脉偾张反复挑战。
本作的BGM也是绝赞，刚开始新一轮冒险上来就是街道的翼を持った少年，大有意气风发、挥斥方遒的气概；废矿坑的暗黒の罠搭配黑暗空洞的场景更显得废矿坑幽深恐怖；在バレスタイン城激昂的节奏下红发剑士独自一人面对城堡众多的士兵和机关，赶到钟楼时天色已染红，时の封印的鼓点越发显得时间的紧迫；疲于奔命的红发剑士终于登上钟楼顶，遇到复仇心切的白骑士，在夕阳的余晖下两人挥剑相向（BGM很粗暴就叫"Chop!!"）。
个人觉得这场BOSS战的气氛是系列最棒的，不知道又有谁在噩切2的压迫下还有暇欣赏这美景和BGM呢(笑)。巴雷斯坦城这段有当年达姆之塔一日游的风范（一路杀穿整个城/塔，随着BOSS倒下天色也在变化，让人感觉紧迫而又兴奋）。

steam版没有加上PSP版追加的新要素差评，不过某成就豆子又暴露出色魔本性，在某个支线色魔有机会推倒少女诶嘿嘿[spoiler]别想多，这是个健康积极的好游戏[/spoiler]

review:
Ich mag die Serie, ich mag die Mechanik, ich mag das Artwork.
Aber dieses Spiel hier ist schlicht schlecht designt. Speicherpunkte liegen fristrierend weit außeinander und Bosskämpfe sind ganz schlicht unfait. Der Dritte Boss kann z.B. unsichtbar werden, sich ranteleportieren und direkt angreifen.
Außerdem fehlt der PC Version die Sprachausgabe die Konsolen bekommen haben.
Alles in allem ein ziemlich frustrierendes Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973095348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8592, 'last_played': 1520318106}
review:
Introduction:
This is definitely my favourite of the Ys series.  The story, characters, and music all tie together well, and when paired with interesting and well-balanced gameplay, it makes for an awesome experience.  

Note for all Ys Games:
I recommend playing them in the order that they were created rather than in the order of the Ys timeline as everything will flow better and no plot twists will be spoiled.  If you're just in it for the story, no need to ramp up the difficulty, but if you're in it for the true Ys experience and all the achievements, start on the hardest difficulty... only if you're ready for a challenge (this game is extremely difficult and when you finally take down those bosses, you really feel a sense of achievement).  Onto the review.

Gameplay Mechanics:
Combat:
Unlike Ys 1 and 2, you have a variety of attacks and movement available to you.  You have various physical attacks/combos, 3 types of magic all with normal and charged activation, a boost state (rage, special, etc.), and the most amazing ability of all... Adol can now push his feet into the ground with sufficient force resulting in him launching off of said ground.

Party:
Until you get to Ys 7, you go solo (no party).

Equipment/Inventory:
No crafting in this game but you can upgrade your gear. You buy/find all of your items and gear and monsters give you gold, exp, and raval (used to upgrade your equips).  Just like Ys 1 and 2, Adol is not a thief... breaking into peoples' houses and rummaging through their drawers will not result in you acquiring pantsu (I tried).

Quests:
While there is no quest log, certain NPCs will have things for you to do at varying times throughout the storyline.

Achievements:
One issue for me is that some of the achievements need to be done on every difficulty level.  This means you need to beat the game (at least up to that point) 6 times, and one of those achievements "That's the Last Time, Kid", can be missed (if you're after all achievements, keep track of this one).  This makes the whole process pretty time consuming.

Story:
Like all the classics, you are the hero. Go save that princess. Slay the boss man. Ride/sail off into the sunset. While there are no daring writing choices, there are no issues or breaks in the immersion which is just as important if not more important. Like my initial note, if you play this on a difficulty that is not challenging to you, you don't get the right experience.  If you start on a high difficulty, make it to the first boss, and experience difficulty, don't give up right away.  Watch a video of the fight and keep trying.  Only if you're certain that you can't beat it should you dial back the difficulty (it was hard with plenty of rage, but if I played on a lower difficulty, it would not have felt like I earned those victories).

Final Score:
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999282226', 'num_games_owned': 972, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1520068638}
review:
Ys: Oath in Felghana is a remake of the originsl Ys III: Wanderers of Ys, and takes place chronologically after Ys Origins, and Ys 1 an 2, and before Ark of Napishtim and later games. It has none of the features of the PSP re-release, unfortunately, but is perfectly fine, running smoothly at 60 FPs with no drops whatosever.

All of the Ys games pride themselves on being very fast paced action RPG affairs, and OiF is no exception. It builds on the Napishtim engine games, and is the second of the series, the first being Ark of Napishtim itself, and Ys Origins being the final culmination of the games. Oath is difficult, even on Normal, and even for fans and devotees of the Ys series, and this speaks nothing of playing the game on Nightmare and Inferno if you're interested in achivement hunting all of the content. (which will require beating the game no less than 6 times, and time attack completely 3 times, as well as post rush boss content) Oath builds on the base of Napishtim and perfects it, removing buying healing items completely and forcing the player to rely entirely on drops and skill.

Ys: Oath in Felghana again tracks the adventures of Adol and Dogi after Ys 1 and 2, and returns them to Dogi's homeland of Felghana, and the town of Redmont. Soon enough, you come across Dogi's old friend Elana, and hear about her missing brother Chester, and the monsters that have been plaguing the land, and Adol and Dogi suddenly find themselves off on another monster crushing adventure, with a few hints and tidbits about previous games sprinkled throughout, linking the series through these quiet connections.

The gameplay is like the other Napishtim games, relying on combos, Focus (a shorrt lived but powerful boost to attacks and defense and combo ability), and spammable magic spells (a ranged fireball, an aoe tornado, and an invincible rock-dash) to let Adol cleave through enemies at blinding speed and rack up XP multipliers and temporary stat buffs. Platforming is frequent and sharp, with Adol being incredibly responsive to movements at all times, even when dashing at full speeds. Bosses often represent steep difficulty spikes compared to normal enemies, but this is standard for Ys games. Bossfights have a lot going on, but almost always feel fair in how they work (save for one lava boss), attacks are essentially always telegraphed, even if it's a quick tell, and so you can dodge and position properly. I didn't need to grind much at all, except for one specific instance  in the aforementioned lava land. As long as you fight every enemy you see, you'll have enough XP and GP for everything you need, plus a little extra if you want to buy a couple extra HP elixers (I ended up having the spare money for 3 by the end of the game)

The music is up to Ys standard, the classic mix of power rock and orchetral environment music, so if you're used to the series, you're going to get much more of that, and if for some reason Oath is your intro to the series, 1: Good luck, this isd a rough starter entry to the series, and 2: The music is fantastic, so enjoy.

Oath is a shorter Ys game and has an achievement for beating it in under 5 hours, but I'm confident it could be much much faster. Much like Origins, I think most players will play on one of 3 difficulties: Very Easy just to play the story and see the game, Normal for the usual challenge, and Nightmare into Inferno for the true Ys dedicated people (or people who hate their lives and want to grind out a boss forever because of 1 mistake - not for me). The boss rush extra content is optional, and unlike Origins, you only unlock a single extra bossfight and no other content besides achievements.

Overall, Oath is probably my second favorite of the Ys games I've played (Origins is my favorite but by a very narrow margin), and I've yet to play Napishtim, or Ys Seven. Oath has some of the best bosses in the series though, both in how you have to react and fight, and in the satisfaction you get when you finally best them. Strong recommendation - but also recommended you play Ys 1 and 2 first, at the very least, to be grounded in the series and have an understanding of how "the game works" even though the combat systems differ between the games.  Going from Origins to Felghana isn't a big step down - the graphics are a bit less, and Origins has more caracters, but you'll already be right at home with how the combat system works, and what's expected during bossfights and normal combat.

Sail forth and defeat your enemies!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078152869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1563723294}
review: Etant un grand adepte de la série Ys je voulais essayer cet opus. En effet, je n'ai pu faire que les deux opus sortis sur Psvita et j'ai donc acheté les autres sur Steam. Il s'agit d'un très bon opus mais il est vrai que quand on a joué aux autres où l'on a un groupe d'aventuriers cela fait bizarre de se retrouver seul. Cependant, tous les ingredients qui font de Ys un excellent jeu d'action RPG sont présents. Falcom fait toujours du bon boulot :). Je le conseille fortement!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078312059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 876, 'last_played': 1517473870}
review:
This game is a fast-paced action/RPG, originally released on the PSP. This version looks and plays great! This plays a lot like a hack and slash, but with some RPG mechanics.

Pros:
-	Beautiful soundtrack
-	Fast-paced, fluid gameplay
-	Fast travel!
-	Fun dungeon exploration
-	Nice graphics options
-	Perfect length 

Cons:
-	Relatively small world to explore
-	HUGE difficulty spike at the final boss
-	Unnecessary level grinding
-	Your fingers may get tired of button mashing!
-	Unfulfilling side quests

This is one of the more enjoyable entries in the series. While it’s not the most in-depth game, its strengths make it hard to pass up!
_______________________________________
Entertainment Value - 5
Gameplay - 4
Story – 3.5
Presentation (Graphics + Sound) – 4.5
Value for Price - 5

FINAL RATING – 4.4/5 (88%)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022311251', 'num_games_owned': 1209, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1500871550}
review:
Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim -- which actually came out before both this game and Ys Origin -- was a clear attempt at redeeming a new playstyle concept Falcom toyed around with on the Super Famicom in 1995's Ys V: Kefin, Lost City of Sand. While Napishtim was objectively superior to Kefin in every possible way, it was still rough along the edges: effectively rebuilding a D minus/F-grade game's mechanics into something I'd place anywhere from a B minus to a solid C.

Meanwhile, there's the third game in the series: Wanderers from Ys, released on far more platforms than I care to list. A significant departure for the series, Wanderers was a side-scrolling action game that relied on linear platforming more than the traditional top-down labyrinths seen in previous and future titles. It felt less like an Ys game and more like a successor to games like Castlevania and especially Zelda II, another contested sequel. Generally considered a black sheep of the franchise as a whole, Wanderers from Ys was also the first game in the franchise to receive a widespread release in the West, appearing on all three major 16-bit platforms -- while the original Ys was limited to Sega's Master System and a limited IBM PC release, and the second game was only released on the TurboGrafx-CD, via a compilation of the first two games.

So with remakes of the first two games, as well as a new sixth entry in the series, Falcom decided that rather that going straight into developing a seventh game -- more on that later -- they would remake the contested third game in the series, using the framework they developed for Napishtim as a base. This development culminated in what is generally considered among the best games in the entire series: The Oath in Felghana.

While Wanderers from Ys was more or less a standalone game, Felghana reimagines many of the story's elements to afford a greater sense of continuity with future games in the series. That being said, the basic outline of the game is kept the same and Falcom focuses more on expanding existing characters than outright adding brand-new ones (though there are a few of those as well). This leads to a storyline that manages to stay true to the source material, while feeling more complete at the same time. The story begins with Adol and his travelling companion Dogi returning to Dogi's home village of Redmont after a fortune teller warns of disaster in the area. Upon arrival, the two adventurers find Felghana infested with monsters, a new figurehead installed by the Romn Empire (a recurring foe of Adol's) and worst of all, Chester Stoddard in league with him, causing even more problems for the ailing villagers.

Napishtim was a good start for a more modernized take on the Ys games, but Felghana smoothes out its predecessor's various issues, leading to a much more streamlined and responsive game. It also retains a similar graphical style, focusing on aesthetics over graphical fidelity. Wanderers from Ys' soundtrack was the only element of the game that fans generally liked -- with the TurboGrafx-CD/Perfect Collection, arranged by Ryo Yoneimitsu being considered the best iteration of the classic soundtrack -- but Yukihiro Jindo's soundtracks, consisting entirely of new arrangements of every song from previous versions of the game managed to deliver what many fans consider to be the definitive way to experience the game's soundtrack.

XSEED released this game well after they released it on the PSP. It was their first PC release -- and it shows. None of the extra features associated with the PSP version are present in this release, including the art gallery and the voice acting. Of course, that means that the rebalancing that made the game easier and more tedious in many respects are also not present, which I think is a fair trade. XSEED did manage to optimize the game for more modern PC platforms, even implementing support for higher resolutions and widescreen, so at the very least, XSEED's release is the ideal way to play the game on PC.

Many people will recommend going for Felghana first if you're just getting into the series. Admittedly, that's not the way I handled it, but if you want to get a feel for the series before diving into the rest of the games, Felghana may very well be the best place to start. While most Ys games have episodic storylines in general, Felghana's story relies the least on earlier games in the series, the gameplay from Napishtim has been refined into something that is both easy to learn and a joy to master and both the aesthetics and sound design are top-notch. It's generally available on sale for a hefty discount, but personally, I'd say that it's well worth the full $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022259298', 'num_games_owned': 1164, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1701, 'last_played': 1608871048}
review:
It's a bold statement to say this is the best action jRPG of all time. So I won't do it. But I'll say I don't believe that a game can't be better - the most it can achieve is to be so good as this one.

It tuns on everything. It's not the prettiest game out there, but there's some charm and beauty about it. Tight controls. A fucking amazing sountrack (that goes well with the sounds of monsters and slashing).

It's so much fun I'm not sure why the government even allow it to be sold.

Oh, I have one thing to complain about the story (spoiler): there's a bad guy. And he is rich and powerful. And he kills a lot of guys. And you kill a lot of guys. But you can't kill this son of a bitch who have ruined everyone's life because you are a good guy. Fuck it. I wanna spill his guts in the floor. I wanna cut his head. I wanna at least to be able to kill him as I killed another characters. I hate the kind of story when the main character can injury the hired bodyguards but can't injure the villain.

Otherwise, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198292547483', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1516724586}
review:
YS=遗迹煞星（误）。
其实这个系列我之前只玩过6代。不过它的结局也是古老而伟大的遗迹烟消云散。
亚特鲁君，你这个冒险家真的不是终结古人成就的煞星么……
---
看了别人的测评，似乎普遍觉得本作的难度和挑战性都挺高。
于是，我果断用了修改 ysf_win.ini 的作弊法。
我不喜欢练级，而且对这游戏类型的热情不复当年了。
---
本作是6代之后，对3代进行了3D化重启。
经典系列中的一部稳定发挥水准的作品。
按现在的眼光，它只能算是一个比小品级游戏稍稍高一截的程度。
我是在大幅度打折时买的。感觉还算值吧。
至少，我玩了30小时，而且（在低难度下）通关了。

[h1]粗略点评[/h1]

剧情……不提也罢。头尾的动画水平低下，毫无观看价值。
难度设置比较合理，而且有各种难度模式选择。
杂兵全都很菜。我不练级，经常蹦蹦跳跳不理睬它们。而它们很少能阻挡我的前进。
而与之对比的是，boss大多对玩家的挑战性陡然上升。我遇到第一个boss时，就被虐很惨……
地形和机关的设计，发挥了3D的一些特点，不过特别出彩的亮点不多。
但好在，场景丰富，而且节奏很快，所以一直有新鲜感，足以让我不停玩下去。

[h1]心得和注意事项[/h1]

动作游戏，当然应当用手柄玩。我的是XBox 360手柄。

首先，去[url=https://steamcn.com/t107903-1-1]下载汉化[/url]并按说明操作。

然后，运行设置程序。

[u][b]推荐按键设置为：[/b][/u]

[list]
	[*] 跳跃: A
	[*] 攻击: X
	[*] 魔法: R1
	[*] 爆气: L1
	[*] 上一腕轮: Y
	[*] 下一腕轮: B
	[*] 菜单: 选择键
[/list]

[u]魔法为什么用R1？[/u]

如果用B之类的主要按键，很容易就按住过久。
而魔法的施放是以[b]松开按键[/b]为准的。
尤其对于旋风魔法——用来暂时浮空——来说，这个在时机上的延后，往往会导致严重的后果。我已经吃够亏了。
R1更容易弹开。改成它后，我的失误大大减少。

[u]菜单为什么不用传统的开始键？[/u]

因为确认键就是攻击键。而我发现用右手大拇指先伸出、按开始键，再紧接着收回、按X，不顺畅。有时候，一着急，指甲还会妨碍按下开始键。
改成左手按选择键，右手就不用移动太远。

[u][b]其它[/b][/u]

游戏后期，遇到非常考验跳跃的关卡设计，这时，务必用[b]十字键[/b]来控制方向！
否则，蘑菇头摇杆绝对会坑你坑得让你想死……

按 F1 可以切换 No-Fall 模式。见游戏中右上角的红字。
开启它(on)，可以在你本该掉落到下一层场景时，变成回到本场景的入口。
但小心：这时，它会[b]自动重新变成关闭(off)[/b]，所以下一次掉落就不管了！
奇怪的规则……

至于修改 ysf_win.ini 的方法，上网搜索即可找到。略。
需要补充的是：如果反复按F2把等级升到顶，可以让主角变得近乎无敌，省得时不时按F5补血。

[h1]关卡和剧情相关[/h1]

得到一个秘药，其说明没有指出有啥用。让人犹豫。
应该立即喝了它。[spoiler]可以给你增加“冲刺”（其实就是跑得更快）的能力。[/spoiler]

一个NPC多次收购你的矿石后，最终会奖励你一个戒指。
立即出镇，存个档。
然后，[spoiler]去商店，把戒指“卖”给道具娘。你会发现巨亏，但可以得到一个哭脸的成就。[/spoiler]
然后，读档，[spoiler]留着戒指。之后你会发现它真正的主人是谁的。到时候，可以换来一个延长战斗buff持续时间的被动能力。[/spoiler]

由于我启用了作弊，所以在熔岩地带，不畏走路损血就继续前进了……
我起初还以为，这个关卡设计是为了考验玩家跳起并在空中挥剑，从而尽可能延长每一跳的距离（大概多了20%吧）。后来发现是我想多了。
正常的流程应该是：[spoiler]在一个容易掉落出去的场景（记得利用F1），可以在尽头拿到一个免疫熔岩的道具。[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198316426206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1533866262}
review:
YS: The oath in felghana es un juego muy entretenido y SUPER desafiante en sus dificultades regulares y muy altas.
A simple vista parece que no le he invertido muchas horas, pero en su lanzamiento original de la PSP, ahi tuve la oportunidad de conseguirlo y terminarme el juego en 11 hrs aproxidamente, puesto que la historia no es del todo original y tiene uno o varios cliches, puedo asegurarles que la jugabilidad recompensa la narrativa. No me gusta comparar juegos entre juegos, pero para ser mas claro que tipo de juego es, digamos que es una mezcla de " The Legend of Zelda " y " Tales of ( Saga ) ", hasta puedo decir que un poco de " Secret of mana ". Vale mucho la pena este juego de verdad y les puedo asegurar que el Soundtrack no es para NADA MALO, principalmente el del overworld. 

Juegazo 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043646212', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1515486585}
review: 今天終於通關了。作為我入坑伊蘇的第一部作品，當年在商場賣69一個，我想了很久很久才買的一款作品。當時在買了之後看著包裝裡面的設定集啊什麼的感覺十分吸引。很可惜的是現在這個遊戲的盒子，碟和設定集全部都不見了。當然當年的我也沒有通關，後來在網上下了盜版通關了normal和hard。也暫時放下了。也是因為這個伊蘇F讓我接觸了伊蘇系列，2 F 6 origin 7都陸續通關了。這是這個遊戲讓我發現自己的真愛還是ARPG。隨便寫了點抒發一下對這個遊戲的感情。為童年回憶點讚。

author: {'steamid': '76561198134811561', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1515521928}
review:
There need to be more games like this. 
+Great Soundtrack(Nothing like symphonic rock blastin' while you're slaying baddies)
+Very fluid and solid combat(Fast-paced even compared to modern action games)
+Story is really good so far(Relatable characters)
+Overall pacing is just right, not too slow and gets right into the action
+Plenty of save points 
+Not only do you get swordplay, you also have magic attacks that recharge over time
+Upgradable weapons and armor to suit most playstyles
+Big bosses and plenty of them

-No cons I can think of. Pretty flawless action rpg. This is the game I think of when someone 
asks me what an action rpg is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256470130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1582603222}
review: Assim como os outros jogos da franquia Ys: The Oath in Felghana é ótimo pra quem busca um RPG divertido, simples e ao mesmo tempo desafiador, mesmo na dificuldade normal o jogo nao vai te dar folga com seus vários bosses cheios de padrões de ataque. Vale ressaltar também dos NPCs que diferente de muitos outros RPGs tem um destaque a mais, e da trilha sonora que é fantástica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267642476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1515450811}
review:
이스입니다. 무슨 말이 필요한가!
역시나 이번에도 3사이즈 측정이 있습니다.
마을 앞 세이브 포인트에서 살살 밀어넣어서 측정 하시면 됩니다.
(이번엔 사이즈는 직접적으로 안나오나 보더군요 ㅠㅠ)
덤으로 호위 임무가 두개입니다.
역시나 최대한 따돌리고 돌아가서 끌고 오는 것을 추천합니다.
그리고 대망의 보스러쉬 최종보스는 삐까드!
(인페르노 크레딧 이후입니다. 얼타지 마요 저처럼 ㅠ)
살인적인 귀여움을 느낄 수 있습니다. (여러모로...)
보스러쉬 나이트메어를 깨시면 추가 스테이지가 나옵니다. (베르할트 할배...)
그걸 깨면 디버그모드(라고 쓰고 치트모드)가 활성화되요!

P.S. 그나저나 8은 예구 걸어놓고 정주행 다 하는데 언제 나오는겨... PS4 사야하나!
아. 그리고 역시나 패드보단 키보드를 추천합니다.
패드는 마법 모아서 점프하기 힘들어요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090930437', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1094, 'last_played': 1514665575}
review:
Ys is one of the best action RPG series and Oath in Felghana is my favorite Ys so far. As usual the Gameplay is amazing. The story and characters are good too. My favorite part though is easily the soundtrack. Like Falcom sound team jdk really outdid themselves. the music is 10/10.

9/10 Overall. Go for it if you want a good challenging action RPG with great music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165315684', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 6274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6153, 'last_played': 1514749601}
review:
Ok after essentially bleeding out my eyes for this game, I believe I'm at a position to give a review. It is an enhancement of the Napishtim engine, gameplay is solid, story is good. Hard mode and below can be accomplished without issues. It is as good as any introduction to the series though I recommend playing Ys VI first. Nightmare difficulty and above? You're in for hell. It can be as rewarding as it is frustrating. If you're looking for a hack'n'slash where you spend hours against bosses learning them to finally kill them off, this game provides. Probably better then any Ys game, if not, on a par with Ys Origin. 

Overall 9/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110722702', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 20817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11736, 'last_played': 1624780190}
review: 初二的时候，69块钱买的正版光盘，是一个大的纸盒子，里面还有一个全彩手册。 通关不下五遍，那时候我家的电脑是02年的，这游戏是当时电脑能带的动得最高配置。玩完了借给院子里的小孩子一起玩。当时我比他们都大，我们一起玩那种圆圆的卡，我的卡多，玩完了就索性送给他们了。后来上了高中，院子里的小孩要么搬走了，要么都不出来玩了。我把自己最后的悠悠球送给院子里认识的还没搬走的小孩。即使院子里安装了新的健身器械，有了手机，也没什么人下楼玩了。这个游戏的光盘最后永远的留在陈晨家，后来听说他搬走了，我也来到了国外。再回去，可能院子都物是人非了。这游戏，也承载了我在楼下院子里和他们玩耍的全部记忆。

author: {'steamid': '76561198047819928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1563737975}
review:
I have fond memories of Ys on the Turbografx, so once in awhile I go on a nostalgia kick and check out the current state of Ys. Found this again, having started a campaign a few years ago, and this time finished in 3-4 days, sharing the action with my 5 year old son who LOVED going on this adventure with me. We both couldn't wait to finish dinner and go play this every night!

Highlights:
Amazingly fun and satisfying combat.
Challenging but fair boss battles
Some of the best music in video games
Simple but good story
No busy work...you only deal in items you need
Some enjoyable platforming
Well done graphics, regardless of era.

All in all, these days it takes ALOT to keep me coming back for more with any non-driving game. I'm 40 years old. But this had me hooked. Just finished on easy. Downloading ys 1 and 2 now to start a new campaign with my son. Quality time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198255058562', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1584791267}

author: {'steamid': '76561198297296547', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1654604115}
review:
首先要说的是我并不是补票，因为当年Falcom在中国代理发售的官中我就有购买，菲尔盖纳，纳比斯汀，起源，包括2个双星物语和迷城的国度，至今游戏碟和说明书什么的都还能运行，[spoiler]因为这些正版游戏没有碟是运行不了的。	[/spoiler]有人肯定就问了你说那么多干什么炫耀吗？[spoiler]是有一点点啦[/spoiler]   顺带一提STEAM的定价和当年游戏盒上标的价格是一样的
为什么要买呢？因为这是绝对的官正，虽然没有代理的汉化，但我依然还是想买，[spoiler]因为打折了3折呢[/spoiler] 
 
想要汉化的评测就有，完美运行。但不知为何打了汉化就不能跳成就了，可能是更新的缘故。[spoiler]  幸好有通关过不在意汉化，刷刷刷就通关了，成就重要[/spoiler]   

BOSS战依旧惊险刺激，音乐扣人心弦，让人不由自主就杀红眼，死了再战，[spoiler]   站起再死。[/spoiler]   
[spoiler]  切斯特真帅[/spoiler]  

加的一些成就很麻烦，6种难度都要打一遍
不过，伊苏系列好评就对了，赞就对了

author: {'steamid': '76561198093726039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1512137151}
review:
플레이 타임은 짧다. 모든 거 다 챙겨가면서 해도 7시간 정도. 

업적은 짜증난다. 난이도 업적은 뭐 그럴 수 있다고 생각 함. 근데 호위 이벤트? 모든 난이도에 대해서 호위 이벤트를 봐야돼서 6번이나 같은 플레이를 해야한다. 아무리 치트도 되고 중반까지만 가도 된다고 해도 영 맘에 안 드는 부분.

나머지는 생각보다 늘어나는 현상이 별로 없다는 점은 굳. 동료가 없이 아돌로만 계속 플레이해야 되는 점은 아쉬웠다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198199753398', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1511500360}
review: There's something oddly satisfying about the contrast of being able to splatter normal monsters while running circles around them, and having to carefully manage your every movement in order to overcome a powerful boss, making it feel like a real life or death duel. The Ys series just seems to scratch that itch *really* well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349647448', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1594626707}
review: La verdad es que si eres de los seguidores y amantes de esta saga Ys, verás que esta entrega tampoco te dejará con mal sabor. Tiene lo que cualquier otro Ys te da para que sea agradable. Puedes mejorar tu equipamento, subir de nivel, etc. Y no sin poder faltar, una buena banda sonora como es de esperar de esta saga. Solo que a mi gusto, su mundo abierto es muy reducido, para poder acceder a otra parte del mapa debes tener cierto item. Es decir, avanzas de manera muy lineal, no puedes ir a explorar o hacerte la vida dificil con un buen leveo en zonas más altas, además de que el mapa de por si es un poco pequeño. Es rescatable cuando diferencias esto con la dificultad de los dungeons y los bosses, no son sencillos, pero tampoco son descabellados. No creo que valga el precio original que mantiene, pero si lo tomas en rebaja, lo vale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966988204', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1338, 'last_played': 1516094967}

review:
Pretty good action JRPG.

Large focus on difficult boss battles. Can't kill the boss? Go grind a couple of levels more and try again :)
Items and gear are not as important as skill and levels are.

Good gameplay, good music and good boss battles.

Buy it if you don't mind being stuck on a boss for quite a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328520483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1731, 'last_played': 1531899313}
review:
★팔콤빠

아루온 시절의 이스, 지금의 이스8 그리고 현재의 페르가나

최근 오리진,페르가나를 다시하면서 느끼지만 확실히 플래시 가드/무브가 생기면서 손맛이 좋아지긴 했지만

난이도가 떨어진 느낌이 확실히 난다. 세월탓인가 했지만 이스8을 다깬지 1년도 채 되지않았다.(갈바란 왜이렇게 어렵;)


팔콤하면 브금.. 아루온때나 좋았지 지금들어보니 그냥 평타치는 수준인 듯하다. 물론 적당히 모험심을 자극하는 느낌이라 만족스럽기는 마찬가지

플래시 가드/무브 있다가 없으니 전투가 상대적으로 지루한 감이 없지않지만 이 시기의 시리즈 특유의 화,풍,지를 이용한 전투방식, 퍼즐? 또한 지금해도나쁘지 않았다.

지금 다시해도 게임내적으로 몇가지를 제외하고는 크게 깔건 없는데..(엘레나의 옆모습이라던지..옆모습이라던지..)

도전과제 중에 좀 주옥같은게 몇개 보인다. 오리진도 그렇지만 강제 6회차라니.. 스팀이니까 도전과제 노상관 :-)

----유저한글패치 적용시 일부 도전과제가 적용안되는 오류가 있음

author: {'steamid': '76561198145527633', 'num_games_owned': 1351, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1509280292}
review:
Hard game, even first boss is hard @_@
Ppl on y**tube make it looks easy XD
(I've played on normal, achievement for lower difficulty also unlocked)

No recovery items (there's a one time revive item)
No bad status (yayy)
Normal enemy drop timed items (like bonus str, def) and instant recovery
Have some hard jumping stage
Have teleport mechanic to save monument so not much backtracking
Need to grind if you're bad at dodging boss attack (like me)

Story is ok, this series is excel on boss fight and nice music ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4718, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1507225171}
review:
[h1] If you're not into Grinding and want the typical YS Experience, select a lower difficulty - lower than Normal [/h1]

I've played this Game on normal and had to grind a little bit per level but all in all a positive Experience. I already played this Game outside of Steam and that's why it only took like 6 Hours to complete for me because I really "Speedrunned" through it.

But that doesn't make the Game any worse or "bad". It's the Typical YS Game and I LOVE IT! Beautiful Music, Artstyle and Gameplay. I'm a huge JRPG Fan and the Story is really pretty.

YS is a Game you can't hate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986543956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1523996572}
review:
For the very first time I am playing all Ys games. Until very recently I have never played nor seen anyone play any of the Ys games. Around Sept/20 2017 I started with Ys I, then Ys II, followed by Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim, Ys: The Oath in Felghana, Ys Orgin, Ys Seven, Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana, Ys: Memories of Celceta. Now in in the year 2021 I beat the new game Ys IX: Monstrum Nox. Leaving no current Ys games left on Steam. I will continue this mission of mine if/when more Ys games get ported to Steam. My goal has been reached! Below is how I rank the games I have played and beat so far from best to worst. I love all the Ys games even Ys I. So I am a huge fan of this series. I will edit this review as I play and beat more Ys games.

<Best>
Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana
Ys Seven
Ys IX: Monstrum Nox
Ys: Memories of Celceta
Ys: The Oath in Felghana
Ys: Origin
Ys II 
Ys VI: The Ark of Napishtim 
Ys I
<Worst>

Still Left to Play...
None (As of this moment.)

What I thought of "YS: The Oath in Felghana"
This game is one of my favorite Ys Game. The attack controls are very fluid and feel very natural. The best yet out of the Ys titles I have played I think. Normal enemies are not as tough to take down as in other Ys titles. But bosses as well as level design are top notch. The boss fights are very challenging! The game is not the longest in length of the YS Games I have played. I had a lot of fun with the level layouts. You need to grind but you don't need to over grind endlessly. No major issues I have with the game. As in many Ys Games the controls and combat may take a little to get used too.  This was my favorite until I completed Ys Seven.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081951932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1505766894}
review:
Para uma primeira vez no universo do YS, não esperava um jogo tão difícil. Porém, não tem nada melhor do que derrotar um boss desafiante, principalmente o segundo boss do jogo, depois de dar game over 500 milhões de vezes.
A trilha sonora é fantástica, e apesar de ter um pouco de grinding de vez em quando, é um ótimo jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255905725', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3443, 'last_played': 1506886969}
review:
[B]Pros[/B]
+ Challenging boss battles: One of the trade marks of the Ys series. Especially on higher difficulties it can take a lot of time to beat a boss. On the highest difficulty even normal monsters can seriously hurt you.
+ You can directly restart the boss battle if you lose.
+ Good music (like always)
+ Good controls: The character is moving exactly the way I want it to (tip: rebind your magic key to one of your shoulder buttons, if you are playing with a controller)
+ I was not ready for that extra boss.

[B]Contras[/B]
- Some unnecassary achievements: For instance, you have to fulfill a certain mission on EVERY difficulty (six in total, but "luckily" you don't have to play the whole game six times). 
- If you get hurt before a boss battle you will not get fully healed even after retrying a boss battle. 

[B]Remarks[/B]
I've played this game three times fully + four times partially to obtain every achievement. 
Some a grindy but nothing too bad.
A skip dialogue function/button would have been nice.

Conclusion? I want to play the next installment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988244668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1506808424}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995152301', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1599, 'last_played': 1492317974}
review:
These are the notes I took in the middle of the night while wrapping up my first playthrough of this amazing game a few months ago:


- Combat feels like hitting a packets of crisps with a metal bat (unlike Kingdom Hearts, where combat feels like hitting a shallow pool with a fish). 

- You know it's an an action game when you have to rebind your keys. You ever had to rebind your keys for a JRPG? I rest my case. 

- Played [the last boss] all night, in a romantically obsessive sort of way. Then I see it getting light again outside, and it stops being romantic and starts being sad. But soon, at about 5:30am, I beat him. 

- My heart hasn't been beating that hard in... [?]

- Maybe sleep deprivation is affecting my judgement here, but it seems like that was pretty much the most incredible boss fight I have ever played. I'm comparing it to Megaman Zero and ZX, Iga Castlevania, God of War... I guess Megaman ZX comes closes, but so much of the excitement in those games is beating the boss guantlet, committing all that time before you even get to the actual last boss. Oath's last boss is self contained. You die, you start again at the beginning of the fight — and after, what, 4 hours, it was still incredible fun. 


I can't wait to play Origins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074690200', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1500414716}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991157647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 6153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5579, 'last_played': 1627894874}
review:
I gotta admit, this is a game I grew up playing on the SNES, although at the time I believe it was called Wanderer's of YS 3 and not Oath of Felghana. I always worry whenever a game gets switched to an isometric or 3d playstyle from a 2d side scroller but this one was perfectly executed. They captured the same challenges as the first game, the movement and combat are fluid even jumping around. I do admit that the ring system on the SNES version gave you a few more abilities you could use opposed to what we have now but I also understand their design decision because they were going for a more action packed, fast to play game style.

It all worked well. I mean I admit my first playthrough picking hard difficulty may not have been the best choice. I raged, oh boy did I rage LOL. But I won! That satisfying feeling of winning something really difficult can't be beat. That is what the developers did right with this remake. They captured that satisfying feeling of victory with fast, action packed gameplay that didn't depend on game design that punishes you for 'dying' by making you waste time backtracking. You die? Jump right back in and try again gives it that arcade feeling where you get addicted and just keep putting in those quarters until you finally win and shout YES! WOOHOO! I'M AWESOME!

I have absolutely no complaints about the gameplay at all. If you don't like your games to be difficult, this isn't the game for you. If you appreciate a challenge and feel the victory of overcoming such challenges is a sweet reward, you will love this.

As far as the story goes? Well I had to install some mod to get the voice acting from the PSP working here. I really liked the voice acting and the story overall is pretty good. It's really your stereotypical hero who conquors evil with some really nice twists. I can't call it the most riveting story ever told but it is absolutely enjoyable, at least to me.

Also the music... wow. The composer did a fantastic job with the music score in this game. It's so blood pumping and at times emotional and makes up some of the best music I've heard in the industry actually. 

The Art style? Well it's an isometric 2d style, top down camera, pixel art and level design giving the illusion of 3d but I can really appreciate this style it's colorful and creative.

Lastly, the level design. Many of it feels maze-like with some hidden secrets. They did a pretty good job capturing that old school level design we appreciated on the SNES game. But it isn't so maze-like that you can find yourself lost and going around in circles constantly.

Ys: The Oath of Felghana is a masterful recreation of the SNES game Wanderer's of YS 3 and i've enjoyed every minute I spent in this game thoroughly and will continue to support Xseed's future YS projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026769505', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1452171984}
review:
A fine story as an RPG, but the gameplay ruins it.
Since I am a fan of similar hack-and-slash/JRPGs like PS1's Alundra, I was expecting a similar satisfaction from this game. Sadly the Hack-and-slash combat felt clunky at best, I could never move as smoothly as I wanted, levelling and character progression was meaningless outside of the main story abilities, and the only reason I kept playing after the 1st boss was that I could swap my buttons layout through my controller drivers (cause there's no keymapping in this game...) when I had to spam X and B at the same time to jump and attack at the same time because the devs forgot to test how playable the controls were.
I am glad to see Nihon Falcom, or anyone else, port their games to PC, but I hope they do a better work with newer releases cause I want to become a fan of their other games but not if they are like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077655402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1617402777}
review:
Oath in Felghana é possivelmente o “magnum opus” dos jogos da série “Ys”.

Remake de “Ys III -  Wanderers of Ys”, cronologicamente ele se passa entre “Memories of Celceta” e “Kefin, The Lost City of Sand”, assim sendo a terceira aventura de Adol “the Red” Christin, o herói e protagonista da série.

Embora o jogo seja relativamente antigo, graficamente Oath in Felghana continua belíssimo, mesclando com sutileza gráficos 3d com 2d no design das dungeons, monstros, e demais personagens.

Ys contem uma historia bastante simples, entretanto com um roteiro muito bem escrito, o jogo possui um argumento convincente, recheado de personagens com personalidade própria - dialogar com os NPCs é uma grata surpresa. Por sua vez, a trilha sonora matem a qualidade padrão dos jogos da Falcom, simplesmente maravilhosa. 

Contudo, o grande destaque do jogo fica definitivamente com seu gameplay que é absurdamente divertido. Ágil, desafiador, e intenso, o gameplay vai melhorando cada vez mais à medida que o jogador vai progredido durante o jogo. Evidenciando o combate e velocidade, de modo que quanto mais inimigos o personagem derrotar num intervalo de tempo menor, mais o personagem se fortalece – ganhando mais força, defesa, velocidade, mana, e experiência. 

Em suma, “Ys - The Oath in Felghana” envelheceu muito bem, estando longe de ser considerado datado. O jogo vem com vários níveis de dificuldade, sendo próprio tanto para os jogadores mais casuais quanto para quem procura um grande desafio.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981543135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1088, 'last_played': 1500803011}
review:
Un des meilleur Ys sur PC avec Origins, on retrouve toujours une BO au top (la musique de "Valestein Castle" est énorme).
 Le système de combat est celui d'un beat'em all dynamique avec divers coups possibles qui varie surtout selon si on saute ou non et avec 3 magie bien différentes qu'on changera selon les ennemis.
 On a un système a la "metroid-vania" ou il faudra débloquer des pouvoirs pour accèder a divers endroits et revisiter d'autres endroits pour en découvrir quelques passages secrets. On a aussi quelques phases de plateformes qui restent plutot accessibles hormis a certains endroits ou on a du mal a voir la profondeur (axe z). A noter qu'il y a plusieurs choix de difficultés ce qui est appréciable dans ce genre de jeu.

Comme dans tout les Ys il y aura toujours un peu de grind a chaque nouvelle zone mais celui ci n'est pas trop contraignant , 20min par zone en général, avec la musique et le dynamisme des combats sa n'est pas du tout chiant. Il faut aussi pensez a améliorer son équipement dès que possible pour limiter les dégats et se defaire plus rapidement des ennemis.

Il n'y a pas besoin d'avoir fait les jeux précédents, chaqu'uns étant indépendant les uns des autres hormis Ys 1 et 2. Il y a parfois quelques clins d'oeil aux autres jeux mais rien d'importants. A noter que les jeux ne sont qu'en Anglais mais ne demande qu'un niveau moyen.

Points positifs :
-Des musiques toujours aussi prenantes.
-Combats dynamiques basé sur 3 magies bien différentes.
-Combats de Boss variés et demandant un peu de stratégie et pas mal de réflexes.
-Un scénario classique mais efficace avec des personange attachants.

Neutres : 
-Durée de vie un peu courte, 8h. Mais le jeu n'a quasiment aucun temps morts que sa n'est pas très grave.
-Le grind bien que léger (20-30min par zone) est quasiment nécessaire a chaque nouvelle zone sous peine de mourrir rapidement.

Points négatifs :
-La zone de la montagne un peu pénible, assez labyrinthique et avec des monstres assez chiant au début.
-Quelques phases de sauts pénibles.
-Boutons de la manette Xbox One non reconnus pour reconfigurer, obligé de passer par un logiciel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356141989', 'num_games_owned': 2521, 'num_reviews': 637, 'playtime_forever': 3135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2266, 'last_played': 1501673484}
review:
I just love the Ys series, the ports are awesome and this game in particular over other titles (as Ys VI) has perfect controls and great music. The storyline is as always not that complicated, but you have still the same pattern with your only hero, his three different magics, lots of puzzles and so on.
The main problem is that the Ys series has silly achievements. But this game is crazy. You have to play the whole game at least six (6) times in order to get the different achievements. I mean, you must finish it both on very easy and on easy..
And you also must finish it in less than 5 hours, for another achievement.. Plus, you must beat the whole bossh rush on different difficulties..
So, if you're an achievement hunter, expect this game to take many hours from your weeks.. :) Even because some puzzles are not frustrating, they're easy, but they're very long and six times is really something unbelievable..
But the game is great, graphics are awesome and even if the lovely bump battle system has been dropped since the first episodes this is a hack n' slash action jrpg that will not disappoint even those who like me love turn-based systems.
As any other Ys game, it's short (of course, there's an achievement that requires you beat it in less than 5 hours!! on very easy difficulty obviously).. but enjoyable like the rest of the series, even though Ys 1 and 2 are still better to me :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198210221317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1450, 'last_played': 1498663406}
review:
F社的游戏用这种二头身加老掉牙的故事硬生生做了6部伊苏，也是日厂智障的代表。阿豆一如既往的走着把妹拯救世界的道路，游戏本身难度不高，当然仅限于愿意刷一定等级，另外高难度，还是手残杀手的。
另外，伊苏f的boss战，还是经典的需要背板，虽然有的boss设计真的是无力吐槽，比如某个需要打乒乓球的最终boss。
剧情本身，也是传承了各代伊苏的特点，一个“捡到”阿豆并且爱上阿豆的女主角，一个你“想不到”的幕后黑手，和一个需要收集三种元素才能干死的游戏流程
如果能够接受这种过时画风，而且喜欢2d动作rpg，并且喜欢日式奇幻和略带自虐的人，推荐

review: Arkadaşlar selamlar öncelikle oyun çok güzel.Combatlar olsun ewt zor ama very easy oynarsanız eminim rahatça geçebilirsiniz.Ben Normalde oynuyorum sadece bosslarda zorlandım :D oyunda heryere git olayı var.Çok güzel oyun bence.Biraz oynadım sonra farkettim ki başka oyunlarıda varmış ve ilkide bu değilmiş. :D İlki olmayı bırakın başka oyunu yok sanıyodum.İlki 2.'si ve origin diye bi oyunu varmış ve ys seven ve ps vitada olanı varmış.ps vitada olanınıda alıcam :) Sevenıda bi şekilde bulucam. :D Aslında ben 3,4 ve 5'i arıyorum :) onlarıda bulursam seriyi tamamlıyabilirim 3,4 ve 5'i nerden bulabiliceğimi söylermisiniz? Ben 6'yı bıraktım 1'e başladım. Sanırım ilk 1'i bitiricem :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198048051084', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 614, 'last_played': 1498592208}
review:
Ys (gesprochen Is) ist eine Reihe von japnischen Action-Rollenspielen mit starker Betonung auf "Action", zumindest was diesen Ableger der Reihe angeht. Die aktuell auf Steam verfügbaren Spiele können in beliebiger Reihe gespielt werden, Vorkenntnisse sind nicht erforderlich.

Ys Oath in Felghana ist ein Remake von Ys III, welches in einer mittelalterlichen Fantasywelt spielt. Der reisende Abenteurer Adol kommt in Felghana an, während sich gerade eine neue Krise in diesem kleinen Reich anbahnt. Und so muss er (fast) im Alleingang dieses Reich retten.
Fokus des Spiels sind Dungeons mit schnellen Kämpfe und harten Bosskämpfen, die nur wenige Fehler verzeihen. Aber auch Story, einfache Rätsel und Sprungpassagen bietet das Spiel. 

Was gefällt mir an dem Spiel:
- Actionreihe, gegnergefüllte Dungeons voller Action
- Optionale Schätze und versteckte Sidequests
- Actionreiche mitreisende Musik
- Jump and Run Passagen, welche zum Teil an Sidescroller anlehnt sind.
- Fordernde Bossekämpfe, welche Übung,Reaktionsschnelligkeit und Vorbereitung verlangen.
- Man muss wenig grinden, sofern man alle Gegner die man sieht niedermäht. Das Spiel lässt sich in weniger als 10 Stunden durchspielen. Muss man doch mal für einen Bosskampf kurz grinden, ist das in 10 Minuten erledigt.
- Gelungenes Magiesystem mit 3 Elementen, welche alle Ihre Verwendung finden.
- Gute Geschichte, gibt aber nicht mit Final Fantasy X oder Trails in the Sky zu vergleichen

Was gefällt mir weniger:
- Die Grafik ist etwas altbacken, Die Artworks sind zwar nicht pixelg, könnten aber eine noch höhere Auflösung vertragen.
- Die Nebencharactere bleiben eher blass, sind aber auch nicht der Fokus des Spiels.

Falls man noch nie Ys gespielt hat, sollte man auf maximal auf dem Schwierigkeitsgrad Normal anfangen. Wer sich unsicher ist, kann auch Easy wählen. Wenn man Ys schon kennt, weiß man jedenfalls bereits was einen erwartet. Ein Gamepad ist empfehlenswert. 

Fazit: Wer eine schnelle actionreiche Herausforderung sucht ist bei diesem Spiel genau richtig. Meiner Meinung nach ist es einer besten Titel der Reihe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181328795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1498852411}
review:
Pretty decent for a jrpg game released in 2012. It's probably the hardest and most challenging among the Ys series in pc.
Gameplay: 7.5/10 (typical hacknslash with magic)
Story: 8/10 (good plot-twist, didn't expect the last part)
Difficulty: Compared to other jrpg's, the normal mode in this game is probably the hard mode on others. I suggest you start on easy mode, familiarize with the game then do another run on higher difficulty to do the achievements.
The only bad thing I would say about this game is the clocktower. It's so freaking hard and would test your patience but once you overcome it, it's really satisfying.
I just finished it but would do another run on a higher difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103916275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 1606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1497206050}
review:
Vollprofis werden es lieben und alle Anderen insgeheim verfluchen

Ys: The Oath in Felghana konnte mich leider nicht so richtig überzeugen. Schuld daran ist in erster Linie der kaputte Schwierigkeitsgrad, der sich eindeutig an Hardcore-Spieler richtet. Selbst auf „Easy“ sind einige der späteren Bosse eine echte Qual und der sogenannte „Normal“-Schwierigkeitsgrad wäre in jedem anderen Ys-Spiel in die „Hard“-Kategorie gefallen.
Darüber hinaus nervt das Spiel mit ödem Schlauchleveldesign und einer arg kurzen Spieldauer. Da haben die anderen Serienableger einfach wesentlich mehr zu bieten als dieses Remake zu Ys III. Nichtsdestotrotz bietet auch dieser Ableger schnelle, actionreiche und angenehm unterhaltsame Kämpfe gegen Trash-Mobs, sowie epische Bossgegner, die zwar viele Nerven kosten, aber dafür auch ein tolles Erfolgserlebnis gewähren, sobald man sie nach einigen Grinding-Orgien doch noch bezwingt. The Oath in Felghana ist sicherlich nicht das Highlight der Serie (auch wenn das Hardcore-Spieler anders sehen werden), aber dennoch einen Blick wert, wenn man ein großer Fan der Reihe ist und eine Herausforderung nicht scheut.


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- Es ist besser als das lahme „Ys III: Wanderers from Ys“
- spielt sich gewohnt schnell und actionreich
- Handlung und Charaktere wurden im Vergleich zum Original stark verbessert
- der ätzende Weitsprung aus Ys VI wurde rausgekickt (gibt jetzt stattdessen einen Doppelsprung)

Neutral:
- gewohnte Falcom-Qualität im audiovisuellen Bereich, aber nichts wirklich besonderes

Kontra:
- stellenweise kaputter Schwierigkeitsgrad, das Spiel wirkt in erster Linie für Hardcore-Spieler konzipiert, was andere Gruppen ausschließt
- ausgiebiges Grinding ist auch im Remake Pflicht um voranzukommen
- langweilige, lineare Oberwelt und Dungeons (Schlauchleveldesign)
- das Spiel ist etwas arg kurz für sein Genre (ca. 5-10 Stunden Spielzeit)


Das vollständige Review: http://www.gamecontrast.de/ys-the-oath-in-felghana-review/#more-70205

author: {'steamid': '76561198168977854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5710, 'last_played': 1497301057}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126178389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2047, 'last_played': 1447021403}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004529716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1495991765}
review:
This is actually 2 kinds of games in 1: a hack-and-slash action game, and a quick-time-event-like game.  Make sure you enjoy both types of gameplay before jumping in.

The majority of the dungeons is the hack-and-slash RPG type.  You can kite enemies, make big long chain combos, with plenty of non-stop action until everything is dead.

Then the boss fights are more like quicktime events.  While it's not exactly the same a QTE, it might as well be.  There's no more continuous action, no chaining combos.  90% of boss fights are learning the timing of the boss's attacks and jumping dodge at the right time - i.e. press X to not die right now.

The difficulty is not an issue, as the game has multiple difficulty levels from very easy to ridiculously hard.  However, the sudden change in gameplay style remains regardless of difficulty level.

As for the story and characters, I didn't get through the whole thing obviously, but it seems to be a pretty generic JRPG style of story.  Not much to say there.

Me personally, I don't like the dodge-forever and wait for the chance to land 1 hit style of gameplay, which made the boss fights annoying and boring enough that I ended up putting the game down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045345033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1580, 'last_played': 1616559178}
review: Incredibly fun and challenging game. Offers lots of replayability, a ton of great bosses that just feel amazing to conquer, incredible music that goes well with the game, and serves as a great remake for a game from the 90s. They also decided to be nice with the difficulty and give you a retry button for boss battles. You'll spend a lot of time clicking it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963047901', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 5573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5271, 'last_played': 1491611727}
review:
I've held off reviewing this one because I really wanted to find ways around its most cataclysmic flaw, but after so long trying I've got to conclude that I just can't.

The platforming, theming and level design are all interesting and fun. The music is awesome and memorable. Bosses, however, single-handedly put all that is good about the game to waste.

I certainly don't mind hard games, but too often it is artificial, particularly on the higher difficulty levels. To set the tone: Bosses generally kill you in 2-4 hits with spammy attacks that are very difficult to dodge, have a lot of health and provide VERY limited (and generally dangerous) vulnerability windows. Most of this is fine, though their health can get absurdly excessive at times and certain attacks have questionable hit boxes.

The problem is that some boss' attacks are decided by RNG and can become impossible (in the literal rather than exaggerating sense) to survive. If Gyalva wants to turn the arena into spikes forever and shoot you when you can't dodge, or if Istersiva wants to repeatedly spit out three laser-crystals until they fill the screen, there's genuinely no chance to win.

These are not controlled in any way; apparently the developers' idea of justifying this is the accessibility of the Retry button that appears when you die.

The need to compensate for often unavoidable damage means that, with rare exception on the highest difficulties, bosses become an aggravating marathon of perfection-demanding frustration that you would expect to see in a badly-balanced bullet hell. It is no small irony that the reliance on scripted attacks makes what is meant to be a tough final boss one of the easiest in the game.

The alternative is to spend an hour (again, not an exaggeration) before many bosses to grind a couple of levels extra, which dramatically reduces the damage you receive and makes them pitifully easy. To sum up the choices, you can beat your head against a wall or you can bore yourself to tears. Both options can only be considered anti-fun.

A far less critical issue is the controls: 3 buttons switch between and use magic, but there are only 3 different magics so they could have just got a button each. XInput support is lacking; controllers work but cannot be remapped. Xbox controllers access the menu with the right stick, while magic use (X) and jump (B) make life awkward as they are often needed together. There are also multiple complaints that jump button presses sometimes fail to register.

But this is a minor flaw compared to the boss problem, which could have been prevented. This is a Steam re-release of the original 2005 PC version. In 2010, the game received a PSP port which made a considerate reworking of bosses and provided a double-boost ability. None of that made it into the Steam release in 2012, and an otherwise great game suffers irredeemably for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043214842', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4638, 'last_played': 1560734522}
review:
By far one of the best games I've ever had the pleasure of playing.  And as a big fan of Ys in general, I consider this to be the best of the series.  As with the rest of the Ys series, the world is built wonderfully.  Every area in the game feels very unique and interesting.  Every character in the game also has their own name, portrait, and a bit of personal character to them, no matter how insignificant their role is.  I've always found this to be a wonderful attribute to the Ys series, and makes character interactions feel more intimate and special than what you get in many RPGs.

The gameplay is also top notch in Felghana.  Each area is laid out very well and presents a challenge to overcome.  The bosses are also incredibly well designed, and some of the best I've seen in any game.  Boss battles are fast-paced and challenging, and despite the high difficulty, everything feels completely fair.  Every single attack is avoidable through practice, skill, and reflexes, no matter how ridiculous they may seem at first, which is something I absolutely love to see in my games.  While I highly recommend playing on the highest difficulty for Ys games to really get your blood pumping, there are also several easier settings for more casual players who aren't as good at fast paced action games, offering something for everyone.

Graphically, the game looks great.  Despite being pretty old (original Japanese PC release in 2005), the visual design and artstyle were done very well.  The colors, lighting, animations, models, and so on all just look fantastic, and I feel they'll hold up well forever.  Falcom just did a great job there.

The music is wonderful too.  Falcom games always have top notch music, and Felghana is no different.  They really did a good job with the soundtrack.  Unfortunately, unlike the PSP release, the Steam release doesn't have the option to change to the alternate soundtracks from the PC88 or X68000 versions of Wanderers of Ys, but this is a minor complaint that shouldn't matter much except to enthusiasts of the sound from those old machines.  The Windows soundtrack is phenominal to be sure.

This game is just so good and I highly recommend it to anyone who likes fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119660771', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4938, 'last_played': 1676168576}
review:
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━


[h1]│𝐈𝐭'𝐬 𝐚𝐥𝐥 𝐟𝐮𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐠𝐚𝐦𝐞𝐬 𝐮𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐥 𝐚 𝐟𝐥𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐩𝐬 𝟗𝟎% 𝐨𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐇𝐏│[/h1]
 

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

[h1]+ ℙ𝕣𝕠𝕤[/h1]

[h1]◜𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐛𝐚𝐭◞[/h1]
Tight, fast, and fluid, it's makes for an extremely fun and satisfying game to play. The combat feels so fair, in fact, that it actually feels like it's my fault when I die. There is no dodge feature in the game, though, so you have to be careful. Additionally, as the game goes on, you will obtain 3 different abilities that you can use to assist you in battle. These abilities are: 

♦ Fireball ([i]ranged attack, possible combo extender[/i]) 
♦ Whirlwind Spin ([i]AoE attack, best DPS potential, slow recovery at the end[/i])
♦ Shield Bash ([i]okay DPS, grants invulnerability during use[/i])

Also, there is a Boost Mode that is super fucking good. Use it. A lot.


[h1]◜𝐒𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐲◞[/h1]
Was it the greatest story I have ever heard of? Not really. Was it entertaining? Hell yeah. My biggest gripe is that it utilizes the whole "[i]travel the land in search for the 7 Mystic Jewels[/i]" kinda vibe, but aside from that, it plays out extremely well.


[h1]◜𝐌𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐜◞[/h1]
While it's not the most memorable soundtrack, it does an excellent job at hyping up the player in a fight.


[h1]◜𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐅𝐫𝐞𝐞𝐝𝐨𝐦 𝐭𝐨 𝐏𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐃𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐲◞[/h1]
Just because it CAN be difficult doesn't mean that it HAS to. It even has a Very Easy option that can beaten by just about anybody, so just about anybody can enjoy it. Oh, and there's also the difficulty that steals your shoes and calls you gay, but only real men  ̶w̶h̶o̶ ̶h̶a̶t̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶m̶s̶e̶l̶v̶e̶s̶ play that one and stick with it. 


━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

[h1]- ℂ𝕠𝕟𝕤[/h1]

[h1]◜𝐋𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐔𝐩◞[/h1]
It's a chore... It will take several hours to max out your level even when grinding in the final area on the easiest difficulty. Quite literally.

There IS a cheat code to bypass this, however, and this cheat still allows you to obtain the achievement for reaching maximum level. On the condition that you beat the Boss Rush on the hardest difficulty, you can press F2 and you instantly go up a level in the Story Mode free of charge.

...it's more trouble than it's worth, though. 


[h1]◜𝐒𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐝𝐬/𝐀𝐫𝐦𝐨𝐫/𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐥𝐝𝐬◞[/h1]
If a boss is beating the ever-living crap out of you, your level may only be a part of the issue. Usually, it means that whatever you have equipped is currently garbage. Simply getting your hands on a slightly better sword can mean the difference of you hardly dealing any damage to suddenly dealing a good amount of damage. You can buy better equipment, but the game eventually reaches a point where you'll have to search dungeons for better equipment. If you can't find said equipment, then tough shit, you're gonna struggle even more. 


━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

[h1]? 𝕄𝕚𝕩𝕖𝕕 ?[/h1]

[h1]◜𝐁𝐨𝐬𝐬 𝐁𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐥𝐞𝐬◞[/h1]
The bosses in this game are super fun to go up against, yet at the same time they are absolute bullshit. The aspect of a 1-on-1 fight to the death is exilerating in any game, yet Ys does some things to add unto the stress. In addition to the inability to pause the game mid-fight, you [b]ᴄᴀɴ ɴᴏᴛ[/b] heal yourself. Whatever damage that you suffer from is there until the fight ends. 

There is also a huge difference in how the battles play out on different difficulties, and I don't simply mean the difference in damage dealt/recieved. Some bosses, as a result, are either harder to hit, have extra attacks, and/or their super-mega-ultra-buttfuck move is faster AND deals more damage. 

In short, be cautious, think of a strategy, and most of all, be patient. You have no idea how many times i have died just blindly rushing in for an attack.



[h1]◜𝐀𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬◞[/h1]
In terms of the time you'll need to spend and the skill that is required, they're hard as fuck to earn. However, it felt really really good once I finally got them all.


━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━



Overall Score: 8/10

review:
Ys is a fantastic series of action RPGs.  The 16bit graphics are great and really evoke a retro feel.  If you grew up on the Ys games, the nostalgia factor alone makes this worth playing.  If you didn't, you can rely on the smooth controls and great gameplay to satsify you.

If you like action RPGs and appreciate retro graphcis you can't go wrong with this game or Origins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152467105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1475964747}
review: Nothing else needs to be said about this game. It is a great game and one of the best in the Ys Series. I hope that The PSP and Vita installments will eventually come to Steam as well. This game is one of the most fun I've had with games in a long time. I have fully played this game all the way to the end and repeated playthroughs beating Nightmare mode. This of course is on the PSP version as I have played it to death. It is a fun experience that everyone should try. This is an action RPG that will remind many people of Zelda except with a heavier emphasize on combat. This game excels in the combat. It will appear basic at first but as you progress, you get more moves, magic and other abilities that will effect the way you play and approach fighting certain enemies. Bosses all test your ability to the fullest in memorizing patterns, utilizing your new magic, and waiting for the opportune moment to strike. The music like anything JDK Falcom composes is beyond words. Often times this soundtrack is regarded as the best in the series while I personally feel like Chronicles is the best for me. As for the story, the game is pretty basic with its plot however, it has a lot of world building for both the previous and newer installments. These are nods to those that have played the other games of the series and nothing major is revealed with these events. It is a self contained story like most of the series except Ys I+II Chronicles, so you don't need to play the previous games to understand the story. A few tips for those that will be playing this game for the first time. Note that this game is a lot harder than most entries in the series. Normal mode will be more difficult than you are used to. Do not be discouraged. As I had played other games in the series I thought that I would start in Hard Mode and got my ass kicked. You can beat it through trial and error and grinding until you can beat the boss, Other than that, I highly reccomend the game for its fast pace, fun combat and soundtrack. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198353635037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1488674184}
review: I like the interface alot, and the graphics and gameplay are very well done. It's definitely a lot of fun to be able to run around and play. The bosses, however, are a huge drawback. I have no idea what they were thinking when designing them, but they are probably the most anti-fun, redundant and repetitive bosses I've ever played against since the original Nintendo. They aren't difficult to fight against, but they always have some stupid gimick to work around, like having a shield you have to wait out, or literally spending 90% of the fight outside of the map shooting at you from where you can't even fight back. Another massive drawback to the boss fights is how often you can count on getting hit by an attack that has clearly missed, or getting hit by an attack even after its animation has ended. I wish it were as simple as "git gud", but you're fighting against the game's design more than you are actual the actual bosses, in battles. Ys Origin is much better, I'd recommend that one over Felghana.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201837847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1479425845}
